story:
What is E.D.D.I.E all about? 

What's more important to a robot? Winning a human lady's heart, or finding his lost energy cord? 

E.D.D.I.E is the first GP project by young trans-masculine artist Felix Morales. It takes place in an electronic-fairy tale, where people run their busyness thanks to cyborgs with human bodies and Electrodomestic heads called Electro-Heads. Living in the Electro-suburbs is Eddie, a computer-boy, who's lost his circuits to his user, a kind and good-looking doctor in a kid's hospital; and Mac, his best buddy with a Boombox-Head who tends to mess things up the 80's way. 



When Eddie has gathered enough confidence to confess to the girl, his energy cord has been stolen and he must find the way to stay with her and not die in the process.

This fully colored story is meant to be published on paper. But first we need to finish it! 

How can I help this guy?

The Author of the story, Felix, is in a situation much like E.D.D.I.E's. He's thorn in two between financing the making of the comic, or saving money to afford his transition (FtM). 

The money would strictly go to finance Felix' transition, so he can get that weight off his back and be able to finish the project, after which he'll promptly find someone to publish it so you can read it on paper.

Changing his name legally, finishing E.D.D.I.E in color, and traveling (Either to San Diego Comicon or another convention) to find a publisher will be the targets of the funding. 

THE PERKS:

$1 - A big thank you on the official page that'll be created for the GN after the making.

$5- A big thank you, and a Cubee Craft of M.A.C that you can print and fold.


$10 All previous perks, and a PDF copy of finished E.D.D.I.E

$15 All previous perks, and one of two Bookmarks with one of the characters sent straight to your house.

$20 All previous perks, and the TWO Bookmarks.

$30 All previous perks, and one of the two posters sent home!

$40 All previous and the TWO posters sent home!

$50 All previous perks and Custom Art! 4 x 7 cm Watercolor of whatever you'd like!

$100 All previous perks and a Original E.D.D.I.E rough comic page signed by the artist and sent with eternal love.

There are also Fully Cleaned-Up pages of E.D.D.I.E, but only 20 of them! This is a special perk for anyone that will help the project with over $500

The Creator and his Creation. 


                   

Felix Morales, as previously mentioned, is a transexual man. The only transman in the illustration media in México actually. Not because he's the only transman in México with a artistic talent, but because he's the only one holding on to make a living out of it. Life as an artist is hard enough, but as a transexual individual, most people say 'bye' to their dream jobs to afford transition in other less than happy ways. 

E.D.D.I.E is Felix's reaching hand to that dream. A dream in which transitioning doesn't mean leaving his career out. A dream in which he's a healthy grown-up making stories for everyone to read and learn from diversity and adventure.

If E.D.D.I.E is finished and published, it wont only be an example for all people with adversities to keep fighting and having hope in those who help them, but will also mean Felix would have achieved the first goal to keep publishing storied that will make such examples.  

True, E.D.D.I.E is not the best example of an LGBT centered story, being a straight romance and all. But it will open Felix's art to a bigger audience that will later know of more personal projects with meaningful messages to gay/transexual rights. 

FIRST 3 PAGES: 
    

                                                          
  

PAGE 5:
 

Page 12:



Can't contribute with Money? Spread the word! 

Not everyone has money to spare, that's true. But if the internet is good for something, that's for spreading things.

TUMBLR, Facebook, Blogspot, Art Blogs, Journal entries, Deviantart, LGBT communities, Comic Forums... Whatever site is of your choice, you'd be making the difference by letting people know of this project and the artist :) 

FOR MORE INFORMATION YOU CAN GO TO: 

E.D.D.I.E's FACEBOOK! Official page to the Graphic Novel, updates, etc... 
Felix's Blogspot! Where you can see art, WIPs, and comments on everyday life!
Felix's Youtube Channel! If you're interested in transition videos. (Spanish only!)
Felix's Deviantart Gallery! Where you can find most of his finished pieces among short comics and traditional art.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN IS FOR BOOK THREE   

ALL BOOKS GIANT SIZED 11"x 11"!!

(book 1 & 2 also offered)

Blast off and explore a wild and wacky galaxy with Alex and Maddison, who discover their Navy Veteran grandfather was a space explorer in his youth. Marooned decades in the past and across the vast cosmos, the kids and their young grandfather must fight against ravenous creatures and sinister aliens while searching for powerful elements that will lead them home.

TELL ME A STORY...

A UFO bursts into flames; struck by lightening over the  American southwest. The military arrives at the flaming wreck and the craft disappears into a fortified secret hangar. Years later three craft emerge; created from the salvaged parts; the Nebula, the Aurora and the Comet. Sent into deep space, two of the craft go missing except for the Comet. Seventy years later, two kids find a secret garage and discover their late grandfather was a space explorer for the Navy. He was known as "Skipper"; pilot in command of the Comet. Through a mysterious device, the kids are hurtled across time and space. They team with their young grandfather and begin a romp through the galaxy searching for powerful elements that will lead the kids home. Along the way, they find out more about the honorable man who they only knew as "grandpa". Battling through vengeful aliens, ferocious creatures and maniacal robots, the family must unlock the secret of the Omingate; the means to manipulate time and space. And they better hurry, a dangerous enemy from their grandfather's past is bent on destroying them and seizing control of the most powerful object in the universe! 

 

WHAT'S BETWEEN THE LINES

The Galactic Comet is an over the top, exciting kids storybook, perfect for bedtime or to just disappear into the galaxy for a while. The story promotes family values; highlighting the respect for elders and taking an interest in their wealth of knowledge and experience. For a child, holding a book and delving into the adventure within is a great imaginative and tactile exercise. That connection is priceless. With this story it's my hope to help strengthen family bonds and inspire children's imaginations.

Every Indiegogo Backer Receives a

Certificate of Authenticity

Every Indiegogo Backer's First Name and Last Initial Printed in All Books

About the Author and the Storybook

I’m a family man of over twenty years and the father of two children. I’ve spent over two decades in product development/marketing and sales. I’m an artist with nearly thirty years’ experience in animation, special effects, 3D design and dubious voice-over work. I enjoy the creative process and developing projects to their completion.

When my Navy veteran grandfather reached the last years of his life, I visited with him and learned more about his incredible life. After he passed, I created a eulogy and poured over 94 years of his life in pictures. It was amazing. Sometimes we don't get to say goodbye to the ones we love, but the time you spent with them is invaluable. Though a kids science fiction fantasy storybook, The Galactic Comet is a tale of two kids learning about their grandfather in ways they never knew and appreciating the man that he is. There's so much more to the people close to us if we only take the time to listen.

Joining in this endeavor allows independent creators to produce art in true free-form. Devoid from corporate thinking and massively funded agendas, stories here can be told with passion and energy. It’s truly exciting when people can come together and be a part of creating something fresh and exciting.

I have operated as a brand executive for over twenty years and have managed the process of many specialized manufacturing supply chains. I bring experience, speed and a successful track record in creative development and production.

Book ONE and TWO of The Galactic are a success and enjoyed by many; we look forward to fantastic things with Book THREE!

What We Need & What You Get

There is a target goal of $300 to complete the THIRD Galactic Comet storybook, part THREE of a four part series. The largest portion of the cost is the printing, binding and shipping of the books to investors. Funding will complete Book THREE and it will be shipped in 3rd Quarter 2020. Other funds are needed for hardware and software upgrades to handle the complexities of 3D rendering.

story:
Thank you to those who backed my campaign!

Unfortunately my campaign didn't hit the minimum amount of money to be successful and my backers should have been refunded by Indiegogo now. If you'd still like to receive any of the great comics that were on the campaign, please visit www.underglowcomics.com , where you'll find all the same items that were on this Indiegogo campaign, plus loads of extras!

Kind regards,

Gary Parkin

Underglow Comics

 

Since my Underglow Comics publishing company launched in September 2020,  I've published 9 comic books, including issues of Vampocalypse and Jungle Captive, with many more titles on the way. I am the writer, artist and colorist on all of my titles, occasionally also featuring guest cover artists. I also publish my Model Behavior stories as webcomics on my Patreon page, where I have produced an issue each month since its initial release there in May 2021.

Primarily these comic books have been sold through Kickstarter campaigns, where they have been extremely successful, especially Jungle Captive. And while I have run an Indiegogo campaign before, at the end of last year, I was still relatively new to the platform, and to be honest I didn't really know what I was doing! Now, after selling in the region of 10,000 comics, I'm more than ready for any future challenges, and I want to share my little comics universe with the Indiegogo audience.

I've selected the first issues of my three titles Vampocalypse, Jungle Captive and Model Behavior for this Indiegogo campaign, so you can all get an idea of what my titles are like. I'll probably launch a similar Indiegogo campaign in a couple of months for my second issues.

When Lauren wakes up in a jungle with no idea of how she got there, she has to figure out a number of things, including whether or not she can outrun a dinosaur! Written and drawn by Gary Parkin.

Adults only.

52 pages, full color.

There are 8 covers available, including a Nude cover (F), a fully black and white edition (G), and a Blank Variant (H) which contains the full comic, plus an extra outer blank cover.

Here are a few of the interior pages:

The first full Underglow Comics comic book! When the President of the United States orders a worldwide cull of 93% of the human population, a tribe of vampire women step in to take matters into their own hands!

28 pages, full color.

There are 6 covers available, including a Negative Space Variant (E) Nude cover (F), a fully black and white edition (C), and a Blank Variant (D) which contains the full comic, plus an extra outer blank cover.

Here are a few of the interior pages:

When models go to photoshoots do you think they only talk about which angle to best photograph them from all day? Of course not! This series delves into the lives of a series of girls who share the most intimate details of their lives with their photographer. Each one has their own story... some funny, some sad, and some just plain weird, but all very entertaining!

Presented in a stylish Red, Black and White art style reminiscent of Pop Art but still retaining a modern edge, Model Behavior #1 is a massive beast of a comic book that you won't be able to put down!

Adults only.

72 pages, full color.

There are 8 covers available, including Richard Morgan (C) and Mark Lawrence (D) variants, Jess Skellington photo covers (E and F), a Blank Variant (G) which contains the full comic, plus an extra outer blank cover, and the very popular Nude cover H by Gary Parkin and Chris Hall.

Here are a few of the interior pages:

With most of my comics I produce a blank variant, which allows me to draw head sketches and topless sketches for you all!

Jungle Captive sketch covers:

Vampocalypse sketch covers:

Model Behavior sketch covers:

Don't want to pay for shipping? You can buy these comics as PDFs, and have them emailed to you after the campaign! The Model Behavior PDF is 100 pages, and includes 28 pages of bonus material not found in the regular comic.

Gary Parkin has been publishing his own comics since the age of 14, when he used to draw stories about superheroes and fluffy animals, and photocopy the comics in his dad's office, before selling them through the back of comics magazines. Since then he's had a long career producing advertising artwork, storyboards, and commissions of sci-fi characters. During the coronavirus lockdown of 2020 he was temporarily furloughed from his day job, and used the time to start creating full-color comics for the first time. He has since been able to quit his job to become a full-time comic artist and publisher. In the last 12 months he has written and drawn over a dozen full-length comics, as well as drawing variant covers for BAD Press Comics, Totally Rad Comics and The NextArt Verlag.

Shipping is a standard rate, no matter how many comics you buy.

UK shipping (because that's where I'm based) is £3.00.

International shipping to anywhere else in the world is £7.00.

 

Risks & Challenges

The comics are all written and drawn, and this Indiegogo campaign is to enable me to print a new print run of the three comics. Once the money comes in, the comics will be printed and sent out to you within 3 weeks. I have a small team of people who help me fulfill my orders, and it's a very smooth, quick process these days. PDFs will be with you within 48 hours of payment being received by me.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to back my project, please share it with like-minded people who may be interested. :)

story:
UPDATE

We have now increased the goal to £2,500 to help go toward funding issue 4 as well as the current efforts on issue 3 so come on people, help us push our goal even further, any amount is welcome and every contributor will receive a reward.

Short Summary

The All Knightz:

  • We are a group of independent artists from London consisting of writers, graphic artists and animators with a big passion for comics.



  • Hard Wired Revolution is a comic book story that has been written like a political thriller with elements of science fiction and aimed at anyone from the age of 10 years and above.

       


In the year 2089 Africa has become to new super power after a mutant outbreak which happened years before leaving most of planet earth in ruins.  
Because of this everyone now wants to live in one of the two places still left standing, Russia or Africa.  Because of the rich amount of natural resources most people chose Africa but this leaves Africa open to over population, tribal conflict, corruption and crime.  A notorious gun runner by the name of "Siege" is extremely passionate about the well being of Africa so with his state of the art sophisticated weapons and the support of his new allies the Naija Congo Army (NCA)  he enforces his own dominance by protecting the borders of Africa by a force of arms so no one he deems an outsider can get in.  


The Naija Congo Army (NCA) have their agenda too.  Funded by numerous rich organizations and unbeknownst to Siege the NCA want to test out a new form of technology on the African population called the "Hard Wired" chip. This chip would help to keep track of and monitor every citizen of Africa but this is only the initial cover story. The chip also has a defect.  

The chip reacts to different types of bodies in three various ways, one is making the host paralyzed and can even cause death but the other rare reaction is giving the host super abilities that enhance their potential which ultimately gives them super powers. Many people don't agree with this chip but in this new world very few can stop it and the theory needs to be tested on somebody.

Siege is unaware of this plot by the NCA but the NCA are also unaware like many others that Siege is a high end gun runner on the top of the gun running business only because of his very unique weapons which were given to him by the very same aliens called the poraxians who visited earth before.  

With a plot line full of deception and twists along with action, aliens, science fiction and more, Hard Wired Revolution will be kicking into its third episode.

     


  • By supporting this project you will be helping us to deliver the finished product more efficiently so we can print up enough comics and distribute to independent book stores and comic stores alike (maybe even a store near you).  We have already put our own money towards getting top quality artwork from different artists involved in the project but with your help we can use what you give to print up a generous amount that we know we can sell at comic conventions, online and in stores.

What We Need & What You Get


  • We are seeking to raise £1500 in total to print up copies of this particular comic, this will include the price of shipping.
  • Every backer that gives £5 or more will receive something in return ranging from wallpapers for your phone or computer to posters and comics that we have made and of course issue 3.
  • We are determined, and even if we do not reach our goal we will still put all of what we receive to printing the comic as we have already proven to everyone including ourselves that we love what we do and you only need to see issue 1 and 2 to see this.

The Impact


  • When we first started this project we focused on characters we didn't see much of as children, black characters, women characters, & characters with actual believable back stories. Before you know it we had lots of other people telling us what they would like to see in a comic book character themselves so we are using this to not only fulfill our own dreams but the dreams of others who support us.
  • We've never done a crowd funding project before as we are used to just saving up our own money from our day jobs to pay for everything but due to other expenses like the price of comic conventions, artists and other things related to comics we decided to ask for a little help from our existing supporters as well as new ones who like independent comic work.
  • We are very approachable and you can even meet us in person at places like Greenwich market where we trade every week from Tuesday to Friday.  We actually like meeting new people face to face and while we would love to get your financial support we would love to see you in person too so you can see exactly what it is that we do.

Risks & Challenges

We have made sure that all of the possible risks are covered such as printing issues which is the only thing that could go wrong at the moment and the possibility of changing the artist we use.  We have more than one printer in mind to use if we are unable to use the one planned and we also have other artists on stand by as well as ourselves who can still deliver and good product (see issue 1 and 2 for examples)

We also have made sure that we've written up enough material to keep this going with this story continuously for years to come, currently we have written 30 issues in total.  Everything has been done ahead of time so no matter how it turns out this will be a success that we will release anytime between January and March.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • We made sure that we made the video as cool and concise as possible so even if you can't contribute please share this around, subscribe to us on you tube, join our mailing list and let everyone know that Hard Wired issue 3 is coming.
  • Also do not forget to share this on facebook, twitter, instagram and every other social networking site you can think of as we are on all of them just google the the name "all Knightz" or visit us at www.allknightz.com
story_txt:
UPDATE
We have now increased the goal to £2,500 to help go toward funding issue 4 as well as the current efforts on issue 3 so come on people, help us push our goal even further, any amount is welcome and every contributor will receive a reward.
Short Summary The All Knightz:  We are a group of independent artists from London consisting of writers, graphic artists and animators with a big passion for comics.






 Hard Wired Revolution is a comic book story that has been written like a political thriller with elements of science fiction and aimed at anyone from the age of 10 years and above.


       


In the year 2089 Africa has become to new super power after a mutant outbreak which happened years before leaving most of planet earth in ruins.  
Because of this everyone now wants to live in one of the two places still left standing, Russia or Africa.  Because of the rich amount of natural resources most people chose Africa but this leaves Africa open to over population, tribal conflict, corruption and crime.  A notorious gun runner by the name of "Siege" is extremely passionate about the well being of Africa so with his state of the art sophisticated weapons and the support of his new allies the Naija Congo Army (NCA)  he enforces his own dominance by protecting the borders of Africa by a force of arms so no one he deems an outsider can get in.  




The Naija Congo Army (NCA) have their agenda too.  Funded by numerous rich organizations and unbeknownst to Siege the NCA want to test out a new form of technology on the African population called the "Hard Wired" chip. This chip would help to keep track of and monitor every citizen of Africa but this is only the initial cover story. The chip also has a defect.  

The chip reacts to different types of bodies in three various ways, one is making the host paralyzed and can even cause death but the other rare reaction is giving the host super abilities that enhance their potential which ultimately gives them super powers. Many people don't agree with this chip but in this new world very few can stop it and the theory needs to be tested on somebody.

Siege is unaware of this plot by the NCA but the NCA are also unaware like many others that Siege is a high end gun runner on the top of the gun running business only because of his very unique weapons which were given to him by the very same aliens called the poraxians who visited earth before.  

With a plot line full of deception and twists along with action, aliens, science fiction and more, Hard Wired Revolution will be kicking into its third episode.

     


 By supporting this project you will be helping us to deliver the finished product more efficiently so we can print up enough comics and distribute to independent book stores and comic stores alike (maybe even a store near you).  We have already put our own money towards getting top quality artwork from different artists involved in the project but with your help we can use what you give to print up a generous amount that we know we can sell at comic conventions, online and in stores.
   What We Need & What You Get   We are seeking to raise £1500 in total to print up copies of this particular comic, this will include the price of shipping. Every backer that gives £5 or more will receive something in return ranging from wallpapers for your phone or computer to posters and comics that we have made and of course issue 3. We are determined, and even if we do not reach our goal we will still put all of what we receive to printing the comic as we have already proven to everyone including ourselves that we love what we do and you only need to see issue 1 and 2 to see this.    The Impact   When we first started this project we focused on characters we didn't see much of as children, black characters, women characters, & characters with actual believable back stories. Before you know it we had lots of other people telling us what they would like to see in a comic book character themselves so we are using this to not only fulfill our own dreams but the dreams of others who support us. We've never done a crowd funding project before as we are used to just saving up our own money from our day jobs to pay for everything but due to other expenses like the price of comic conventions, artists and other things related to comics we decided to ask for a little help from our existing supporters as well as new ones who like independent comic work. We are very approachable and you can even meet us in person at places like Greenwich market where we trade every week from Tuesday to Friday.  We actually like meeting new people face to face and while we would love to get your financial support we would love to see you in person too so you can see exactly what it is that we do.    Risks & Challenges We have made sure that all of the possible risks are covered such as printing issues which is the only thing that could go wrong at the moment and the possibility of changing the artist we use.  We have more than one printer in mind to use if we are unable to use the one planned and we also have other artists on stand by as well as ourselves who can still deliver and good product (see issue 1 and 2 for examples)
We also have made sure that we've written up enough material to keep this going with this story continuously for years to come, currently we have written 30 issues in total.  Everything has been done ahead of time so no matter how it turns out this will be a success that we will release anytime between January and March.   Other Ways You Can Help
  We made sure that we made the video as cool and concise as possible so even if you can't contribute please share this around, subscribe to us on you tube, join our mailing list and let everyone know that Hard Wired issue 3 is coming. Also do not forget to share this on facebook, twitter, instagram and every other social networking site you can think of as we are on all of them just google the the name "all Knightz" or visit us at www.allknightz.com

story:
Mit unserer Graphic Novel Hemispheres projizieren wir das gegenwärtige Abbild unserer Gesellschaft in die nahe Zukunft des Jahres 2027, um auf grundlegende Chancen und Probleme verschiedener Lebenswelten des Menschen in Vergangenheit, Gegenwart und Zukunft aufmerksam zu machen. Das ist die Vision unserer Graphic Novel. 

HEMISPHERES 'Corpus Separatum' ist der erste von drei Bänden, geschrieben von Christopher De La Garza, gezeichnet von Sascha Grusche mit Concept Art & Design von Simon Pape.

Wir benötigen 5.000€ um in folgende Posten zu investieren:

  • 2.000 € decken die Miete für das Orange Lab in Berlin ab
  • 1.000 € decken die Kosten für das Programm vom 03. bis 18. Oktober ab
  • 1.000 € decken die Kosten für die Produktion des Doku-Films ab
  • 1.000 € decken die Kosten für die Produktion der Exponate ab

DIE LOCATION. Raum für neues Denken - Schnittstelle zur Öffentlichkeit: das ORANGE LAB in Berlin. Schon immer ein Ort für Innovationen: was in den 60er Jahren der Serversaal von IBM war, ist 2013 ein Ort für neues Denken, Diskurs und Disput. Das ORANGE LAB ist eine Schnittstelle zur Öffentlichkeit – sowohl im architektonischen als auch im inhaltlichen Sinne. 


Zum Artikel: Science-Fiction-Comicprojekt "Hemispheres"




Zum Artikel: Der Mönch und die Sprayerin                                                                Weitere Artikel: Eine Welt voller Gier und Egoismus



Bürgerlicher Name: David (hebr.: geliebter Gottes) Shakara (pidgin English: Angeben) Buddhistischer Name: Dvarakadisha (sanskr.: Herr der Tore) Dasa (sanskr.: Diener, Sklave, Devote/Anhänger) - sieht sich gezwungen aus der friedlichen Abgeschiedenheit seines Klosters zurück in seine verhasste Heimat Hierosolyma zurückzukehren. Dort trifft er auf eine Gesellschaft, die dem Untergang geweiht scheint.


Selah (hebr. innehalten und nachdenken) Ray (en. Lichtstrahl) - ist eine junge provokante Streetart-Aktivistin, die mit ihrer Kunst bei den Menschen Bewusstsein für die bestehenden Probleme in der Stadt und in der Gesellschaft schaffen will.

Isaac (hebr. Gott lächelt) - ist ein ehemaliger Polizist und Kollege Davids. Seit einem Arbeitsunfall ist er an den Rollstuhl gefesselt und fristet, vom Staat im Stich gelassen, sein Dasein außerhalb der Gesellschaft - geprägt von Enttäuschung und Resignation.



JETZT UNTERSTÜTZEN UND DAS BUCH VORBESTELLEN!

JETZT UNTERSTÜTZEN UND DAS BUCH VORBESTELLEN!

JETZT UNTERSTÜTZEN UND DAS BUCH VORBESTELLEN!

JETZT UNTERSTÜTZEN UND DAS BUCH VORBESTELLEN!

JETZT UNTERSTÜTZEN UND DAS BUCH VORBESTELLEN!

JETZT UNTERSTÜTZEN UND DAS BUCH VORBESTELLEN!

Christopher De La Garza, im Februar 1988 geboren, schrieb schon früh Aphorismen, Kurzgeschichten und Essays über philosophische und gesellschaftskritische Szenarien. Begonnen mit der Vision einen Roman in Buchform über eine Gesellschaft an einem fiktiven Ort in der Zukunft zu schreiben, an dem die Menschen nur noch Symptome bekämpfen statt die Ursachen der Probleme zu erkennen, entwickelte sich die anfangs rein dystopische Geschichte mithilfe von Sascha Grusche, geboren im März 1986 zu einer bebilderten Geschichte. Text und Bild, Dystopie und Utopie vereint in einer Graphic Novel. Sascha, Physiker und Künstler lebt, arbeitet und promoviert in Weingarten, illustriert und gestaltet die Geschichte und das Konzept maßgeblich mit. Seine wissenschaftlichen Erfindungen, welche in der Graphic Novel ebenfalls Einzug halten und sein Hintergrundwissen über klassische Kunst verstärken die kontrastreiche Welt von Hemispheres inhaltlich und visuell um ein vielfaches. Simon Pape, geboren im Dezember 1987, Graffiti Fine Artist, Illustrator und Designer entwickelte ursprünglich die Graffiti-Motive, welche von der jungen Streetart Aktivistin und Protagonistin Selah Ray innerhalb der Graphic Novel gesprüht werden sollten. Mittlerweile ist er seit August 2013 ein Teil des Hemispheres-Teams und als Concept Artist und Designer maßgeblich an der Gestaltung der Welt von Hemispheres beteiligt. 


Bei HEMISPHERES prallt die spirituelle Abgeschiedenheit eines buddhistischen Klosters auf das materialistische Chaos einer Megastadt. Wir verbinden moderne Wissenschaft mit klassischer Kunst, um den Betrachter zum Nachdenken über unser gegenwärtiges, gesellschaftliches Leben anzuregen. Wir wollen einen tieferen Diskurs anstoßen, der sich durch viele Ebenen unseres Lebens zieht - ökologisch, ökonomisch und sozial. Bei unseren Lesern soll die Frage entstehen, welche Veränderungen schon heute notwendig sind, bevor es für einen Wandel zu spät ist. Dazu schaffen wir mit unseren Veranstaltungen interdisziplinäre Ideen- und Projekträume, verbinden Menschen miteinander und entwickeln dabei gezielt Inhalte und mögliche Lösungsansätze für die gesellschaftlichen und globalen Herausforderungen des 21. Jahrhunderts.

Die Geschichte von HEMISPHERES erzählt die utopisch/dystopische Trilogie von einer scheinbar aufstrebenden Gesellschaft in der fiktiven Stadt Hierosolyma (gr. hieros "heilig", lat. solum "Land", hebr. Yerushaláyim), welche mitten in der Phase ihres moralischen und physischen Verfalls steckt.

Das erste Kapitel der Graphic Novel heißt CORPUS SEPARATUM. Der Mönch Dvarakadisha Dasa begibt sich in die Stadt um seinem erkrankten Mönchsbruder ein dringend benötigtes Medikament zu beschaffen.

Hierosolyma ist eine hektische Megacity, laut und überfüllt - irgendwo in Südostasien. Viele Dinge haben sich verändert seitdem David seine Heimat verlassen hat und sie ändert sich umso schneller im Sekundentakt und dem Puls der Gesellschaft. Höher, schneller, weiter - das ist alles erst der Anfang.

story:
Who are Angel Lite Comics?

David Rothschiller, founder of Angel Lite Comics is a devout Christian and avid fan of comics. He has a vision for a grand universe of Angels, Demons, Saints, and Heroines that he believes will not only entertain readers from all walks of life, but also be a blessing to them, and glorify God.

Gerry Lee is a self published Christian comic book writer and has partnered with David because he believes that David's stories are exciting, inspirational, and worthy to be told.

Now, two writers can dream up a lot of stories, but let's face facts, comic book fans are looking for beautiful artwork as well as epic tales. This is why we have come to you, humbly asking for your assistance.

We have been most blessed in meeting several wonderfully talented artists willing to work on David's stories as volunteers, or for pocket change a page. This is not only a wonderful testimony of Christian fellowship, it's also the artists vote of confidence in Angel Lite Comics stories. They believe in the stories God gives to David.

We at Angel Lite Comics are very grateful for the support we've received from our artists. But as the Bible says, 'the workman is worthy of his/her pay'. We are asking you, dear readers, to contribute what you can so we can give some small financial compensation to our wonderful artists, and also pay something for future art to continue bringing David's stories to life.

You will not only be helping David and Gerry grow a brand new and much needed Christian comic company, you will be primarily contributing to the artists who we believe in and love, and who have given so much to us already!

What We've Done so Far

Thus far, within the span of a year, Angel Lite has begun one series, "A Knight that no one Forgets", with a self published printed 24 page book. Part 2 is due to be completed in May-June of 2014, and will be merged with part I to make a beautiful 48 page graphic novel. 

Rather than print individual comic books, we believe in a 'snowball' philosophy towards graphic novels. While an 8 1/2" X 11 graphic novel 24 pages long is considerably more expensive than a 24 page comic book to produce, as we add new episodes and sections, the cost per page to print is mere pennies. In time, the graphic novels will be a better buy than multiple comic book issues.

Here is the cover of our first book, art by the critically acclaimed web comic artist of "Violent Blue", Matthew Skelly.

Gerard Lee and veteran small press comic creatorLarry Blake have been working for several years on a Christian themed comedy/adventure story titled 'The New Sons of Thunder' The 126 page 1st volume is complete and future stories are in the works.

Currently in the works are a 75+ page graphic novel of Angel Lite Comics star heroine CometGirl, and the origin stories of two very different heroes: The Crimson Knight and the Servant Warrior.

CometGirl

The Crimson Knight

The Servant Warrior

Please help us with your contributions so we can gain the momentum we need to begin generating income to pay our artists and establish this Christian comic company!

Our Humble Perks and a Plea

As writers, it's difficult for David and Gerard to offer the usual comic book incentives for your donation. Such things are generally art work related merchandise and special edition books.

Here is what we will offer. For your Donation of just $1, we will put your name on the official Angel Lite Website for the year of 2015 with our thanks! (Which is at www.angellitecomics.com by the way)

For your donation of $5 we will send to your email address the pdf file of both "A Knight that no one Forgets", the as yet unpublished "Angel Lite Comics Annual 2014", and the link to the pdf of 'The New Sons of Thunder' graphic novel. As a note, The 'Annual 2014' contains the beginnings of 'The Origins of the Crimson Knight' story and "The Ballad", the beginning of the tale of the Servant Warrior and his companions Spirit and Keenan.

We know times are hard, and that there are very many worthy causes competing for your hard earned money. Your donations of any amount are most welcome! Things being as they are, we cannot offer more in perks at this time, we are hoping you will share our vision for an independent Christian comic book company dedicated to bringing God's blessings to their readers.

More than your assistance financially, we'd appreciate you letting friends know about this IndieGoGo crowd funder if you would. And even more than these precious gifts from you, we would appreciate your prayers. Because we believe your prayers, that you, yourselves, matter to God:) That is really why we are trying to publish these stories in the end.

story:
Hello there viewers.  My name is Sam Limberger.  I created a webcomic called "Let's Ask Violet".  Let's Ask Violet is an advice webcomic and blog that I created to, well, give advice to those who ask.  I'll answer any question, listen to any problem, or just be a shoulder to cry on if that's what you need.  
However, I have a little bit of a problem.  What problem you may ask?  Well, my computer is a little bit on the old side.  To the point where I'm afraid it's going to crap out on me at any given moment.  And if that happens, then there's no more comic.  No more comic, no more helping people with advice.  No more helping people with advice...well then I'd be out of a job.  And unfortunately, that's the problem.  You see, my computer does everything right now.  Meaning that on top of the computer I need, I also need to update my programs for the new one.  That's why I'm turning to you guys, the fans of Let's Ask Violet. And don't think I won't reward you guys for doing this.  
If you guys donate $1, I'll put your name under the "Sponsored By" tab on the website.  Because without a computer, there's no site.
If you donate $10, I'll draw you a fully coloured headshot print of up to 2 characters.  They can be any character, as long as the picture remains safe for work.  No pornography will be drawn here my friends.  You're just gonna have to go to 4chan for that.
If you donate $30, you can ask a question, ANY question, and it will automatically be queued for the next comic.  Mind you, storyline comics take priority, but the next comic after the storyline is done will be your questions.  You just have to email them to me after I see that money has been donated.
If you donate $50 or more, you get a signed copy of an original draft of a comic strip.  These are going to be photocopies, so just in case someone else wants the same strip, it's available. 
And the best part is, the more money you donate, the more perks you get.  So if you donate $50, not only do you get the signed copy of the draft, but you also get a question in the comic, a original print, AND your name goes on the website! 

And even if you can't donate, that's ok.  Just send out the word to as many people as you can so at least it's known.  
So please help me so I can continue to help you guys.  I really do love giving advice to you guys and I want to be able to continue to help you and entertain you with my comic.  

(all questions for the perk should be emailed to askviolet@letsaskviolet.com)
story_txt:

And even if you can't donate, that's ok.  Just send out the word to as many people as you can so at least it's known.  So please help me so I can continue to help you guys.  I really do love giving advice to you guys and I want to be able to continue to help you and entertain you with my comic.

story:
What is Ship Jumper?

Ship Jumper is a free, online, +18 homoerotic webcomic starring Piper, an enthusiastic sailor in the navy of his country of Clochette. They are at war with the country of Lymeswold, and after their ship is destroyed in a battle, Piper and his Captain, Ellis, find themselves stranded on a seemingly deserted island. Besides having to fight for their survival, Piper soon discovers that the island is full of strange and mysterious creatures, as well as an unexpected fellow survivor from the wreck with a particular interest in him...

Piper- post wreck

The Book-

I’m hoping to utilize Indiegogo as a pre-ordering system for the Ship Jumper book! When I started this comic I always envisioned it as a physical book in the end. I like owning comics and reading something that’s tangible in my hands. I currently generate no revenue off of Ship Jumper. I’m doing it 100% for the LOVE baby~ Reaching this funding goal will allow me to print a high quality run of the comic which I hope to debut at the MOCCA festival in NYC this April.

Okay, so just how rad is this book going to be?

Super rad! This book will include both Volumes One and Two of Ship Jumper combined into one 110 page ‘omnibus’ edition! That’s 110 full color pages!
It will be printed on matte coated 85 lb paper in color for the interior pages and have a luxurious matte finish 10pt cover. So a really nice, high quality book on par with trade paperbacks you’d find at your local comic store.


But OF COURSE there will also be fabulous book-only extras!

The extras-

     -A reworked and COMPLETELY re-colored Volume One!
As you may have noticed on the comic site, many of the Volume One pages posted now are not the originals but have some tweaked and updated art. Volume One will continue to be available in B&W online, but it will be presented with more redrawn art and in color ONLY in the print edition. Check out the example before & after panels below~

Old art vs New art

     -Extended scenes!
Two scenes, one from Volume One and one from Volume Two have an additional page added! Both extended scenes are rated +18 and will never appear online.

     -A 10 page BONUS comic!
10 pages of pure silly, sexy, fluff featuring our three heroes- Piper, Ellis and Rhinston. This +18 bonus comic will ONLY be available in the book and will never appear online.
I don’t want to give too much away, but here's one of the sketches~

     -Extra sketches, scripts from 2 short cut scenes that didn’t quite make it into Volume 1 or 2, plus some behind the scenes work in progress thumbnails and pictures.

The Rewards-

Pledge of $20- Book level
-This is the basic level which will get you a copy of the book in all its glory!
(please add $5 for shipping outside of the US)

Pledge of $35- Bonus level
-This will get you the book signed and with a sketch on the inside cover! Also includes a pre-order only bookmark.

Pledge of $50- Special Edition level
-This level includes the book, signed and with a sketch, in a special edition slipcover jacket featuring new art AND your name (or prefered handle) printed in the book in the ‘Special Thanks’ section! This is a pre-order only special edition and will not be available after this phase is finished.

Pledge of $75- Plushie Edition level
-This includes everything from all the other levels PLUS a hand made by me Piper Plushie! I’m really excited about this one and I’ve been wanting to make it for awhile. Utilizing the amazing printers over at Spoonflower, I’ll have custom designed and printed fabric created that I can then turn into chibi Piper sized pillow you can cuddle!

Pledge of $100- Super Special Edition level
-This includes everything from all the other levels PLUS a high quality, 8x10 giclee print of a new full color painted Ship Jumper piece I am currently creating.

Pledge of $150- Custom Edition level
-This includes everything from all the other levels PLUS an original, custom illustration!

If you bought the old Volume One-

Thank you so much for the help when I was first starting out! Message me and I will bump you up to the next reward level for free as a thank you!

 

Thank you so much for your time and interest in my comic! This project means the world to me and I’m looking forward to moving into the future and being able to meet people at conventions! Please ask me any questions you may have!
Le Captain~

Website
http://shipjumpercomic.com/
Twitter
@Valmontgod

story:
The Monstrosity Cover, by James Edward Clark!

THIS JUST IN! AN ORIGINAL MICHAEL WALSH (IDW'S The X-Files) AND ADAM GORHAM (BSC's TEUTON) MONSTER MASH-UP HAS JUST BEEN ADDED TO THE REWARDS SECTION! Print version colored by Nolan Woodard (BOOM! Studio's Incorruptible).

What is Monstrosity?

Monstrosity is a monster movie lovers dream. Godzilla vs. King Kong. Giant robots smashing through cities, Jason and the Argonauts battling sword and shield wielding skeletons. Those were the types of movies that fuelled a love affair with monsters that provided the creative fuel that led to the creation of this graphic novel anthology, Monstrosity!

Monstrosity is a comic anthology that includes the work of over 30 comic loving creators, 18 stories in all! Action adventure, alien worlds, UFO invasions, demons and devils, colossal robots, science fiction and fantasy all grace the pages of Monstrosity!

The Goal

Brian Evinou and I (Phil McClorey) have, between us, over a decade of experience in comics self-publishing.  Monstrosity will be our finest accomplishment to date. There is no risk factor in this fundraiser as this monstrous tome is complete and it looks gorgeous! We’ve got a small press distributor lined up that will be able to get Monstrosity into the hands of retailers. What we’re trying to do now is raise money for the print run and shipping of the book while offering you a kick ass, monster romping reading experience! The more money we raise from the fundraiser, the more books we’ll be able to print and take with us on the comic convention circuit. As part of our thanks to you for helping us out you’ll be able to get a copy of the book into your hands before anyone else and a PDF version of the book even earlier! The books big premiere will be at this year’s Fan Expo in Toronto, August 23rd to 26th. All contributors can expect their own copies within a couple days of that date.

Monstrous Updates!

Keep checking back in every week. We will be posting updates with art and profiles with the artist above in our gallery section!

Please Help Spread the Word

If helping us out financially isn’t an option at this time you can still help us out so much in other ways. Spread the word about Monstrosity on your blogs, through Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, you name it, we love it. Every little bit helps and is greatly appreciated.

The Rewards!

 

The Book in Digital and Print and sketch upgrades

 

The Walsh Gorham Monster Mash-Up Original! Or get the print!

 

Exclusive Print! Only available for the fundraiser!

Original Artwork! Pages from Brian Evinou and Phil McClorey Astro Jaq story No Way No How

Original Artwork! Page 7 from Shane Heron and Kyle Kaczmarczyk story The Island! -SOLD OUT

Original Tony Taylor Painting!

More Original Artwork! Page 5 from Marvin Law's Kronk the Neanderthal story, Of Men and Monsters!

 Contributors (get ready for this list of awesomeness!):

James Edward Clark - Cover

 J.Bone (Multiple Eisner nominee and artist on DC’s Super Friends and IDW’s Rocketeer) – Summer Summoning

Noel Tuazon (Eisner nominated artist on Archaia’s Tumor) and James Turner (SLG’s Warlord of Io, Rex Libris)– Boggart

Fred Kennedy (Teuton) and Gibson Quarter – Princess Patty

Shawn Aldridge (Vic Boone) and Rob Croonenborghs  – Kingu Tora

Sam Agro – Murphy’s Law

Julie Faulkner (Promises Promises) and C.M Morgado –Dinner in Deepwell

Jason Loo (Loo Harvest) – The Grizzly Biker

A.G. Pasquella (New Town, Why Not A Spidermonkey Jesus?) and Dan Simon (No Reason)  – It Came From Within

Kyle Kaczmarczyk (Igor: Occult Detective) and Shane Heron – The Island

Stephen Sloan - Witch Grifter General

Marvin Law and Phil McClorey – Kronk the Neanderthal in Of Men and Monsters

Brian Evinou and Phil McClorey– Wyrms of Coltha and No Way, No How

Adam Christopher and Anthony Furey – War Stories of the Occult

Fabian Rangel Jr. (Los Muertos and Doc Unknown) and Austin Rogers – Jack Manzo in Junk Food

Jim McMunn and Phil McClorey – The Brain

Kris Waddell (Mirror Comics) and Toma Feizo Gas – The Refuge

Ian Daffern (Freelance Blues) and Martin MacIntosh - Hungry

Ricky Lima and Rodrigo Bravo – Stones on the Shore

Keith Grachow - Pin-Up

Jason Copland - Pin-Up

Michael Walsh (IDW's The X-Files) and Adam Gorham (BSC's Teuton) - Pin-Up

Tony Taylor – Back Cover

 

Updates! PAGES

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The Book

Hi! Jared Barel here from Loaded Barrel Studios and the artist and writer from our forthcoming original graphic novel GREY. Part sci-fi, part horror, GREY is the story of a small town cop who must go on the hunt for the alien that is terrorizing his town. Shot with live actors on set, GREY has the look of a comic combined with the cinematic feel of a movie. GREY is a 116 page full color graphic novel with a foreword by the Eisner Award winning writer of RETURN OF THE DAPPER MEN, Jim McCann. 

How You Can Help

The book is 100% complete. All we are looking for now is help to cover the cost of printing. We'd like to bring more Loaded Barrel Studios projects to the world, including the completion of the first Brielle and the Horror full length graphic novel, but we need a little help making this final push to get GREY to the New York Comic Con and on shelves in comic stores everywhere. Obviously, it would be nice to raise the complete funds to cover all of the printing costs, but truthfully, every dollar will help. One way or another, this book is getting printed, so rest assured that every dollar you pledge will go directly toward that goal, even if we don't raise all of the funding that we're looking for here - this book will be printed.


The book is done. The distribution deals are in place. All that's left is a little printing help! 


Check out the Perks on the right to see what you can receive for your contribution!


Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, if you can't contribute there are still other ways you can help us, most importantly by spreading the word! Tell your friend who loves sci-fi movies or your brother who likes horror movies, share a link to this page on Facebook or Twitter. Every little bit helps and we appreciate it all! Thanks!

story:
A SPACE OPERA SPOOF WITH SUMPTUOUS ART SUITABLE FOR ALL AGES

 

I'm Bambos Georgiou, creator and writer of SLASH MORON, a slapstick space opera spoof suitable for all ages.  When Aardman Animation decided to stop producing WALLACE & GROMIT strips I created a new strip, SLASH MORON, with my fellow W&G creators, James Hansen and John Burns.

This is a Limited Edition printing (300 copies) of our creator owned strip, which has only previously appeared on-line in ACES WEEKLY. If you back this project you'll get a physical copy that will instantly begin to rise in value. Featuring 43 landscape pages of full colour, plus extra pages showing James Hansen's beautiful pencils and my inking and lettering.

 

 

We're keeping this offer simple by making 250 copies available exclusively through Indiegogo that are guaranteed to become collector's items. We won't be re-printing this book in this format ever again.

The softback book is 62 pages of high quality paper with card covers and measures 297 mm x 210 mm (approx 11 3/4 inches by 8 1/4 inches) a standard A4 size. The book was printed in 2016 and has been in storage since then and is now finally available.

Jim, John and I have worked for just about everyone from British weekly comics like The Lion, The Beano and Buster to American comics such as Savage Sword of Conan, Marvel Comics Presents, The Ray and Batman Adventures.

This book features three seasoned professionals of the comic book industry finally working together on a character they created.

 

 

Meet the characters...

SLASH MORON: Jock, hero and all around idiot.

PROFESSOR ESSOR: A brainy scientist and inventor with a one track mind.

GALE GOODBODY: A beautiful scientist who lives up to her name.

THE ROBOT: Emotionally intelligent and sensitive, he sometimes seems the most human of all.

Stranded on the planet Varzoom they battle against the evil emperor Klutchmong, despotic ruler of the planet...

 

 

"Slash Moron is to Flash Gordon what Spaceballs is to Star Wars or Flaming Carrot is to, well, any superhero comic...A lighthearted, comical sci-fi adventure packed with gags and great art. One for all the family, especially if they have a "British" sense of humour."

Darryl Robson (Comiconverse.com)

 

 

This book will not be available in this format again!!
story_txt: A SPACE OPERA SPOOF WITH SUMPTUOUS ART SUITABLE FOR ALL AGES I'm Bambos Georgiou, creator and writer of SLASH MORON, a slapstick space opera spoof suitable for all ages.  When Aardman Animation decided to stop producing WALLACE & GROMIT strips I created a new strip, SLASH MORON, with my fellow W&G creators, James Hansen and John Burns.This is a Limited Edition printing (300 copies) of our creator owned strip, which has only previously appeared on-line in ACES WEEKLY. If you back this project you'll get a physical copy that will instantly begin to rise in value. Featuring 43 landscape pages of full colour, plus extra pages showing James Hansen's beautiful pencils and my inking and lettering.  We're keeping this offer simple by making 250 copies available exclusively through Indiegogo that are guaranteed to become collector's items. We won't be re-printing this book in this format ever again.The softback book is 62 pages of high quality paper with card covers and measures 297 mm x 210 mm (approx 11 3/4 inches by 8 1/4 inches) a standard A4 size. The book was printed in 2016 and has been in storage since then and is now finally available.Jim, John and I have worked for just about everyone from British weekly comics like The Lion, The Beano and Buster to American comics such as Savage Sword of Conan, Marvel Comics Presents, The Ray and Batman Adventures.This book features three seasoned professionals of the comic book industry finally working together on a character they created.  Meet the characters...SLASH MORON: Jock, hero and all around idiot.PROFESSOR ESSOR: A brainy scientist and inventor with a one track mind.GALE GOODBODY: A beautiful scientist who lives up to her name.THE ROBOT: Emotionally intelligent and sensitive, he sometimes seems the most human of all.Stranded on the planet Varzoom they battle against the evil emperor Klutchmong, despotic ruler of the planet...  "Slash Moron is to Flash Gordon what Spaceballs is to Star Wars or Flaming Carrot is to, well, any superhero comic...A lighthearted, comical sci-fi adventure packed with gags and great art. One for all the family, especially if they have a "British" sense of humour."Darryl Robson (Comiconverse.com)  This book will not be available in this format again!!

story:
SURPRISE BONUS!

Every AlternaWeen backer will also receive an exclusive limited edition trading card SIGNED by publisher/founder Peter Simeti!  Artwork by Dean Kotz and Ryan Winn

 

AlternaWeen is BACK

Thanks to hundreds of people all over the world, our first AlternaWeen was a hit! Thousands of children got one of our comics as trick-or-treats for Halloween, nearly 15,000 comics in total! This Halloween, we're back at it again with even more comics and fun items and rewards.

By using our comics as trick-or-treats, you'll be able to help grow a new generation of comic book readers and creators.  The funds that we raise will once again go towards helping us to expand our product line into a variety of stores and depending on the stretch goals we unlock, we'll be able to get our comics into convenience stores, grocery stores, dollar stores, and more!

 

 

AlternaWeen is also GIVING back

At Alterna, we believe in giving back to the community, so for every $1000 raised past our goal, we'll donate a box of 100 comics to various children's hospitals so kids that can't go out trick-or-treating for Halloween, can still have a few goodies on that day.

 

To order specific comics, merchandise, and more from us -- please click the above banner and visit alternaaccess.com -- thank you!

 

Putting more comics in more places

The funds raised from last year's AlternaWeen campaign allowed us to purchase a membership at RangeMe -- a site that connects companies with product buyers at a large variety of stores. Because of this membership, we were able to get our comics into Sheetz and we were also able to begin communication with several store buyers. This year's AlternaWeen will allow us to renew our membership with RangeMe and continue to build those relationships with stores so we can expand our distribution.

For those that don't know, Alterna has been around since 2006. We mostly published graphic novels in the first ten years of our existence and in May 2017 we launched a single issue line that featured interiors printed on newsprint. Printing on newsprint is what allows us to have such affordable cover prices.

Part of our newsprint initiative started in 2017, was to also get comics back on newsstands. We make comics for everyone at Alterna but the sad truth is that comic books aren't as readily available for everyone as they used to be.  Over the past two years, we've taken steps to become one of the only publishing companies with newsstand distribution along with traditional comic shop distribution. We're also working with dozens of comic shop retailers directly to get our comics into their stores on a more consistent basis.

Our comics have been carried in stores like Toys "R" Us, Barnes & Noble, Books-A-Million, Sheetz, and dozens of independent newsstands and even international chains in Poland, Germany, France, and more.

Our $5000 goal will go towards reward production and shipping, renewing our membership at RangeMe, as well as printing the additional comics that we'll need to continue expanding our distribution. We also have stretch goals in place that will help us secure promotional product placements in a variety of stores, enable us to print more comics for more distribution, and will go towards all of the additional supplies that are needed for such an undertaking. We'll have more information on stretch goals once we reach that point.

 

 

The Rewards

Risks & Challenges

We've run over a dozen successful crowdfunding projects between Kickstarter and Indiegogo and have helped out over two dozen other projects as well.  Alterna has been around since 2006 and ships hundreds of direct orders every month. You're absolutely in good hands with us!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word on social media if you can and make sure to use the hash tag #AlternaWeen -- thank you!

story:
WE'RE MAKING A COMIC BOOK


Hello.  Thanks for taking the time to read this.  I also hope you will contribute to my 

project and also share this with social media.  I really could use the help.

I hope you will back me with my ideas.  This would mean so much to me to be able 

to follow my dreams.  I work hard and will not disappoint if you give me a chance to 

show you what I can do.  



The Black Jack is a new comic with original script and artwork by Alister Lee. Also

helping with editing is Sevgi Kahverengi.

The first volume One shot has 41 finished pages and the story is to continue with

nine more story lines.  This first story is about a young girl seeking revenge as her 

entire family was killed by a gang of outlaws. The story is set in the old west in a 

small desert city in Arizona. Life was though in the old west and she had to hide her

identity as a girl so she pretends to be a boy. She learns all she can about surviving

the times. Her fear and anger is always present.


What she finds out though that this isn't just her fight. Evil forces are also after the

 outlaw gangs who must pay for their earthly sins! There are many twists and turns 

to this western fantasy comic.

What We Need & What You Get

I'am seeking help to further write, draw and produce the next nine story lines.

I need $10,000 to continue to work full time creating this. I also need the money

to help get a website set up for digital  publishing.

Thank you in advance for your interest and for pledging your support!


Thanks again for reading and for your support. Feel free to contact me should you have any questions or concerns.  I really want this project to move forward.  Please help if you can!

story:
CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY is the most TALKED ABOUT COMIC BOOK of the last few years!

 

It's definitely one of the most highly anticipated!  And as people receive their comics happily, many new fans might feel left out!  This book isn't available in stores.  It's only available here on IndieGoGo!  

So although the other three versions of the book aren't available, I did print THREE line art variant covers that are limited to 1500 copies each!  (The lowest print run of this book!)  Choose one!  They're all the same inside.  Or collect all three!

Also, I'm making the PROOF COPIES available.  These are the FIRST RUN CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY comics, digitally printed on heavy paper.  They were made for inspection and approval purposes.  A very small print run, but as promised, I'll offer them here as well!

ALL OF THESE ITEMS ARE IN STOCK AND READY TO SHIP!  They will ship promptly following complete fulfillment of the prior CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY campaigns, which are quickly reaching the hands of customers! 

DON'T MISS OUT!

Alright Major update time

Since this campagin isn't going well at all and I currently need all the time I can get to do commissions for christmas money, I'd like to update the few people who donated\plan to donate on a few things:

-further donations are appreceated but wont really affect Strange Worlds 

-I'm still going to launch Strange Worlds early summer 2015, but instead of daily updates I might only be able to update once a week or less

-further updates on the comic will only be posted at http://strangeworldscomic.tumblr.com

-spreading the word about Strange Worlds is still very important and appreceated

Have a nice day!


/EDIT

story:
Hi, I'm Joe Sweetness. Welcome to my Test Page.

I'm honest, sweet, sincere, sexy & a whole lotta Fun! Are you ready to take a ride on my GoGo-Stick?

I'm feeling a bit lonely today. Will you keep me company on my Journey to Sweet Enlightenment?

  • I'm a bit of a player. Scrabble anyone? 
  • I dig creativity... Checkout my projects!
  • Tech, Entertainment, Design... Jam Studios does it all. 

Continue reading or go straight to the perks on the right to learn more about what I have to offer a gorgeous person like yourself. 

What I need is you. Beautiful Sexy You!

Brought to you by JAM Studios

Other Jam Projects include:

  • Little Bunny Foo Foo - Animated Storybook
  • Candid Hope - Feature Film Trilogy
  • Noni Goji - Virtual Pop Stars
  • Stereo 3D Operating System (O ya!)

Who wants to play with my Monkey?

Yo Yo, I'm MANKEY, but you can call me Mista Mank. 

"Hey baby, I see you... you really got it goin on... Do a spin for me. Yea that's it...Work it, Work it... Now close your eyes and Peel the Banana "

Take it from me, Joe's the man. He and I go way back. He needs you're $Moola to make some cool sh*t happen. So help a brotha out Yo. 

I know i'm supposed to build up trust, yet here's the thing.

"Money aint a thang, but still we like to share... We toss it in the air, we toss it in the air!"

 

Checkout the 1st 3 Comic Strips Ever!

___________________________________________________________________________

___________________________________________________________________________

Will you please help my friend Joe?

I'll show you my perks if you do ;)

They're nice & Perky, I promise.

 JUST DO IT!

25 pages of Sweetness

"I'll make it worth your while"
___________________________________

A Signed & Numbered 8.5x11 Sweetness Print

"hand delivered by a post officer. And no, not the bachelor party version"

___________________________________________________________________________

Disclaimer: In case you have'nt noticed, The content will be dirty. Very (im)mature-rated material.

"Welcome to the Sweetness. Yeah, it's the Sweetest. I just sugar coated you in my Sweetness" 

 

Wishing you all the Sweetest,

Joe Sweetness

PS: Follow the Links below to join us on Social Media.

story:
Help make the book become a reality!

I'm working hard to finish the pages so that they are ready to be sent off to print. Old chapters are beind redrawn or touched up so as to keep the quality consistent.

Yakage Force is written and Illustrated by Jahvin Baxter (TripleB). It began it's run March 16, 2008.

Every human has the ability to harness their inner powers and elements. Once they are aware of this they can use martial arts as a way to help them access their abilities. However there are those who use their powers for evil. Yakage Force's job is to stop them, away from the eyes of the general public

In the year 2023, they are attacked by Isabelle Foster who attacks them against her own will. When this happens, they realize there is something bigger going on.

Incidentally, the comic can be read online at: http://yakageforce.co.uk/ !

 

 

What I need and what you get

Hopefully I am not asking too much. I only need money to help with printing costs and pomotion. At the very least the printing costs, regardless, anything I'm able to recieve will go directly into  the comic.

The volume will be Chapters 1~6 which will total about 120 pages, all in black and white.

Anyone who backs the project will obviously recieve a copy of the book (both in print AND PDF) but also one of the perks listed on the right.

Spread the Word!

In addition to pledging your support, you can also help us out by TELLING OTHERS about this project. Tweet it, Facebook it, do whatever you can! Everything helps!

story:
Weregeek is a comic strip that has been running online for over five years.  At its heart, it's a comic about geeks and geek culture, highlighting the power of imagination as one seemingly "normal" guy called Mark learns to love all things nerdy.  Roleplaying games, LARP, anime, cosplay, miniatures battles and many other forms of geekdom are explored in great detail... for those unfamiliar with the story, here's a glimpse of what you might find in this book:

The Book:

Why would you want to buy a book when you can read the comic online? Well, other than the lovely feel of a real physical book in one's hands, there's a TON of extra content packed into this book that ISN'T available online! There's production art, big splash images, author commentary, 8 never-before-seen strips, and a foreword by Tarol Hunt, the artist and writer behind another fine geek comic - Goblins. And, as though that wasn't enough, I've also managed to pack an exclusive 6-page story into the book!

 

Book 4 Details at a glance:

  • 104 pages, full color art throughout
  • Durable gloss cover, perfect bound 
  • Format: 10" x 8.5"
  • Over 12 pages of extra content, including the 6-page bonus story 

 

So what's the deal?:

While Weregeek has been published on the internet regularly since 2006, my first book came out in 2008 Since then, I've published two more books.  All of the money for printing costs comes out of my own pocket, and that means putting several thousand dollars worth of debt on my credit card, *every year*.

 

We've tried doing pre-orders in the past, but they were always problematic. Not only was our store software just not up to the task, but it took a long time to get orders sent out using Canada Post. US Customs also seems to be very picky about letting things in, even for printed materials.

 

This time, I will be shipping all of the books out of the United States. This means that I can offer shipping for much cheaper, even for International orders, but it also means that there's a much lower chance that things will get lost or caught up at the border!

 

What YOU get out of this:

In addition to preorders of the book itself, we're offering a LOT of cool incentives to entice you to jump on our book-printing bandwagon!  First of all there's a special 2-page PDF Weregeek story that has never appeared before in any form (neither on the website or in any of the books), exclusive only to backers!  All donations of 8 dollars or more will receive this PDF as a digital download.  Then there's the books themselves, of course, which we're offering at reduced shipping costs, especially if you order the multiple book sets.

 

Then there's the really exciting stuff:  Weregeek Poetry Swag, custom sketches, original artwork used in producing the book, one-of-a-kind weregeek sculptures... Want me to NPC at your next game? I'll do it! Want me to RUN you a game over Skype? That's also something I can do!  And if you want a combination of things that doesn't appear in any one perk, you can email me to make arrangements!

 

The print cost (including shipping from China) for Book 4 will be $4250. Plus I need to pay brokerage fees for customs, and pay to have it transported from the port in Vancouver to my office in Alberta. On top of that, I will also have to cover taxes on all money earned, as well as fees charged by IndieGoGo. The final estimated cost for all of this is around $5000, which is the goal I've set.  If we don't make the goal, fear not!  All orders will be honored.  However, if there's enough of a response, and we actually meet or beat that goal, we have a number of special rewards planned for all backers that we'll reveal as the campaign goes along, so remember to check back for updates!

 

If this happens, I also want to let you know where the extra money will go.  Doing the last book was a lesson in just how out-of-date my computer system is, and I'm in desperate need of an upgrade.  Not only will this make it possible for me to upgrade from Photoshop 7 to the latest version, but a better system means that I will be able to start up weekly UStreams again! (My current system just can't handle running the current UStream software + Photoshop at the same time).

 

Shipping

Shipping for U.S. supporters has been included in the price of each perk. For non-US supporters, a small additional charge is listed below the perk to help cover the extra cost of shipping. Please make sure to include this cost in your contribution, or your order can't be shipped to you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute any money (and believe me, I know what it's like to be broke! Games ain't cheap!), the best way you can help us out is by spreading the word about this campaign. Tweet about it, post about it on Facebook, mention it to your gaming group or at the local gaming store... Every little bit helps!

 

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/alinapete

G+: alina.pete@gmail.com

I'll do it! Want me to RUN you a game over Skype? That's also something I can do!  And if you want a combination of things that doesn't appear in any one perk, you can email me to make arrangements!
 
The print cost (including shipping from China) for Book 4 will be $4250. Plus I need to pay brokerage fees for customs, and pay to have it transported from the port in Vancouver to my office in Alberta. On top of that, I will also have to cover taxes on all money earned, as well as fees charged by IndieGoGo. The final estimated cost for all of this is around $5000, which is the goal I've set.  If we don't make the goal, fear not!  All orders will be honored.  However, if there's enough of a response, and we actually meet or beat that goal, we have a number of special rewards planned for all backers that we'll reveal as the campaign goes along, so remember to check back for updates!
 
If this happens, I also want to let you know where the extra money will go.  Doing the last book was a lesson in just how out-of-date my computer system is, and I'm in desperate need of an upgrade.  Not only will this make it possible for me to upgrade from Photoshop 7 to the latest version, but a better system means that I will be able to start up weekly UStreams again! (My current system just can't handle running the current UStream software + Photoshop at the same time).
 
Shipping
Shipping for U.S. supporters has been included in the price of each perk. For non-US supporters, a small additional charge is listed below the perk to help cover the extra cost of shipping. Please make sure to include this cost in your contribution, or your order can't be shipped to you!
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute any money (and believe me, I know what it's like to be broke! Games ain't cheap!), the best way you can help us out is by spreading the word about this campaign. Tweet about it, post about it on Facebook, mention it to your gaming group or at the local gaming store... Every little bit helps!
 
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/alinapete
G+: alina.pete@gmail.com

story:
Hi, I'm Deirdre. I've been doing my comic Wasted Epiphanies (http://wastedepiphanies.com) since 2006, when I put together a little 12-page photocopied minicomic to give away at Burning Man. It's a collection of strips about... polar bear temps, black holes in language, strange hovering artifacts, racing snails, festival dawns, selfish genes, a caveman who dreams of aeroplanes, why sex is like ice skating, why spaceships make me cry, and whatever is currently making my head explode. 

I have a new 40-page A5 collection ready to go. 

What's in it? All the web strips since last October, and several which will only appear in the print version. Some because they're the wrong format (landscape), some because they're TOO HOT FOR THE INTERNETS due to naked people and/or bad behaviour.

What does it look like? That's the cover up there. Inside it's in glorious colour.

Colour printing is really expensive. Yes, I know, and it'd be cheaper to do a print run in black and white, but I don't want the experience of reading the comic in print to be less good than it would be on the web; if possible, I want it to be better. It's great to be able to reach people through a website, but books as physical objects are still important. 

Even so, I'd been thinking doing a colour collection would be way out of my price range. Then I checked with my college printers, and the cost of a print run went from "don't even think about it" to "ouch, that's quite expensive, but... hmmm..."

But. I am astonishingly skint - I've just moved to London and started an MA. When I was doing little photocopied minicomics, I could just print off a batch of them myself and ignore the cost. This is not just a little photocopied minicomic, and stumping up the whole printing cost in advance and hoping to break even eventually would be... painful. There have to be better ways for starving artists to do these things. I believe that. Please help prove me right.

If I don't make my total, I'll still do the print run, so all contributors will get their copies. But if you help me cover the whole cost, you'll know that you helped me sleep at night. 

In the event that I go over the total (wouldn't that be cool?), I'll print more copies!

(Added later: I never thought I actually would go over the total, but now I have - thank you all so much. If this keeps going past the cost of a print run of 150, which I think is the most the small-press market will support, I'll put anything further towards my web hosting bills and make the site advertising-free.)

 

What are you paying for?

At the subsidised printers at my college, a print run of 100 books will cost about £300. (As I said, this is incredibly cheap as colour printing goes.) (And it turns out this is the minimum you can ask for on this site anyway.)

Everyone who contributes at least £5 (this is the equivalent of a pre-order - it'll cover comic cost and postage in the UK) gets a copy of the comic, signed to you, and a thank-you shout-out on the inside back cover and on the website. If you contribute more than that, you can get all sorts of extra stuff - from Tempin' Bear notebooks to original artwork, to cake and hanging-of-out, to custom paintings and murals and my eternal gratitude. See the VIP Perks for info.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Signal amplification! I'd really appreciate if you could tell people about this if they're interested in comics or new ways of funding creativity. RTs are very welcome (@bluedevi and @epiphanytweet), or mentions anywhere else.

 

Thank you!

D x

story:
The brand-new Amazon original series debuts July 26th and Dynamite will bring you up to speed on the world of The Boys with the official graphic novel series that started it all! Welcome to the The Boys omnibus collection, assembling the first 6 story arcs of this gloriously violent, unapologetically funny comic series!

WHAT’S THIS ALL ABOUT?

AN ALL-NEW PRINTING

To celebrate The Boys jump to the silver screen, Dynamite Entertainment is excited to offer fans, new and old, a brand new printing of the series, with your choice of cover! Each volume is available in either a “COMIC” cover, or a “SHOW” cover featuring the actors in poses that pay tribute to the original covers that made the series so memorable.

(above: The Amazon series poster on the left compared with the original iconic comic cover.)

THE TRAILER

THE CREATORS

GARTH ENNIS (writer)

Garth Ennis is a Northern Irish comics writer, best known for the DC/Vertigo series Preacher, co-created with artist Steve Dillon, and his successful revival of Marvel Comics' Punisher franchise.
His work is characterized by extreme violence, black humour, profanity, an interest in male friendship, an antagonistic relationship with organized religion, and irreverence towards superheroes. Frequent artistic collaborators include Darick Robertson, Steve Dillon, Glenn Fabry, Carlos Ezquerra and John McCrea.

DARICK ROBERTSON (artist)

Darick W. Robertson is an American artist best known for his work as a comic book illustrator. Highly prolific, Robertson has illustrated hundreds of comics in his twenty plus years in the industry. His body of work ranges from science fiction characters of his own creation to headlining on renowned classic characters from Marvel and DC Comics. Robertson is best known as the co-creator and illustrator of the biting satires Transmetropolitan and THE BOYS.
