story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone!

My name is Clarissa and I am the creator of LifeUnexpected.  I am a student going to a community to become a Graphic Design and Illustrator. I also work as a illustrator for a children’s book company. I completed 2 books recently, called “Gimme Will Not Get It” and “Penny Mae Pigsnout: Detective Extraordinaire.”

I have been drawing since I was a young child and I always wanted to make sci-fi adventure comic books and even animations. I loved seeing the different races and species from other planets. The clearfully designed battle ships and futuristic cities that blow my mind away. There are a lot of inspirational movies, comics, and books that really inspire me, such as: STAR WARS, IRobot, Chronicles of Riddick, AVATAR, Final Fantasy games, Men In Black, Prometheus, District 9, Hunger Games, oh gee and so so much more!

I already have my comic online over the computer in a site called Comic Fury, so then you must be wondering why do I want to print out the comic? Well, some people not only like to read comics over the computer but they also appreciate a psychical copy in their hands. This campaign is important to me because I want to share my comic with everyone, so I have this satisfaction of them enjoying what I have produced.

All your donations would greatly help me in my pursuits!

About the Comic!

Here’s a little intro into my comic chapter 1: In the beginning, the universe was a vase open space, filled with many galaxies and many planets with in them. However, the different races residing in the planets did not know of each other existence. In distant future where technology advanced and few planets had capabilities of exploring space, they set off to find their neighboring planets.

Five planets that were near by each other formed a perfect pentagon on the galactic map existence and teamed up together to form the Planetary Alliance. This alliance grew to be one of the most powerful in the known galaxy, the planets in the alliance are: Earth, Taji, Rion, Veinara, and Antares. Unfortuantely, the leader of Taji did not want to continue their friendly alliance but to take it over entirely and become sole ruler of all five planets and possibly beyond

The leaders of the planets are: Earth Leader: Ahmose, Taji Leader: Damien, Rion Leader: Vortex, Veinara Leader: Nira, and Antares Leader: Zordon.

They all have there own strengths and weaknesses which only makes their bond stronger.

Earth: Is a diverse planet, different species from the other planets dwell in Earth, it is also a planet of trading and commerce. They deal with economical and social issues as well, wanting to make sure all citizens in the Planetary Alliance are at peace and happy with one another.

Taji: Is a planet of war, they have well trained soldiers, the strongest armies, highly advanced weapons and battle ships. They are the main defense for the alliance.

Rion: Is the planet that keeps the others in check, Rion is the main headquarters for most of the Planetary Alliance affairs, their leader is clear headed and wise.

Veinara: Is a planet of agriculture and medicine. They grow all kinds of food and plant life. Since most of their people are more peace loving they some they are healers and make fantastic medical professionals.

Antares: A planet made with unique metals and materials. The people of the planet are humanoid, android like beings not really a robot that we may see on earth. The people live through the planets central core that not only powers them but the planet too. The people experience emotions and conscience just like any other life form would because even though they are, but just part mechanical and are part flesh.

Here are a few sample pages of my comic:

Cover of my comic: 



My art skill and styles as grown and changed over the years, I start this comic in 2010, then became more active with the comic in 2012 and 2013. The script and characters are still the same though :)


What We Need!

My goal: I want to raise 1000 dollars so I will be able to produce and sell as many comics as possible. I want to make about 200 comic books, adding with with merchandise, like key chains and posters, to help promote the comic.

The comic will be fully colored, also front cover and back cover will be colored.

Inside the comic will be 12 pages, it may vary for each chapter (volume) of the book.

The comic book size will be about 6 x 9, as small as a manga’s size.

I will hopefully also begin selling my comic at Nekocon happening in November 2013, in Virginia. Maybe I will see you there!

A few loyal viewers of my comic ask me forever to make psychical copies of this comic and I want to fulfill their wishes and my wish.

Also will add some more perks eventually!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR DONATING. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I want you to help me spread the word about my campaign, remember to use sharing tools and to just tell your friends!

story:
A HUGE THANK YOU goes out to anyone who has already supported this campaign in any way. Thank you for supporting Canadian comics, political comics, historical comics.
 
                                                - - - - - - - - - - - -
 
My name is Nicole Marie Guiniling and I’m the founder of Ad Astra Comix. Ad Astra is a website that promotes political and historical comic books, and has recently stepped, albeit with shakey legs, into production, distribution, and publishing.

Over the next 40 days, I'm here on IndieGoGo to promote the re-mastering of "100 Year Rip-Off: The Real History of British Columbia." It’s a graphic history of the province that was first published in 1971. That makes it the oldest "Graphic History" on record in Canada.
 

 

THE COMIC: 100 Year Rip-Off

In July 1971, 100 Year Rip-Off was printed as an 8-page tabloid-sized insert in the counter-culture newspaper, Socialist Youth. It was produced in response to festivities celebrating 100 years of British Columbia's time as a Canadian province. When I first looked through it 40 years later, I was holding a photocopy of a photocopy--after four decades out of print, it was unlikely that too many originals were still around.
 
Pages were creased, graphics were scarred, and the text was messy, but I loved it. What a wonderful documentation--and piece, in and of itself--of B.C. history! I just knew that if the work were re-issued, there would be others like me who would want to see it.
 
In cooperation with the original artist, Bob Altwein, Ad Astra Comix is re-releasing 100 Year Rip-Off for a new generation of readers. The original work has been re-mastered and re-formatted into a black-and-white, 30-page comic book--the same size as your garden-variety Marvel or DC comic.
 
Ad Astra Comix is already at the presses, ready to begin printing.... but in order to get 100 Year Rip-Off into comic shops across Canada, we need costs to be as low as possible.
 

The Pledges and the Perks...

For as little as $7 you can get a copy of 100 Year Rip-Off mailed, with a protective board and bag, right to your doorstep--no extra shipping fee required.

Next is our “Pay It Forward” pledge. That’s where, for $25, you get one copy for yourself, two to pass along to friends, co-workers or classmates, and a poster-sized copy of the map included in the book – which details the names and locations of much of what is mentioned in the comic. The map is great to have for classrooms, studies and bookstores; it's also a great place to start if you’re from out-of-province and need some orientation before diving in!
 
 
 
No complicated combinations. No useless swag or perks. This is truly about coming together and supporting a long-lost political and historical comic that needs--deserves--a new lease on life.
 

Follow Along!

If you have any questions, you can follow along with us on Twitter at @AdAstraComix or like us on Facebook and get more information about the world of political comic books.
 
Thanks for watching – and from the bottom of MY heart, a big big thank you to those who contribute. I hope you enjoy reading your copy of 100 Year Rip-Off as much as I do!

story:
I created an idea for an original horror/sci-fi movie called "NAKED ALIEN MASSACRE" which has a kickass script penned by comedian Kevin Lahaie and myself. In it evil clothes-hating aliens invade a real nudist resort. Theres more to it than that but.. come for the NUDITY stay for the STORY.. it'll blow your mind!!

It is NAKED AND AFRAID meets PREDATOR!!!

Last year my team and I put together an excited Oscar/EMMY winning crew and even managed to attach several big name actors to the project, but alas ultimately Hollywood just didn't get it. So now after a year of doing other projects, at the urging of my comic book industry friends I've agreed to finally turn the screenplay into a KICKASS GRAPHIC NOVEL!!!

Purpose of it would be:

#1. To reward those fans that contributed and supported the movie project attempts by making available the vision in another form. Make it the best quality art and production I can to thrill and excite true fans of horror comics!!

#2. As a tool to show those Hollywood studios what the vision is and how exciting and profitable it can be. In a time of nothing but remakes, re-imaginings and reboots here's something truly original. 

I am TIM CHIZMAR -Writer/Producer and a member of the Horror Writers Association, a Comic Con pro regular, and a frequent guest of comic book podcasts. I grew up on Midnight Sons/Ghost Rider and have a love/appreciation for all things dark/macabre. I wrote/produced a John Constantine: Hellblazer fan film which was directed by Matt Gonzalez and starred ROH/TNA star Nigel McGuinness, WWE/TNA star Katarina Leigh Waters, and 2-time Oscar winner Jeryd Pojawa among others. Heres PART #1. http://youtu.be/VbMQJGFY_9A 

Believe me when I say this will be a violent/shocking and surprisingly different kind of story - of that i assure you. There's never EVER been a story like this.  

Lets bring it to life!!!

I grew up on Midnight Sons/Ghost Rider and have a love/appreciation for all things dark/macabre. I wrote/produced a John Constantine: Hellblazer fan film which was directed by Matt Gonzalez and starred ROH/TNA star Nigel McGuinness, WWE/TNA star Katarina Leigh Waters, and 2-time Oscar winner Jeryd Pojawa among others. Heres PART #1. http://youtu.be/VbMQJGFY_9A Believe me when I say this will be a violent/shocking and surprisingly different kind of story - of that i assure you. There's never EVER been a story like this.  Lets bring it to life!!!

story:
Comic Cinema Remix (CCR) is simple: a once a month, live event in Boise, Idaho where comedians provide hilarious commentary over movies that you remember being excellent but were in fact head-scratchingly terrible -

Call it the “Footloose Effect”: for no apparent reason everybody remembers thinking a movie was a rip-roaring fun time when – as is revealed through the magic of a live CCR viewing – it was in fact a complete pile of garbage.

Thus far, CCR has gotten by on its good looks and charm and the fact that the comics involved are so passionate about the project that they have not minded missing one or two credit card payments in order to make the first few CCR events happen. 

But we want to ensure that the next full Comic Cinema Remix season takes place and for that we need help. 

See, it costs a bit of money to license each of the terribly wonderful films that we lambast each month. The precise licensing fees are variable, depending upon the age and popularity of the movie being screened as well as the time and place that the showing takes place – and there is a “bulk-rate” discount if we pre-pay for multiple films all at once…which is why we started this indiegogo campaign!

 Judging from the first six CCR shows already under our belt (Footloose, Commando, Ghost, Independence Day, Marked for Death and Adventures in Babysitting) we can safely expect that licensing fees for our next six outings will run $200 per movie. 

So we ask you, the marginally-crummy-movie loving audience to dig not-so-deep into your pockets and help us raise the $1200 needed to ensure the next 6-month “season” of Comic Cinema Remix can happen.


Please take a moment and watch the attached video, part of which contains the 60s promo video we put together leading up to the July 18, 2014 CCR of Independence Day in Boise Idaho. This promo captures the essence of what the next season of CCR will be about.


We have our season partially mapped out at this point:

Oct 17: Halloween 3

Nov 14: Howard the Duck

Dec 19: Jingle all the Way

January 9: Dirty Dancing

This campaign is to help guarantee we can afford to actually have these shows happen!

story:
Leia em Português



Do you have comics stuck in a drawer? Let's publish them! 

Hello! I'm Alex Moura and I'm the founder of Comicflip, the platform that will help authors and artists to get their comics in the hands of thousands in a way that's honest and fun, with loyal readers and fans 24/7. Comicflip will be the best place to be to publish and read comics: a truly direct connection between authors and readers. 

Let's make the world a better place for comics authors

It's hard to make a living from comics in the traditional publishing business, because the authors only keep about 8% of the selling price. Yes, you read that right: just about 8%. The big digital gatekeepers (like Google, Amazon, Apple, among others) are doing the same, keeping from 30% to 50% of all earnings, and at the same time retaining the new readers for themselves: the authors have no contact at all with their own audience. Together we can change it!

With Comicflip, authors will keep 95% of the profit. Pretty cool, huh?

Imagine what it feels like to wake up in the morning to lots of appreciation on the new comic you posted, or to hundreds of sales that came in overnight from readers all around the world. Imagine finally making the impact and the income you know you deserve. This is not a crazy dream, it's a new reality of the comics business. All authors should have a chance to be found and to thrive, and you can help to make it possible by supporting Comicflip.

Your fans are all around the world. With Comicflip you will reach them.

Comicflip will be global, available initially in English, French, Portuguese and Spanish (more to come), and you can also have your stories professionally translated to other languages by our passionate translation team and reach even more people. Isn’t this cool? 



Dedicated to comics

Comicflip is nothing more than the result of the desire to make a difference, to help comics artists across the planet to grow, and we've been working really hard to build Comicflip in a way both authors and readers will love to use.

Reading comics on Comicflip is great: just flip through the story in full screen, without distractions, ads or clumsy interfaces, making it really cool to read comics on any device: tablets, phablets, smartphones, desktops, notebooks, you name it!

It takes only 3 steps to publish on Comicflip:

  1. Type the title
  2. Add the images
  3. Set the price

and... That’s it: free, quick and simple.



Information is power

The author's Dashboard is your analytics and data on your comics, where you will see the number of sales, visits, and referrals to your stories. Additionally, you can see where your readers come from and in which country your stories are successful.



Comics are passion

Most comics artists get started creating stories because they need to express themselves. They're looking to not being chained to an office desk and don't want to be locked into someone else's schedule, and what they really want is to have a better life doing something they love, something they are born to do, and to be happy and successful doing it. 

Comicflip will bring, closer to you, the people who really care about what you do, no matter whether you call it bande dessinée, manga, graphic novel or história em quadrinhos: we share the same passion.



Let's make this happen!

Did you enjoy this idea? I hope so. If you did, contribute now and, of course, share it with your friends. By supporting us, you are not just a collaborator, you are a creator, and I can't wait to see what you will create with it.

Thank you.

 Leia em Português

story:
Who is Merk & what is this?

I am! My name is Merk and I am an artist and storyteller from middle of nowhere Canada. I've been making comics independently for upwards of a decade now with 2  self published books under my belt: "Victor's Legacy" (written by Matthew Jowett & Andrew Sookram) and "Nowadays" (written by Kurt Martell). Now I'm ready to do a book completely by me and "Season of the Dead Hours" is it.  A 112 b/w graphic novel about banished sorcerers returning to this world, trying to gather power before they are ripped fro this world & sent back into their magical limbo. We follow one sorcerer, Sitchenn, as he enlists the help of a young, Irish boy named Fionn. Fionn's eyes are opened to a magic long obscured from mortal eyes. He encounters creatures hidden right before him as they make their way to one final battle with Sitchenn's foes the Janus Magus.  But not all is what it seems in the world of magic.

This campaign, with your help, will make the printing of this book possible, something I can't do on my own. I am not a publishing house. I am not flush with cash (I'm an artist, remember? It's a good day if i can buy a sandwich).  This whole endeavor.... is just me. I am doing EVERYTHING involved in this book from the story conception to art to this campaign to advertising to bagging up & shipping you all the awesome perks involved to your door!  You have a chance to be a part of that.  90% of the work on the book is done, so now it's just that final stretch and you could have a book in your hands.... or on your table.... or by the toilet? Wherever you want to put it is cool by me.  No judgement. Or hey! A Christmas gift? There is a special Xmas deal... read on!

Break it down.

Ok. The goal is $8500. That will print 2000 books & cover the perks that I'm offering which will include tshirt printing, poster printing, stickers, teleportation, and whatever else my brain will come up with to make this an awesome offer for you. This is very clear and simple. ALL the funds raised go towards that. I don't make money from this part. This covers me making the book, getting it professionally printed. I've worked with these printers before and they do beautiful work!

Ok. Now, the STUFF YOU GET! Depending on what level you contribute at, you get lots of great stuff. You can get things from: RANDOM THINGS find lying around my house (seriously, I am tons of things in my house & will put random things in. Might be a paperclip. Could be a comic trade. Might be original art. Or maybe a signed photo from a complete stranger), a personalized, SIGNED COPY OF THE BOOK, a thank you/name drop in the book (if you contribute at any level, you get a name drop in the book & a big smoochy book thank you!),  MERK DESIGNED SEASON SHIRTS (designs to be revealed!), PERSONALIZED SKETCHES (you pick, I draw), I make YOU into a sorcerer/sorceress in a LIMITED EDITION POSTER PRINT (only those who contribute at that level get 'magiced' and I turn you into some sort of wielder of ancient power, with whatever input you want to give me for your look), have an AD IN THE BOOK (Do you have a business or are you an artist who wants to have your ad in the book? I travel all over North America going to conventions and so could your ad, not to mention through my website and other contributors to the campaign. HEY FELLOW COMIC ARTISTS, here's your audience. Target them.), and since I do my art 'traditionally', not digitally, there are gorgeous, ORIGINAL INKED PAGES up for grabs (those puppies will be very limited). And who knows what else I will toss into the campaign as we go along. Think about it. You go to a bookstore to buy a book. Here, you are preordering that book, dealing DIRECTLY with the creator, and getting a bunch of fantastic extra stuff along with it!!  And then there's the XMAS DEAL! This book will NOT be printed before Christmas, BUT if you are purchasing it as a gift for someone for Christmas, then I will send you a Christmas Card stating that you are a &^%$ing amazing friend/family member and have ordered this book & perks for them and will receive it post haste!

I've done this before.

So I've contributed to other campaigns before.... and waited... and waited... and waited, only to have something arrive out of the blue years later or sometimes never to receive anything at all.

That will not happen.

I hate when that happens so I make sure that I never do that to others. And I've done campaigns before. Kurt & I did our 'Nowadays'  graphic novel (look it up here on the ol' indiegogo) and got it printed & out to everyone within the stated timeline of a couple months from campaign completion. This book is almost completed. I don't do these fundraising campaigns until I am almost done the book. You're not paying me to work on the book. You're paying for the book. It's penciled. It's 95% inked and words are being put into their word bubble mouths & things getting set for the printer. It is tentatively scheduled to hit the printer in February so it will be in everyone's beautiful, little hands by April or May (depending on print/shipping times).  You will not be waiting around for me to finish things up. I've done the VAST majority already. All I need now is you.....

So that's it. That's the idea. I love to make art and tell stories. 20 years ago, I wouldn't have been able to do it this way (and maybe not at all), but this sort of thing now is AMAZING on BOTH sides of the fence, for creators and readers.  We get to connect. I get to share these things from my brain (and soul) without companies telling me what to create and what story to tell. YOU get to be a part of something that few people get to enjoy. Think about it. This isn't some international best seller that will be in every store. This is a small print run and you will have been a part of creating it. And your name will be in it!! This is a big thing for me. I've spent YEARS doing this book. And I want you to read it.

So contribute if you can. Share if you can't (or contribute AND share ... because Kenny Loggins wants you to). Sharetools, check 'em.  Join me on this wacky journey. Questions, drop me line.

story: Wonderful
story_txt: Wonderful

story:
The right image or graphic, at the right moment, can right the world.

We all know the power of art. With that power I'm creating a printmaking studio to find the most powerful world-changing drawings and graphics. And, you can help: with your contributions, I can fund the full run of the limited-edition prints here and I'll create new work. I'll finish the sketches I've made for new images and design new images. I'm adding color to my drawing style and, with your participation, I can experiment with that and distribute new print editions. Together we can find that right moment, that right drawing or graphic, to right the world. That's the collaborative power of art.

-- Okay, so, that's the advertising. But, I don't want to do cheesy advertising, I just want to make new images. Under the alaVoid name, there's a lot I can do with your contributions: new drawings and graphics, more print editions, posters, stickers, a new website with social media and, with enough new work finished, new books. Contribute as you can, and I'll continue my adbusting battle through graphics that mock cheesy advertising and even cheesier corporate civilization. Of course art can't save the world, but it can decorate it.

Sincerely, William

P.S. You can order with PayPal or a credit card.

All prints are made by the giclee process and are on acid-free, high quality paper and are signed and numbered in editions of 100 prints by me in graphite.

With a $5 contribution you get a 4" alien head sticker from the original factory. These stickers are on heavy weather-resistant vinyl.

With a $25 contribution you get an 11"x14" signed, limited edition graphic print. Click the Gallery tab at the top to see a larger image of this print.

With a $30 contribution you get an 11"x14" signed, limited edition drawing print. Click the Gallery tab at the top to see a larger image of this print

 

With a $50 contribution you get a 16"x20" signed, limited edition print of your choice from this edition or, with a contribution of $250 you get all six 16"x20" signed prints from this edition. If ordering one print, please indicate your choice by name with your order. Click the Gallery tab at the top to see larger images of these prints.

With a $100 contribution you get a 16"x20" signed, limited edition print of your choice from this edition or, with a contribution of $500 you get all six 16"x20" signed prints from this edition . If ordering one print, please indicate your choice by name with your order. Click the Gallery tab at the top to see larger images of these prints.

The alaVoid Facebook Page

 A Wikipedia Article About My Work

World Operations Manual Video

Schwa Animation Demos

The alaVoid Website

story:
Overview

Evil Witch Allie is a young adult comic series about a little girl with an enchanted book and the three hapless teens who get sucked into her magically destructive wake.

This campaign will raise funds to print the second volume in the series: Evil Witch Allie And The Book Of Secrets.

But it’s easier to show than to tell you:

 

Sample Pages

 

So Who Are You, Anyway?

Hi! My name is Kristin Tipping. I’m a queer comic artist living in Minneapolis. I’ve been published through Uncivilized Books and was a recipient of the 2019 Artist Initiative Grant. I make a lot of strangely endearing bittersweet work full of fluffy animals, queer feelings and existential dread. 

Evil Witch Allie was inspired by a lot of the comics and shows I experienced growing up, like XXX Holic and Natsume Yuujinchou as well as my own experiences growing up queer in a small town. I enjoyed the blend of character drama, whimsy, and danger those stories provided, and I wanted to write a story about queer and marginalized characters that doesn’t define the characters by those aspects of themselves. 

The comic started as my thesis project in art school and has since mutated into it’s own series. I’m posting the pages online as I finish them and collecting each story arc into a print volume as I complete it. The new volume will include all of the second story arc and an exclusive bonus comic at the end. 

 

Budget and Timeline

The goal for this campaign is $1600. All money raised will go towards printing, IndieGoGo fees and shipping materials. 

The good new timeline wise is that all 140 pages of Book Of Secrets are done! So you won’t have to worry about waiting around for me to finish the book. It’s already finished! 

Right now I’m hesitantly planning to get all the rewards shipped out in July. However, given the times we live in I can’t promise there won’t be shipping delays. I'll keep you updated on any timeline changes as they arise.

 

Sample Copies

 

 

Stretch Goals

I’m keeping it simple. The book already includes one exclusive bonus comic. I'll add a new mini for every $100 over the funding goal up to a total of five comics. Over that and we’ll unlock more, secret, stretch goals!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute to this campaign, it’s okay! There are still a bunch of ways you can help, both monetary and otherwise. 

If you would like to throw some money at me, but don’t want to do it through Indiegogo for whatever reason, you can always buy me a coffee or become a Patreon supporter. 

And if you want to help me in a non-financial way you can do so by following me on social media, (Twitter: @KristinTipping, Facebook: @KristinTippingArt, Instagram: @kristintipping) reading Evil Witch Allie online, recommending it to your friends, or just leaving a nice message in the comments section of the comic. I’m not sure how much that  last one actually helps make Allie more popular, but it makes me feel good. 

 

Attribution 

Music in the promo video is Riding Countryside by Youth Faire.
story_txt:
Overview
Evil Witch Allie is a young adult comic series about a little girl with an enchanted book and the three hapless teens who get sucked into her magically destructive wake.
This campaign will raise funds to print the second volume in the series: Evil Witch Allie And The Book Of Secrets.
But it’s easier to show than to tell you:
 
Sample Pages




 
So Who Are You, Anyway?
Hi! My name is Kristin Tipping. I’m a queer comic artist living in Minneapolis. I’ve been published through Uncivilized Books and was a recipient of the 2019 Artist Initiative Grant. I make a lot of strangely endearing bittersweet work full of fluffy animals, queer feelings and existential dread. 
Evil Witch Allie was inspired by a lot of the comics and shows I experienced growing up, like XXX Holic and Natsume Yuujinchou as well as my own experiences growing up queer in a small town. I enjoyed the blend of character drama, whimsy, and danger those stories provided, and I wanted to write a story about queer and marginalized characters that doesn’t define the characters by those aspects of themselves. 
The comic started as my thesis project in art school and has since mutated into it’s own series. I’m posting the pages online as I finish them and collecting each story arc into a print volume as I complete it. The new volume will include all of the second story arc and an exclusive bonus comic at the end. 
 
Budget and Timeline
The goal for this campaign is $1600. All money raised will go towards printing, IndieGoGo fees and shipping materials. 
The good new timeline wise is that all 140 pages of Book Of Secrets are done! So you won’t have to worry about waiting around for me to finish the book. It’s already finished! 
Right now I’m hesitantly planning to get all the rewards shipped out in July. However, given the times we live in I can’t promise there won’t be shipping delays. I'll keep you updated on any timeline changes as they arise.
 
Sample Copies

 


 
Stretch Goals
I’m keeping it simple. The book already includes one exclusive bonus comic. I'll add a new mini for every $100 over the funding goal up to a total of five comics. Over that and we’ll unlock more, secret, stretch goals!
 
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute to this campaign, it’s okay! There are still a bunch of ways you can help, both monetary and otherwise. 
If you would like to throw some money at me, but don’t want to do it through Indiegogo for whatever reason, you can always buy me a coffee or become a Patreon supporter. 
And if you want to help me in a non-financial way you can do so by following me on social media, (Twitter: @KristinTipping, Facebook: @KristinTippingArt, Instagram: @kristintipping) reading Evil Witch Allie online, recommending it to your friends, or just leaving a nice message in the comments section of the comic. I’m not sure how much that  last one actually helps make Allie more popular, but it makes me feel good. 
 
Attribution 
Music in the promo video is Riding Countryside by Youth Faire.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
THIS IS ESSENTIALLY A PRE-ORDER.

THIS IS AN ALL OR NOTHING CAMPAIGN. FUNDS WILL ONLY BE DEPOSITED IF THE MINIMUM GOAL OF $3500 IS REACHED. 

IF THE GOAL ISN'T REACHED, ALL CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY REFUNDED.

PLEASE, DO NOT WAIT TO CONTRIBUTE!

Featuring A god-like anti-hero, a psychotic sister bent on domination and a marauding Zombie Werewolf! 

Hello, my name is Rob Sacchetto and I’ve been an illustrator and freelance artist for over 25 years. You might know me from www.ZombiePortraits.com, a project that allows me to create original zombie-themed artwork on a daily basis. Or maybe you’ve seen one of my many zombie related artwork appearances in magazines, newspapers, blogs and television? That exposure has allowed me to do something I love for a living and for that I am very grateful.

But, before and throughout all my zombie adventures, I’ve always been a comic book nerd.

A million years ago I sold my first comic book collection to buy my first car. Since that regrettable day, I’ve been slowly reclaiming that collection. But I've also grown more and more obsessed with my own comic book project. 

Over 15 years ago I conceived the idea that would eventually become Cape Fear. What was initially intended as a comic book mini-series has grown into a complete 150 page graphic novel. It is a project that is on the cusp of completion. I just need a little extra support before I can unleash my creation upon the world.

Specifically, I want your support. I’ve opted to enter into the crowd-sourcing route because I want to directly engage the people who will read Cape Fear. I want you to feel like part of the process, to share in its success and I want to be able to offer you great perks and rewards in addition to what I think is a dynamite graphic novel.

THE STORY

Cape FearCape Fear is unlike anything you’ve ever read. It will definitely appeal to fans of horror and, although the characters display heroic qualities, Cape Fear is anything but a superhero comic.

After a quarter century of avid reading, I feel I am finally telling the kind of story that has all the elements I’ve always enjoyed. Beyond my fondness for monsters, sexy chicks and aliens, (which have all incorporated into Cape Fear), I have penned a tale which is both multi-layered, and complex – without being convoluted.

Cape Fear stars Fear itself, manifested as a physical ‘godlike’ creature. Fear’s physical presence on earth is necessary only in extreme circumstances. Instances in which there is such a profound imbalance in power that it threatens the continued existence of mankind.

Recently, Fear has found himself needed on earth much too often.

Without giving too much away, Fear embodies a host whose personal life becomes affected by his curse. Fear’s sister Nyxia returns from hundreds of years of exile scheming to usurp Fear and a Zombie Werewolf tears through the pages of the book.

 

WHAT I NEED

Actually, what I need is your support! The Cape Fear graphic novel is almost complete. It was created without outside funding or grants. It was created out of dedication to a dream and a real desire to create something new that encompasses everything I always wanted to see in a comic book without compromises. It’s taken close to 15 years, but we’ve almost there.  

This is an all or nothing campaign, together we must meet the goal.

100% of the illustrations and layout are complete and 90% of the graphic novel is lettered. We are so close!

100% of your contribution goes towards the professional printing of a 150 page black and white standard size graphic novel. I’ve come to an agreement with KaBoom Comics, an industry leader in comic book printing, that will ensure a top quality final product. Your funding dollars will also go towards the digitization of the final graphic novel.

Your interest may result in more comic books or graphic novels in this or other series. Together, we can do great things.

WHAT YOU GET!

Cape Fear is a full and complete story that was originally conceived as a four issue comic book mini-series. It has been combined into one incredible tale.

You will receive a number of great perks for contributing to the Cape Fear cause. From a handshake to final original artwork - there is something for everyone who contributes.

Digital versions of Cape Fear will be available on all major platforms including Kindle Fire, NOOK,iPhone + iPad, Android Tablets + Phones and Kodo. Digitization will be prfessionally handled by Graphicly - specialist in digital media.

Print copies of Cape Fear will be professionally printed by industry leaders KaBoom and will feature full color cover artwork and rich black and white interiors. They will be delivered to your door.

Other rewards include personalized artwork from Zombie Portraits, custom illustrations by Rob Sacchetto as well original artwork from the comic book itself!

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Pledge you support! If not financially, then by spreading the word. Join the official Rob Sacchetto Cape Fear Facebook page and then share, share share. I really appreciate all of your support and I know this is a project we can complete together!

Delivery dates will be prompt and defined once this campaign is underway! Expect plenty of updates!

story:
Hello!

We are Ann "Chezhnian" Kennedy and Eren Fitzgerald, the creator/writer and co-writer/artist of an epic fantasy webcomic, Tamuran.  Through this campaign we hope to raise funds to help us get book 1 of our comic - the first seven chapters - into print.  

What is Tamuran?

Tamuran is the story of a kingdom besieged by the forces of an ancient enemy and betrayed from within. It follows the journey of four unlikely individuals whose lives get tangled up in this plot, and who, despite their differences, shortcomings, and secrets, may be the kingdom's only hope for survival. On the way they must deal with friends, enemies, family, monsters, dragons, shapeshifters, necromancers, nature spirits.. and their own inner demons.  

The story of Tamuran started out as a chat-based roleplay set in a world Chezhnian had been developing for many years, as a fun way for some old friends to keep in touch.  In the four years since we started writing, it has developed and grown beyond that - into an epic story spanning multiple plot threads and many, many characters.

Since January 2010 we have been publishing Tamuran online as a webcomic, updating with a new page ever Tuesday and Friday.  So far we've posted nearly 8 chapters - roughly 250 pages. You can read the comic at  tamurancomic.com. 

(Please note that Tamuran is recommended for teenaged readers and up, as it contains some coarse language and violence.)

What are we doing here?

It has long been our dream to see Tamuan printed, and with your help on this campaign we've got the chance to make that happen.

The books we're planning to print will be 6x9" perfect-bound paperbacks with around 240 pages.  They'll contain the prologue through Chapter 7 of the comic, fixed up and retouched, plus some fun extras like a map of Tamuran, extra bonus artwork, character profiles, and "directors' commentary" notes. We would like to have the books printed and ready to debut at Ohayocon in January.

We are hoping to raise at least $2500 though this campaign to help with the costs of getting these books printed and shipped, registering ISBN numbers, and shipping and materials to get the books to you. If we raise more than our goal, we'll increase the number of books in our print run. If we should VASTLY surpass our goal, any money we raise beyond what we need for printing, shipping, taxes and fees, and rewards for our contributors, we will put toward the costs of things like maintaining our website and creating more comic pages, helping us to make convention appearances to get our books out there and meet more of our readers, and printing Book 2 once chapters 8 through 12 are completed.

What's in it for you?

Please check out our list of pledge levels and rewards & goodies along the sidebar.  ALL contributions are appreciated, and all contributors will receive access to behind-the-scenes updates and sneak peeks into the development of the books and extras, as well as a thank-you shoutout on Twitter and Facebook.  International contributors, please remember to add $10 to your pledge to help cover shipping costs. 

Here are a few of the fun things you can pledge for:

*PLEASE NOTE* - The Elkstravaganza! perk includes everything at the $50 level - we just forgot to add it in the description! 

Update! New perks:

These are loose leaf teas inspired by the main characters of Tamuran, made with certified organic ingredients (and natural flavoring in one case). They're specially designed by us - they taste AWESOME, in our opinion - and manufactured by Gardens by Grace, LLC - the organic herb & tea shop where Eren (and sometimes Chezhnian) work. At the $70 tier you'll get a 1oz bag of each of the four teas (and instructions for brewing), along with your signed, sketched book and the other goodies listed at the $50 level. OR, for contributions at the $15 perk level or higher, you can UPGRADE your perk to include one or more teas - just add $5 for each tea you want and send us a note when you pledge to let us know. 

Here are the different teas:

Royal Blue Tea (Ranon's tea)
A warm, spicy blueberry-crumble blend of red rooibos with cinnamon, dried blueberries, vanilla and natural blueberry flavoring (Ranon loves blueberry).

Mystical Garden Tea (Kip's tea)
Exotic combination of mango ceylon black tea with rose petals and safflower. Sweet and unique, lemur-approved.

Dark Forest Chai Tea (Varony's tea)
Yerba mate with cinnamon, chai spices, and lapsang souchung black tea. Dark and mysterious with a hint of smoky flavor.

Sylvan Lore Tea (Nashua's tea) 
Green tea with lemon balm, lemongrass, basil, and a touch of spearmint. Smooth and refreshing. 

HOW TO ADD TO YOUR CONTRIBUTION, if you've already contributed:

Just make a second contribution for the amount you want to add and select the "no perk" option, then note us to tell us what teas you want. IE, if you already pledged $15 and want two teas, make a second contribution for $10 (NOT $25). If you're overseas and have already covered your $10 for international shipping, you don't have to worry about adding the shipping cost again.

Other ways you can help

Spread the word!  You can use the "share" tools at the top of this page, or just plain tell your friends about our comic.  Know any fantasy fans who'd like something new to read? Point them in the direction of our website!  Anything you can do to help us get our campaign out there is very much appreciated.

story:
So...you're doing a book? What's it about?

My name's Anne and I'm an artist based in Western MA. I started an autobio comic in 1995 called booty to document my day-to-day life after finishing college, going to work in the woods for a little while, and then on to graduate school.
 
The twist in the story, because there's always a twist in the story, is that I did all of these things before I turned 21. I dropped out of high school in 1991 to start at a tiny college in the woods in Great Barrington called Simon's Rock College of Bard, where for the first time in my life someone told me I was smart, where I met people who were like me, where I learned and fell in love and finally saw possibility in my life.
 
You might or might not know that school for other reasons. The next year, in December of 1992, a classmate of mine bought an AK-47, got bullets in the mail, and shot his way through the snowy campus. He murdered two people, injured more, and changed the arc of my life.

What You Don't Get is my first long-form comic work and it's a vastly different project for me for a few reasons. It's a project I've planned to undertake for a number of years, but the timing wasn't right, or the story wasn't done, or I just wasn't ready to write it.

I'm ready now.

What's with the title?

There's a long tradition of professional mourners. In Ireland, they were women called "keeners" who were paid to mourn over a body. One story involves a priest and a particularly loud keening woman who made her living by mourning the dead.

At one point in the story, the priest turns to her and says, unkindly, "You'd cry over a dead dog if they paid you enough."

"There's no need to be so bitter, Father," she apparently fired back. "What you don't get from the living you get from the dead."

And that's something I think about a great deal: what do I get from my dead? How are they present in my living? What You Don't Get is basically about both of those questions. In the months after the shootings I became a relentless journaller, writing everything down instead of speaking to other people. Reading back though those journals, it's like someone else wrote them. In the years since, I've written comics about those same questions -- not only on anniversaries or birthdays, or some other day that always felt too bittersweet-- but every time there was some new terrifying news report about some other mass shooting somewhere, more murders in schools. This project is a way to tie these disconnected experiences together as part of a longer, larger story about life and grief and losing people you love, but also about living and surviving and what those things mean.

What I Need & What You Get

Otherwise known as the money stuff...

After research and discussion with many other artists, I decided to publish with Lulu.com because of their flexible publication options. My goal is to do a signed and numbered first printing of between 150 and 200 books, to have stock to bring to various shows and distribution networks and also to get the books to my backers. Each book will likely cost about $6 to produce -- about $900 to about $1200 depending on final page counts (between 100 and 128 digest-size pages is my projection) and total final copies.

$400 of this campaign will cover the cost of the lengthy and tedious process of converting the 100+ drawn pages into a digital format. In the interest of finishing in a timely fashion, I'm getting some help from a fellow artist on this one, because I just don't have enough technical know-how yet and I want to support another working artist while I learn.

The last $400 of this proposal covers the assorted shipping costs of getting books to me and then getting the books to you (postage will cost about $3 per copy in the US) and various other expenses (mailers, promotional material, sample copies, fundraising fees, etc.) associated with printing a long form book and crowdsourcing the funding.

Perks!

Everyone loves perks. I wanted to do a combination of cool things and essential things. A hand made card isn't essential, but it's important -- and even though this project is going to be hard and heartbreaking and difficult, it's exciting to be able to actually be in a place where I can do it and I want to celebrate that -- so the perks are both practical and quirky.

What if...

I want to finish this book no matter what happens with the fundraising. So even if I don't hit my minimum needed, which is probably about $700, there will still be something in your mailbox. I want to use this opportunity as a way to force me to finish this project and quit stalling; that accountability is a major part of why I chose the flexible funding option rather than the fixed all-or-nothing funding option.

The Impact

This project is something I intend to complete within the next 45 days, which is also the duration of my fundraising campaign. As part of one of the perks, I'm completing a panel-a-day minicomic basically about the experience of getting the project going. What You Don't Get is also going to be my full-time project for the next 45 days and my intent is to come out of the end of that 45 days with a finished book, no matter what happens with the funding.

But I'd be really, really excited if it got fully funded. I have some ideas where money raised beyond what I need might go (most specifically a Best of Booty book collection), but we can talk about those things when we get there.

EDIT: Well, we're there!

In the works is a best of booty collection. Booty's my autobio comic that I've been writing since 1995; I did one collection covering issues 10 through 17 some time ago, but I've been looking to get something more recent together (and if I sell through those last 18 pre-order copies, it's gonna happen for sure).
 
I'm working up some cool odds & ends, including some small things to add into everyone's perks. Once the final copy is done, I'm going to scan through and pick out some images to put on 1-inch pins and little vinyl stickers -- fun perks for everyone!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, you can still help. Sharing the link among your social networks to get the word out is incredibly helpful. Reading this far is helpful too; it's a new experience for me to talk this openly not just about my work but also about my past and my process. I'll update this site with sketches and news as the project moves forward so you can stay in touch and watch how it goes.

thanks, folks.

Anne
story_txt:
So...you're doing a book? What's it about?

My name's Anne and I'm an artist based in Western MA. I started an autobio comic in 1995 called booty to document my day-to-day life after finishing college, going to work in the woods for a little while, and then on to graduate school.
 
The twist in the story, because there's always a twist in the story, is that I did all of these things before I turned 21. I dropped out of high school in 1991 to start at a tiny college in the woods in Great Barrington called Simon's Rock College of Bard, where for the first time in my life someone told me I was smart, where I met people who were like me, where I learned and fell in love and finally saw possibility in my life.
 
You might or might not know that school for other reasons. The next year, in December of 1992, a classmate of mine bought an AK-47, got bullets in the mail, and shot his way through the snowy campus. He murdered two people, injured more, and changed the arc of my life.What You Don't Get is my first long-form comic work and it's a vastly different project for me for a few reasons. It's a project I've planned to undertake for a number of years, but the timing wasn't right, or the story wasn't done, or I just wasn't ready to write it.
I'm ready now.
What's with the title?
There's a long tradition of professional mourners. In Ireland, they were women called "keeners" who were paid to mourn over a body. One story involves a priest and a particularly loud keening woman who made her living by mourning the dead.
At one point in the story, the priest turns to her and says, unkindly, "You'd cry over a dead dog if they paid you enough."
"There's no need to be so bitter, Father," she apparently fired back. "What you don't get from the living you get from the dead."
And that's something I think about a great deal: what do I get from my dead? How are they present in my living? What You Don't Get is basically about both of those questions. In the months after the shootings I became a relentless journaller, writing everything down instead of speaking to other people. Reading back though those journals, it's like someone else wrote them. In the years since, I've written comics about those same questions -- not only on anniversaries or birthdays, or some other day that always felt too bittersweet-- but every time there was some new terrifying news report about some other mass shooting somewhere, more murders in schools. This project is a way to tie these disconnected experiences together as part of a longer, larger story about life and grief and losing people you love, but also about living and surviving and what those things mean.
What I Need & What You Get


Otherwise known as the money stuff...
After research and discussion with many other artists, I decided to publish with Lulu.com because of their flexible publication options. My goal is to do a signed and numbered first printing of between 150 and 200 books, to have stock to bring to various shows and distribution networks and also to get the books to my backers. Each book will likely cost about $6 to produce -- about $900 to about $1200 depending on final page counts (between 100 and 128 digest-size pages is my projection) and total final copies.
$400 of this campaign will cover the cost of the lengthy and tedious process of converting the 100+ drawn pages into a digital format. In the interest of finishing in a timely fashion, I'm getting some help from a fellow artist on this one, because I just don't have enough technical know-how yet and I want to support another working artist while I learn.
The last $400 of this proposal covers the assorted shipping costs of getting books to me and then getting the books to you (postage will cost about $3 per copy in the US) and various other expenses (mailers, promotional material, sample copies, fundraising fees, etc.) associated with printing a long form book and crowdsourcing the funding.
Perks!
Everyone loves perks. I wanted to do a combination of cool things and essential things. A hand made card isn't essential, but it's important -- and even though this project is going to be hard and heartbreaking and difficult, it's exciting to be able to actually be in a place where I can do it and I want to celebrate that -- so the perks are both practical and quirky.
What if...
I want to finish this book no matter what happens with the fundraising. So even if I don't hit my minimum needed, which is probably about $700, there will still be something in your mailbox. I want to use this opportunity as a way to force me to finish this project and quit stalling; that accountability is a major part of why I chose the flexible funding option rather than the fixed all-or-nothing funding option.
The Impact
This project is something I intend to complete within the next 45 days, which is also the duration of my fundraising campaign. As part of one of the perks, I'm completing a panel-a-day minicomic basically about the experience of getting the project going. What You Don't Get is also going to be my full-time project for the next 45 days and my intent is to come out of the end of that 45 days with a finished book, no matter what happens with the funding.
But I'd be really, really excited if it got fully funded. I have some ideas where money raised beyond what I need might go (most specifically a Best of Booty book collection), but we can talk about those things when we get there.
EDIT: Well, we're there!
In the works is a best of booty collection. Booty's my autobio comic that I've been writing since 1995; I did one collection covering issues 10 through 17 some time ago, but I've been looking to get something more recent together (and if I sell through those last 18 pre-order copies, it's gonna happen for sure).
 
I'm working up some cool odds & ends, including some small things to add into everyone's perks. Once the final copy is done, I'm going to scan through and pick out some images to put on 1-inch pins and little vinyl stickers -- fun perks for everyone!

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't donate, you can still help. Sharing the link among your social networks to get the word out is incredibly helpful. Reading this far is helpful too; it's a new experience for me to talk this openly not just about my work but also about my past and my process. I'll update this site with sketches and news as the project moves forward so you can stay in touch and watch how it goes.
thanks, folks.
Anne

story:
Hello and welcome to the Indiegogo campaign for Average Jo #2. My name is John Pross and I'm the owner of a small Indie Comic Company. I'm the writer/creator of the books. The hard stuff I leave to my talented teams, most of whom are based in the Philippines. We currently have 4 books out with four more hopefully coming out this year including Posers #2, Average Jo #2, Slugger #1, and Demonic #1. Now for the book.

Average Jo is a 6 issue limited series about an ordinary Filipino-American cop who is trying to police the city of Eden which has the densest population of people with powers in the United States. Average Jo # 1 introduced us to the city of Eden where the police have become little more than crowd controllers anytime a crime involving a person with powers takes place. The mayor has outsourced this policing to a private organization of mercenaries in fear of having the city sued numerous times from people being injured from the super people brawls that have become a common occurrence in Eden. After being publicly embarrassed at work and being one upped by his ex-wife's new husband at his daughter's birthday Jo is reluctantly dragged to the bar by his partner Paul. His night starts looking promising as he saves a woman from some thugs and she takes him back to her hotel to thank him. Jo realizes a little too late that this is the woman they have nicknamed Gingerblast, a super powered serial killer who is known for killing her partners at the height of their sexual encounters.

This made regardless of the outcome of the campaign but every dollar helps us make the book quicker and helps get more copies out there. Even if you can't donate, sharing is a great way to help this project out. Now for a sneak peek at some pages and some of the rewards

Cover by Emil Cabaltierra and Martin Hernandez Tena

Cover by Harvey Tolibao and Ula Mos

 

 

Print of Jo

Page Average Jo #2

Print of Cricket

Print of Paul

Print of Gingerblast

Print of Gingerblast

story:
Update 10/19: The new campaign is now also over, but you can still check out the campaign page and (pre)order all the stuff by sending a mail to preorders@donrosaclassics.com.

Update 9/7: Exciting news! The third and final book in this Classics series is happening. Please visit http://www.indiegogo.com/donrosa-art?a=148782 - you can also preorder all stuff from this campaign there (while stocks last)! 

Who Is This Don Rosa Guy And What Are His “Classics”?

You might know Don Rosa for his Eisner Award winning work on Uncle $crooge and Donald Duck comics, but even before he started working with those world famous characters, he was a well-known comic book artist. His creator-owned strip series, “The Pertwillaby Papers,” started in the newspaper of his college, and was later continued in a fanzine. A second series with the main character Lance Pertwillaby, now transformed into the superhero parody “Captain Kentucky,” followed in a local newspaper later on. For more images of both characters, see our “Updates” and “Gallery” tabs.

What Are the Strips About?

In case you've never read them, here's a quick synopsis: The Pertwillaby Papers are about the adventures of Lancelot “Lance” Pertwillaby and his friends and colleagues around the world. The adventures start with the political satire of Lance's admittance into college and his life there, and a treasure hunt to the Andes in search of the Inca temple of Manco Cápac. Afterwards, Lance, together with his friends and enemies, is searching for the sizeable art collection hidden in the North Pole by the Nazis, and in another story they find and capture a black hole, and travel to the centre of the Earth. Finally, there's a story in which Lance is sent to King Arthur's time. As for Captain Kentucky, it's a sequel of sorts to the Pertwillaby Papers, featuring Lance becoming the superhero parody Captain Kentucky. Lance has taken up job as a newspaper journalist in Louisville, Kentucky, and due to toxic waste being dumped into a sewer where he was happening to be writing a story, he discovers that by drinking the toxic waste, he is temporarily given super-powers. He salvages a large barrel and keeps a small vial of it on his person, in case of an emergency. The strip often features real events and local celebrities from Louisville and Kentucky as backdrops, or, occasionally, as supporting characters in storylines.

What's With These New Books?

While there have been a few reprint editions of those two classic Rosa series, the only book set that featured the complete run of them in English was a hardcover version published in Norway in 2001. This old edition has been out of print for quite some time now, and to celebrate Don's return to Germany this fall (he'll be doing a signing tour sometime around September/October), a new deluxe edition, consisting of two hardback volumes, is in the works to be sold before and during his signings. However, as the printer has to be paid before the books go out to the readers, this campaign was started to secure the production. The project is being organized by Jano Rohleder, a longtime friend of Don Rosa's, who is also the German editor/translator of his Duck work. Therefore, it's a given that the books will aim at the highest possible quality standard.

Why Should I Contribute?

This will be a hardback edition of probably about 350 to 500 copies each (depending on how many preorders come in), and only available while stocks last. Contribute at least $35 and lock your copie(s) in right now, even if you're living outside of Germany and can't attend the signing tour. Free shipping (to everywhere) is included! Or, if you don't want the books themselves, you can also get some exclusive Rosa goodies by contributing -- see the list on the right. Contributors will also get a thank you credit in the book!

What Others Say:

  • “Very funny!”
    – Scott McCloud
  • “The Pertwillaby Papers is great, great stuff! They’re Wonderful!”
    – Kurt Busiek
  • “One of my all-time favorite cartoonists.”
    – Ed Brubaker

And don't forget: Spread the word! :)

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Shipping to My Country Included?

Yes! Free shipping to anywhere in the world is included in your contribution!

Which Language Will the Books Be In?

The books will be all English (the comics as well as the bonus features).

What Will the Comics Look Like?

The strips will be presented in their original black and white. They were designed by Don to be printed in black and white (as they appeared in newspapers and fanzines), and will look excellent printed on high quality art paper. We'll use thicker paper than any edition of these strips has ever before!

What Size Can We Expect?

The books will be about A4 size, maybe slightly bigger. While the Pertwillaby Papers will have the regular “portrait” A4 page orientation (21 cm × 29,7 cm = 8.27 × 11.69 inches), the Captain Kentucky book will be presented in “landscape” orientation, due to the “sunday strip” format of the CK comics (29,7 cm × 21 cm = 11.69 × 8.27 inches).

Is Don Rosa Himself Involved?

Yes, Don will act as an advisor and oversee every stage of the books before they are printed. He'll also write a new introduction for both books.

Will There Be Bonus Features?

Yes, absolutely! We'll include a whole lot of articles, old ads, fandrawings etc. as well as a promotional episode of the Pertwillaby Papers that hasn't been reprinted in English ever before! Oh, and we'll also include the whole run of Don's short-lived newspaper strip, “Phalanx,” an adventure-comedy like “Asterix,” set in old Greece, that never made it to the papers! And you know what? There's even more to come! Watch our “Updates” tab above to see all bonus feature information as they come in!

story:
Summary

DISorder is a series of full color graphic novels created by Daniel Murrell.

DISorder  is a Comedy that is about a group of friends that are also a support group, geared towards helping each other get through day to day life with their quirky  personality disorders


I have spent countless hours working on this project and currently the first book is a quarter of the way finished!

The story follows therapy sessions between a man named Jackson Smith and his therapist Dr Rosenberg. Jackson is a push over, who after years of abuse, has developed a violent alter ego named Duane. Jackson is determined to work through his issues and rid himself of Duane via therapy with Dr Rosenberg. He also hopes to achieve this through his support group of friends, who all have their own personality disorders. The series will be centered around the many stories told to Dr. Rosenberg about Jackson’s everyday life with his group of quirky friends.

 WHO IS WORKING ON THIS PROJECT 

This graphic novel is created by Daniel Murrell who is an Illustrator/Entertainer. Daniel has been drawing his entire life and has attended many specialized schools for art as well as plenty of illustration courses. Currently Daniel is working on getting a degree in illustration. Over the years he has been commissioned through his website and referrals to work on custom art work and in addition, has sold his works at local comic book conventions. Daniel’s creative and imaginative art work is always evolving and he loves to find creative and innovative ways to express his works.  He also loves acting, more specifically the field of comedy, so this book is a perfect fit.

What We Need & What You Get

DISorder will only become a reality with your much needed assistance. Our goal is a minimum of $7000. This money will cover artist’s fees, marketing, and promotion of the book as well as the great incentives you will receive for your support, which we offer as a thank you for your faith in our vision as well as helping us make this project happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody can contribute but you can always help me spread the word and get this project out there! So please feel free to spread this link around to your family and friends!

story:
In May, when the days grow long,
The sound of distant birdsong enchants me
And when I am parted from her
My mind turns to my distant love.

(Jaufré Rudel)

 

IN ABSENTIA

Hi, I’m Cecilia Latella, an Italian comic book artist. I’m known online as cabepfir. Maybe you have seen some of my fanarts around, or have read some of my comics.

It is with great pleasure that I want to introduce you my new project, IN ABSENTIA. It’s a 24-pages comic written, drawn and coloured by me, set in an imaginary XIII century Italy. I’ve written this story one year ago and now I’m finally ready to go.

By founding this campaign, you will support me while I draw these pages and help all the oher readers to be able to read it, as it will be released FOR FREE on the net:

- on my blog,

- on deviantArt;

- on smackjeeves.

The first three pages will be online on October 1st.

Thank you so very much!

I shall be wretched and sorrowful when I leave,
If I do not see this distant love.
I do not know when I shall see her,
For our homelands are so far distant. (Jaufré Rudel)

1200$ means 50$ a page, or 39€ if you prefer. You’ll help me to keep going on this project and sustain the time I spend in drawing, inking, colouring and lettering IN ABSENTIA and uploading it online. Be my collective commissioners in this project!

IN ABSENTIA to be a story about silence and incommunicability. The two main characters live together in a relatively small place, yet never come to a deeper understanding. I wish IN ABSENTIA to be a comic of feelings and atmosphere, enjoyable by everybody who loves comics, the Middle Ages, and unspoken sentiments.

But that which I desire is so contrary to me
For my stepfather set this fate upon me:
That I should love, but not be loved. (Jaufré Rudel)

Please share the word and support this project to come true!
