story:
The Story

This campaign will bring issue 3 of our 5 issue series to print, just as prior campaigns successfully did for Issues 1 and 2. 

Death took our penciler, Lovalle Davis, in April of last year. Here is the team that brought you issue 3: 

Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): This is my passion project. As I search for meaning and purpose in my own life, I often reflect on what it must have been like to serve one horrible regime in order to fight another. The story of Lilya Litvyak speaks to me, and this project allows me to share her story with others.

Jake Bilbao (Penciler) is a freelance Comic book Artist that has worked on titles like Bloodrayne, Pathfinder, Wolverine.

Diana Greenhalgh (Editor / Inker): Living in Vancouver, Diana has done work for IDW, Marvel, and Upper Deck. 

Blond the Colorist: Industry veteran colorist from series such as Superman, Green Lanterns, and Red Hood & The Outlaws.

Issue 3 finds our two main characters, Katya and Lilya, fighting for their lives over the skies of Stalingrad against an enemy that is better equipped, better trained, and more experienced.  

 Why this project?

I have always had a strange fascination with self-destructive genius. Those people who have amazing ability to create and influence, but can't seem to find any compelling reason for their own existence. 

n fiction, we cloak these figures in noble ambitions towards unrealistic ideals and often give them superhuman powers to defy the odds. Inevitably, these stories become a quest for redemption measured in the number of times the day got saved. But what if it was your self-destructive nature itself that was your superpower?

This story finds Lydia Litvyak, the White Lily of Stalingrad, falling further and further into the grip of her own death wish. And yet, it is that disregard for her own safety that makes her such a fearsome opponent. 

It is in her story that I have found the quintessential tortured genius. 

Who will like this comic?

Obviously if you enjoy war comics, particularly ones set on the Eastern Front like Sara, then this book will appeal to you. 

If you want to see strong female characters fighting to prove their worth in a male dominated society, you will love this story. 

If you struggle with a sense of purpose and wonder what any of it means, that is the central question I tackle here. Lilya holds a dark wish to die a war hero, and those who love her try to get her to find the value of her own life. Her rage and self-destructive tendencies cause her to take terrible risks that make her a feared opponent in air-to-air combat.  

Risks and challenges

The comic has already been completed. I printed an advance copy of Phoenix Fan Fusion and just finished a campaign on Kickstarter to bring it to print. This campaign is for those who missed the Kickstarter or simply prefer to use another platform. There are no risks to fulfillment.
story_txt:
The Story
This campaign will bring issue 3 of our 5 issue series to print, just as prior campaigns successfully did for Issues 1 and 2. 
Death took our penciler, Lovalle Davis, in April of last year. Here is the team that brought you issue 3: 
Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): This is my passion project. As I search for meaning and purpose in my own life, I often reflect on what it must have been like to serve one horrible regime in order to fight another. The story of Lilya Litvyak speaks to me, and this project allows me to share her story with others.
Jake Bilbao (Penciler) is a freelance Comic book Artist that has worked on titles like Bloodrayne, Pathfinder, Wolverine.
Diana Greenhalgh (Editor / Inker): Living in Vancouver, Diana has done work for IDW, Marvel, and Upper Deck. 
Blond the Colorist: Industry veteran colorist from series such as Superman, Green Lanterns, and Red Hood & The Outlaws.
Issue 3 finds our two main characters, Katya and Lilya, fighting for their lives over the skies of Stalingrad against an enemy that is better equipped, better trained, and more experienced.  
 Why this project?I have always had a strange fascination with self-destructive genius. Those people who have amazing ability to create and influence, but can't seem to find any compelling reason for their own existence. n fiction, we cloak these figures in noble ambitions towards unrealistic ideals and often give them superhuman powers to defy the odds. Inevitably, these stories become a quest for redemption measured in the number of times the day got saved. But what if it was your self-destructive nature itself that was your superpower?This story finds Lydia Litvyak, the White Lily of Stalingrad, falling further and further into the grip of her own death wish. And yet, it is that disregard for her own safety that makes her such a fearsome opponent. It is in her story that I have found the quintessential tortured genius. Who will like this comic?Obviously if you enjoy war comics, particularly ones set on the Eastern Front like Sara, then this book will appeal to you. If you want to see strong female characters fighting to prove their worth in a male dominated society, you will love this story. If you struggle with a sense of purpose and wonder what any of it means, that is the central question I tackle here. Lilya holds a dark wish to die a war hero, and those who love her try to get her to find the value of her own life. Her rage and self-destructive tendencies cause her to take terrible risks that make her a feared opponent in air-to-air combat.  Risks and challengesThe comic has already been completed. I printed an advance copy of Phoenix Fan Fusion and just finished a campaign on Kickstarter to bring it to print. This campaign is for those who missed the Kickstarter or simply prefer to use another platform. There are no risks to fulfillment.

story:
A magyar leíráshoz lapozz az angol szöveg végére /
Scroll down for the Hungarian description
 

IMPORTANT NOTICE: The book includes 18+ content
Blood / Violence / Nudity / Sexual behaviour / Bad language

Now that the campaign ended with success, all stretch goals were unlocked during the campaign, and the printed copies with 150 full color pages were delivered to our contributors, we want to give you even more!

We want to continue the story of the Fallen Ones, so we decided to open up 5 post-campaign stretch goals. Reaching each goal will extend the the story with one extra episode on 30 full color pages. Are you ready to bring this story to the next level?

Then grab the Digital Comic Book perk, get the 150 pages comic book and an awesome wallpaper, and finally, get excited for what is to come after the end… By purchasing this post-campaign perk, you will also receive all digital content unlocked as Post-Campaign Stretch Goals, while you also give us the opportunity to continue the story of the Fallen Ones. Thank you!

Sharing means more value for your money
Want to read Fallen Ones 2 and get it for free? Share this with your friends who love comics. The more people buy this digital comic book, the more Fallen Ones 2 content you will get for your contribution as we unlock the post-campaign stretch goals below. So help us spread the word about this campaign and make it a win for both of us. With every share you will get closer to getting more value for your money.

Share this campaign on Facebook

An outcast werewolf, a lonely inventor and a beautiful assassin. You would think that they live in separate worlds, having nothing in common - but their fate still brings them together to form an alliance against the scheming of a demonic dark sect. Will the Fallen Ones rise again or are they doomed forever?

Bromm is a lycanthrope, in other words a werewolf, an outlander without a home or a name. Once he was member of a small raiding clan near Germania, until he was banished. Now he’s on the run, without any hope for peace, but a strange voice draws him to a foggy little town on the borders.

Clémence was raised to be a fine prostitute and a skillful assassin at the same time. Her parents were butchered long ago and she was given to slavers. She is about to start a new life when her last mission brings her to a city emerging out of nowhere.

Tobias van Gerwen is an inventor and a spymaster from Kanton. He dedicated his life surveying the blood crystals, and creating wonderful, delicate machines. However, he soon earned the distaste of competing scientist guilds and had to run away with his family. Her wife died on the road and now Tobias and his son are heading to a strange city, hoping to find peace.

The series is set in a dark fantasy universe, the Unseen Domains.

"The old world has perished and armies of the dead are feasting on its carcass."

It is the middle of the 17th century. Magic has awakened, and its deadly impact along with the raging plague of the undead have obliterated Europe, changing the known world forevermore. Entire nations have disappeared, and its people are scattered all over the continent. The old traditions can now only be found at small cultural refuges.

Those who wish to survive must adapt to the age of witch plague. New heroes rise, answering the call of changing times, as creatures long thought to be vanished now crawl out from their lairs. People realize that things thought to be nothing more than myth and superstition have always existed, only their necessary magical sense was missing to see them.

If these times had cartographers, they’d draw very strange maps. Landscapes without borders, only zones around the Haven. Enclosed valleys still capable of sustaining life, and regions less roamed by the undead hordes. Everywhere else is desolation and barren lands- the realm of the dead.

If we couldn’t convince you yet with the above, please let our work convince you instead. The 5 Fallen Ones episodes that the book will include are available to read online as a webcomic: Click here to read them online.

If you like it and want a printed copy delivered to your hands, please select a perk where the book is included. You won’t regret it ;)

We are a small team mostly from Hungary, Europe and we’re the creators of the Unseen Domains dark fantasy universe. Last year we teamed up originally to create a video game but it became much more soon after - the idea started to expand rapidly and we found ourselves working on a webcomic series called the Fallen Ones. And now the time is ripe for a printed edition to sum up the series in one complete fascinating book for an easier read.

Meet our team behind the Fallen Ones comics series:


And finally, if you like the concept and if you find the content worth of sharing with others, please help us spread the word about our comic book. We would love to keep on creating great stuff for you but we need your support to be able to do so. Financial support (e.g buying a copy of the book for yourself) is not the only way of support, sharing our content is also invaluable for our growth.

Thank you for being here and we hope you will enjoy the Fallen Ones dark fantasy comic book! Be safe, for there are numerous horrors lurking in the shadows between the pages ;)
 


Magyar kampány leírás / Hungarian description
 

FONTOS: A könyvben 18+ korhatáros tartalom is előfordul
Vér / Erőszak / Meztelenség / Szexuális magatartás / Káromkodás

Most, hogy a kampány sikeresen lezárult, minden stretch goal-t elértünk még a kampány alatt és a nyomtatott, 150 oldalas képregények eljutottak a támogatóinkhoz, szeretnénk még többet adni nektek!

Szeretnénk folytatni a Bukottak történetét, ezért elhatároztuk, hogy megnyitunk 5 újabb, kampány utáni stretch goal-t. Minden egyes cél, amit elérünk, egy teljes, 30 oldalas résszel bővíti a sorozatot. Kész vagy rá, hogy a következő szintre emeld ezt a történetet?

Akkor vásárold meg a Digitális Képregény perket, legyen tiéd a 150 oldalas képregény és egy szuper háttérkép, és végül, derítsd ki, hogy mi következik a vég után… Azzal, hogy megvásárolod ezt a perket, megkapsz majd minden Kampány Utáni Stretch Goal tartalmat is, ahogy azok elérhetővé válnak, miközben ezzel lehetőséget adsz nekünk arra, hogy folytathassuk a Bukottak történetét. Köszönjük!

A megosztás egyet jelent azzal, hogy több értéket kapsz a pénzedért
Szeretnéd már olvasni a folytatást és megkapni a digitális könyvet ingyen? Akkor oszd meg ezt a kampányt a barátaiddal, akiket érdekelnek a képregények! Minél többen veszik meg az első részt digitálisan, te annál több Bukottak 2 tartalmat kapsz majd meg, ahogy egyre több kampány utáni célt teljesítünk. Hajrá! Segíts te is abban, hogy ennek a kampánynak a híre minél több emberhez eljusson, elvégre ezzel mindenki egyértelműen nyer. Minden egyes megosztással közelebb kerülsz ahhoz, hogy ugyanannyi pénzért több értéket kapj.

Megosztom Facebookon


Egy kitaszított farkasember, egy magányos feltaláló, és egy gyönyörű orgyilkosnő. Látszólag semmi közös nincs bennük, a véletlen mégis szövetségbe kovácsolja őket, hogy útját állják egy démoni szekta hatalomra kerülésének. Vajon felemelkedhetnek még a bukottak, vagy az örök kárhozat vár rájuk?

Bromm likantróp, azaz vérfarkas, származási helye és eredeti neve ismeretlen. Egy Germánia környéki erdőben portyázó kisebb klán tagja volt, míg kitaszítottá nem vált. Miközben reményvesztve menekül, egy rendkívül különös hang csalogatja őt egy ködös kisváros falai elé.

Clémence-t gyerekkora óta kitűnő prostituáltnak és még kitűnőbb orgyilkosnak képezték ki. A szüleit még kislánykorában lemészárolták, ő pedig emberkereskedők markába került. Épp mikor eldöntötte, hogy új életet kezd, utolsó orgyilkos küldetésén útja egy olyan városba viszi, ami a szeme láttára tűnik elő a semmiből.

Tobias van Gerwen kantoni kémmester és feltaláló. Életét a vérkristályok kutatásának és soha nem látott mértékben kifinomult gépek kifejlesztésének szentelte. Nem sokkal később azonban ezzel kivívta a konkurens tudóscéhek rosszallását, majd családjával együtt el kellett menekülnie. Felesége a hosszú út során meghalt, most pedig Tobias a fiával együtt egy különös városba tartanak, abban a reményben, hogy ott majd békére lelnek.

A Bukottak képregénysorozat az Unseen Domains sötét fantasy univerzumában játszódik.

„A régi világ elpusztult, s romjain döghadak lejtettek haláltáncot”

A 17. század közepén járunk. A megébredt mágia és hatásai, a tomboló élőhalott-járványok letarolták Európát, majd végletesen átalakították az egész világot is. Államok tűntek el, népek szóródtak szét, kulturális zárványok formájában maradt csak meg valami a régi hagyományokból.

Aki túl akart élni, annak alkalmazkodnia kellett a boszorkánypestis korához. Az új idők szavára új hősök születtek. Rég elfeledettnek hitt teremtmények bújtak elő valahonnan, ahol eddig rejteztek. Mítosznak, babonaságnak hitt dolgokról derült ki, hogy mindig is léteztek, csak az értő, mágikus látása hiányzott hozzá a legtöbbeknek, hogy észre is vegyék őket.

Ha akadtak volna az új időknek kartográfusai, egészen különleges térképeket rajzolhattak volna. Olyan földabroszokat, amelyen már nem szerepeltek országhatárok, legfeljebb többé-kevésbé kiterjedt zónák a nagyobb Menedékek körül. Elzárt völgyek, melyek még alkalmasak voltak az életre, és vidékek, amiket ritkábban jártak az élőholtak. Minden más csak pusztaság és letarolt földek - a holtak birodalmai.

Ha esetleg nem sikerült meggyőznünk a fentiekkel, kérjük hagyd, hogy most a munkánk beszéljen helyettünk. Az Bukottak képregénysorozat 5 része, amely ebben a könyvben nyomatatott formában is benne lesz, elérhető webes képregény formában, online is a honlapunkon keresztül: kattints ide és olvasd el őket.

Ha a munkánk elnyerte a tetszésed és te is szeretnéd kézbe venni a nyomtatott könyv változatot, akkor nincs is más dolgod, mint választani egy olyan csomagot az alábbiak közül, melyben már szerepel a könyv is. Ígérjük nem fogod megbánni :)

Egy kis magyar csapat vagyunk, mi állunk az Unseen Domains sötét fantasy univerzum kulisszái mögött. Tavaly eredetileg még azért álltunk össze, hogy egy videojátékot készítsünk, de annyira beszippantott minket ez az univerzum, hogy elhatároztuk, tovább bővítjük más műfajokban is. Aztán már azon kaptuk magunkat, hogy egy képregénysorozaton dolgozunk gőzerővel, melynek a Bukottak nevet adtuk. Most pedig úgy gondoljuk, hogy elérkezett az idő arra is, hogy ezt az 5 részes sorozatot egy kötetbe foglaljuk össze, hogy mindenki kedvére forgathassa.

Ezek vagyunk mi, a Bukottak képregénysorozat mögött álló csapat:

Végül pedig, ha tetszik ez a kezdeményezés és a tartalmat is érdekesnek találjátok, segítsetek nekünk egy megosztással abban, hogy ennek a képregénynek a híre minél több emberhez eljuthasson. Nagyon szeretnénk továbbra is hasonló ötletekkel előrukkolni, de ehhez szükségünk van a támogatásotokra. És itt nem feltétlenül anyagi támogatásról beszélünk (amikor is kiválasztasz innen egy csomagot), azzal is rengeteget segítesz abban, hogy fejlődni tudjunk, ha megosztod a munkánkat másokkal is a környezetedben.

Nagyon köszönjük, hogy itt vagy, és reméljük, hogy a Bukottak képregény kötet elnyeri majd a tetszésed! Végül pedig légy résen, hisz sötétség és rettegés leselkedik rád eme lapok közül :)

"Kerüljön el messzi a Pestis!"

Az új idők szavára új hősök születtek. Rég elfeledettnek hitt teremtmények bújtak elő valahonnan, ahol eddig rejteztek. Mítosznak, babonaságnak hitt dolgokról derült ki, hogy mindig is léteztek, csak az értő, mágikus látása hiányzott hozzá a legtöbbeknek, hogy észre is vegyék őket.Ha akadtak volna az új időknek kartográfusai, egészen különleges térképeket rajzolhattak volna. Olyan földabroszokat, amelyen már nem szerepeltek országhatárok, legfeljebb többé-kevésbé kiterjedt zónák a nagyobb Menedékek körül. Elzárt völgyek, melyek még alkalmasak voltak az életre, és vidékek, amiket ritkábban jártak az élőholtak. Minden más csak pusztaság és letarolt földek - a holtak birodalmai.Ha esetleg nem sikerült meggyőznünk a fentiekkel, kérjük hagyd, hogy most a munkánk beszéljen helyettünk. Az Bukottak képregénysorozat 5 része, amely ebben a könyvben nyomatatott formában is benne lesz, elérhető webes képregény formában, online is a honlapunkon keresztül: kattints ide és olvasd el őket.Ha a munkánk elnyerte a tetszésed és te is szeretnéd kézbe venni a nyomtatott könyv változatot, akkor nincs is más dolgod, mint választani egy olyan csomagot az alábbiak közül, melyben már szerepel a könyv is. Ígérjük nem fogod megbánni :)Egy kis magyar csapat vagyunk, mi állunk az Unseen Domains sötét fantasy univerzum kulisszái mögött. Tavaly eredetileg még azért álltunk össze, hogy egy videojátékot készítsünk, de annyira beszippantott minket ez az univerzum, hogy elhatároztuk, tovább bővítjük más műfajokban is. Aztán már azon kaptuk magunkat, hogy egy képregénysorozaton dolgozunk gőzerővel, melynek a Bukottak nevet adtuk. Most pedig úgy gondoljuk, hogy elérkezett az idő arra is, hogy ezt az 5 részes sorozatot egy kötetbe foglaljuk össze, hogy mindenki kedvére forgathassa.Ezek vagyunk mi, a Bukottak képregénysorozat mögött álló csapat:Végül pedig, ha tetszik ez a kezdeményezés és a tartalmat is érdekesnek találjátok, segítsetek nekünk egy megosztással abban, hogy ennek a képregénynek a híre minél több emberhez eljuthasson. Nagyon szeretnénk továbbra is hasonló ötletekkel előrukkolni, de ehhez szükségünk van a támogatásotokra. És itt nem feltétlenül anyagi támogatásról beszélünk (amikor is kiválasztasz innen egy csomagot), azzal is rengeteget segítesz abban, hogy fejlődni tudjunk, ha megosztod a munkánkat másokkal is a környezetedben.Nagyon köszönjük, hogy itt vagy, és reméljük, hogy a Bukottak képregény kötet elnyeri majd a tetszésed! Végül pedig légy résen, hisz sötétség és rettegés leselkedik rád eme lapok közül :)"Kerüljön el messzi a Pestis!"

story:
BAD MOON RISING MAGAZINE N.1

Con il Bad Moon Rising Magazine vogliamo mettere su carta i nostri personaggi visti su internet, in una chiave diversa ed inedita.

Il magazine sarà un piccolo albo di 32 pagine di soli fumetti e illustrazioni (e qualche breve scritto).

Più precisamente, in questo primo numero, troverete:

  • Stephanie & Louis – La nostra storica coppia becera farà qui il suo debutto cartaceo, con alcuni inediti (oltre a una piccola selezione tra le vignette più amate)
  • Sottoscala Di Mostri – Le illustrazioni di Matilde Simoni
  • Genova’s Mostrini – Un inedito della serie di illustrazioni vaporwave del Drugo
  • M.P.Alan – La one-shot del Drugo sulle origini del papero schizzato, per intero
  • Microcosmo  - Le prime strisce della nostra serie più longeva
  • Kervin – L’alcolista nudo con la maschera da rana, finalmente su carta
  • Pinguini Tattici a Fumetti – Il nostro adattamento a fumetti delle canzoni dei Pinguini Tattici Nucleari
  • Vignette del Drugo, dissacranti ed illegali
  • Scritti e approfondimenti
  • SPECIAL GUEST – Gaddi, autore di Buster Capp!

 

 

CHE COS’E’ LA BAD MOON RISING PRODUCTION?

Siamo un collettivo di quattro giovani autori di fumetti.

Tutte le nostre opere (strisce, storie, illustrazioni, vignette) sono disponibili in lettura gratuita sulla nostra pagina Facebook.

Viaggiamo molto per fiere. Dal 2015 ad oggi abbiamo partecipato a tutte e tre le edizioni del Daunia Comics in Puglia, alla Mostra Internazionale Dell’Artigianato di Firenze in una sezione dedicata, allo Smack Comics di Genova, al Voltri Comics (Edizioni 2016 e 2017), al Carrara Show, al Varchi Comics, al Prato Comics + Play, al Combat Comics e al ChimeraComix.

Collaboriamo con la rivista romana Scomodo, con la quale abbiamo anche realizzato l’evento Scomics, tenutosi a Roma nell’Aprile del 2017, con tanti ospiti e personalità del mondo del fumetto.

Siamo inoltre autori dell’adattamento a fumetti delle canzoni dei Pinguini Tattici Nucleari, anch’esso disponibile in lettura gratuita sulla nostra pagina.

A fine anno uscirà la nostra prima graphic novel non autoprodotta, con Barta Edizioni.

 

CHI SIAMO?

Lorenzo La Neve (classe 1998, Roma), sceneggiatore, studente del Dams di Roma e della Scuola Romana Dei Fumetti. Per la Bad Moon Rising Production ho scritto, ad oggi, le serie “Microcosmo” e “Stephanie & Louis”, “Pinguini Tattici a Fumetti” (episodi “Test Di Ingresso Di Medicina”, “Il Paradiso Degli Orsi Gay” e “L’Uomo Che Inventò Il Fuoco”), ed i fumetti per Scomodo.

Mattia ‘Drugo’ Secci (classe 1997, Genova), disegnatore, sceneggiatore e studente della Scuola Internazionale di Comics di Torino. Per la Bad Moon Rising Production ha scritto e disegnato le one-shot “M.P.Alan”, “Cicada” (di prossima uscita) e “Bagatelle” (della serie “Pinguini Tattici a Fumetti”) e le serie “Il Testadimmerda” e “Piero Pieri”. Con Lorenzo La Neve ha realizzato i fumetti per Scomodo. Come illustratore ha tra l’altro curato, oltre a tutti i disegni sul papero Napalm, la miniserie “Genova’s Mostrini”.

Matilde Simoni (classe 1995, Bologna), illustratrice e animatrice. Per la Bad Moon Rising Production ha curato i disegni di “Microcosmo” e “Stephanie & Louis”, ed è autrice della serie “Kervin”.

Mitja Bichon (classe 1995, Firenze), musicista, compositore e sceneggiatore. Per la Bad Moon Rising Production ha collaborato alle sceneggiature delle prime strisce di “Microcosmo” e ha scritto “Jack Il Melo Drammatico” (della serie “Pinguini Tattici a Fumetti”), di prossima uscita. Sta inoltre lavorando a più storie one-shot.

story:
Ciao, sono Stefano Pace (Gniffe)!

Nella vita sono un informatico, lavoro come sviluppatore software presso una grande azienda, ma ho da sempre l'hobby del disegno e dei fumetti.

Mi piacciono le vignette e le strisce brevi, di una sola tavola, ma per una volta mi sono voluto cimentare in una storia lunga!
Da qui nasce "Il sonno della digestione genera mostri", una storia di 60 tavole, piena di nonsense e scorrettezze, più vignette extra, per un totale di un albo circa 90 pagine, tutte a colori!

I disegni sono realizzati completamente in modo tradizionale, con carta, matita e pastelli.
Trovare un editore disposto a pubblicare non è cosa facile, quindi ho deciso di fare un'autoproduzione, che purtroppo ha i suoi costi elevati.
Ma magari, il crowdfunding mi permetterà di rimettermi a pari con le spese sostenute e di fare altri lavori!
 

 

Perché dovreste finanziare questo fumetto?

Il fumetto sarà stampato in 1000 copie, tutte a colori, brossurate, con rilegatura in filo refe e copertina serigrafata, in formato 168x240.
Saranno stampate anche 250 copie in formato A6, per chi preferisce fumetti più tascabili!
Realizzare una storia, pensarla, abbozzarla, disegnarla, colorarla e prepararne i file per la stampa richiede tempo e pazienza!
Quindi se la storia vi piacerà, il vostro contributo mi darà modo di crearne altre in futuro!
E se vi piacciono i fumetti, potrete avere un fumetto di nicchia che non si trova nelle librerie, nelle fumetteria o nelle edicole!

Quando sarà pronto il fumetto?

Tutte le tavole sono state già disegnate ed il file pdf è già pronto per essere mandato in stampa, quindi le copie cartacee del fumetto saranno pronte a fine febbraio 2021!

E se non raggiungi la cifra minima?

Il fumetto sarà stampato a prescindere dall'esito di questa campagna!
Ma allora a cosa serve finanziarlo? Serve a permettermi di farne altri in futuro, perché i costi elevati dell'autoproduzione vanno sopperiti in qualche modo.
Inoltre, il costo delle copie cartacee potrà essere un po' più basso, se parte delle spese vengono recuperate con il crowdfunding.

Non posso dare soldi, posso essere utile in altro modo?

Certo! Se anche non potete contribuire direttamente alla campagna di crowdfunding, potete comunque essere molto utili nei seguenti modi:

  • Condividete questo crowdfunding con amici, parenti, conoscenti e sconosciuti! Sui social, tramite SMS, con ogni mezzo! :D
  • Parlate del fumetto agli amici, se lo avete acquistato e vi è piaciuto, fateglielo vedere!
  • Seguitemi su facebook o Instagram e suggerite il profilo agli amici (basta cercare "gniffecomics")

story:
THIS IS A LAST CALL PRE-ORDER CAMPAIGN

WITH EXCLUSIVE COVER and REWARDS.

EXCLUSIVE TO THIS PRE-ORDER CAMPAIGN  FILIPINO WARRIOR COVER BY CEDRIC NOCON  (WILDSTORM,EXTREME,MARVEL,TOP COW) AND WALTER PEREYRA (MARVEL,DC,)

AND 

 HERETIQUE GOTHIC PAINTING BY LEVI HINTON!!

Written by Kurt Belcher  
Art by Clint Scott 
Colors and Letters by Sebastian Valencia
From the cosmos of Creation, Saint Heretique fell like a star.  Along the way, *something* threw her off-course, causing her to crash-land far from Earth in the depths of Hell.  To find her way across the “Damnedscape”, she seeks the aid of a demonic guide.  But the guide’s price may be steeper than she can afford.
Saint Heretique must defeat the champions of Hell in order to escape to her final destination: Earth, where she was intended to go all along.  There, she will fulfill her mysterious destiny, to be either a savior…or a destructor.  If Saint Heretique has her way, she’ll find her own path.

Add On List Cost

 

  • 1. Artist Edition/Standard Cover $10

  • 2.Sinister Logo Sticker $6

  • 3. Heretique Bookmark $5

  • 4. Heretique Hentai Love Sticker $5

  • 5. Sinister Waifu Card Set $10

  • 6. Double Sided Mecha Heretique Card $5

  • 7. Levi Hinton Goth Heretique Poster $15

  • 8. Naughty Girl Variant Cover $10

  • 9. Lovesick Schmoog Bookmark $5

  • 10. Holofoil Cover Variant $30

  • 11. Heretic Demon Cover $10

  • 12. Standard Cover Poster $10

  • 13. Cedric Nocon Filipino Warrior Poster $15

  • 14.  Card Regular Card Set $ 10 

LEVI HINTON

CEDRIC NOCON

WALTER PEREYRA

Risks & Challenges

Very Little Risk, The book has all writing and line-work art finished and is currently being colored and lettered. Book will be finished ahead of schedule. Offering this Campaign in response to Most Conventions, Shops,And Distrubution methods being put off due to Covid 19 Like most Indy Publishers we're forced to think outside the box to stay alive in these challenging times.

story:
TFN is an anthology series much like Astro City, where there is no singular star of the series. Rather the city itself serves as the backdrop to introduce our universe. This allows us to tell an array of stories and genres with each new arc.

Neroesville has the highest population of Heroes of any city in the world. Awesome! It also has the most Villains. Not so awesome. Living here is unlike living anywhere else. Every day is an adventure. Here's hoping you live to tell about it!

Get in on the ground floor with the first 3 issues of Tales From Neroesville! The books and prints are printed and in hand, which means they can be shipped immediately when the campaign ends!

 

Issues 1 & 2  "Lightning Balls" is a buddy flick a-la Blue Beetle/Booster Gold circa 1987. Loveable losers trying to make a name and save the day. Can they do it? (Spoiler alert: Probably not)

TALES FROM NEROESVILLE #1: LIGHTNING BALLS (part 1 of 2)
An object of unparalleled power has been located and the criminal kingpin Lord Sinisterio wants it for himself. If he manages to get the object and translate the ancient text, the world will tremble beneath his rule. Neroesville’s greatest heroes have been gathered to thwart Sinisterio and his army. Unfortunately for AirBall and LightningDoug, they didn’t make the cut, but that doesn’t mean they won’t end up right in the middle of the action!

TALES FROM NEROESVILLE #2: LIGHTNING BALLS (part 2 of 2)
While Neroesville’s greatest heroes are in hot pursuit of the object, our lovable losers, AirBall and LightningDoug, find themselves consistently and accidentally one step ahead of them. Meanwhile, Lord Sinisterio is preparing to recite the ancient text and gain omnipotence. Will AirBall and LightningDoug save the day? Better question: will they survive the day?

- Issue 1 includes the backup story "Glory Days"

- Issue 2 includes the backup story "The Drastic Duo"

(Tales From Neroesville issue 1)

(Tales From Neroesville issue 1)

(Tales From Neroesville issue 2)

(Tales From Neroesville issue 2)

Issue 3 "A Day At The Beach" Street gangs have taken over the Allister Pointe Pier. Luckily there's a new vigilante in town. One that plays for keeps!

TALES FROM NEROESVILLE #3 : A DAY AT THE BEACH

The street gangs have taken over the Allister Pointe Pier section of Neroesville. The police have their hands full with the super-powered criminal activity. So who, or what, will step in and take care of the thugs making life Hell on the Pier?

- Issue 3 includes the backup story "Feoladair"

(Tales From Neroesville issue 3)

(Tales From Neroesville issue 3)

 

Comics + swag package includes:

Physical copies of the first 3 issues of "TFN" autographed by writer Jason Meadows.
(3 issues/over 80 pages)

+ Digital PDF copies of the first 3 issues of "TFN"

+ Limited signed/#'d "HEROES" print

+ Ashcan previews of upcoming issues of TFN

+Sketch card drawn by one of the KSS crew

+ Stickers, refrigerator magnet, pin, etc

(Heroes of Neroes print)

As a fan of 80s indie comics, we strive to tell stories in the vein of those great comics. Fun and entertaining, with no PC BS or morality jammed into the stories. Our goal is simple; to bring you entertaining tales with quality writing and artwork at a great price. That's it. With that in mind, we've taken a nod from those books we grew up with and decided to print on newsprint. This allows us to offer backers more bang for their buck. These same books on glossy paper would have cost $25 plus shipping.

We have received extremely positive feedback from fans and reviewers alike.

Meanwhile, Lord Sinisterio is preparing to recite the ancient text and gain omnipotence. Will AirBall and LightningDoug save the day? Better question: will they survive the day?- Issue 1 includes the backup story "Glory Days"- Issue 2 includes the backup story "The Drastic Duo"(Tales From Neroesville issue 1)(Tales From Neroesville issue 1)(Tales From Neroesville issue 2)(Tales From Neroesville issue 2)Issue 3 "A Day At The Beach" Street gangs have taken over the Allister Pointe Pier. Luckily there's a new vigilante in town. One that plays for keeps!TALES FROM NEROESVILLE #3 : A DAY AT THE BEACHThe street gangs have taken over the Allister Pointe Pier section of Neroesville. The police have their hands full with the super-powered criminal activity. So who, or what, will step in and take care of the thugs making life Hell on the Pier?- Issue 3 includes the backup story "Feoladair"(Tales From Neroesville issue 3)(Tales From Neroesville issue 3) Comics + swag package includes:Physical copies of the first 3 issues of "TFN" autographed by writer Jason Meadows.(3 issues/over 80 pages)+ Digital PDF copies of the first 3 issues of "TFN"+ Limited signed/#'d "HEROES" print+ Ashcan previews of upcoming issues of TFN+Sketch card drawn by one of the KSS crew+ Stickers, refrigerator magnet, pin, etc(Heroes of Neroes print)As a fan of 80s indie comics, we strive to tell stories in the vein of those great comics. Fun and entertaining, with no PC BS or morality jammed into the stories. Our goal is simple; to bring you entertaining tales with quality writing and artwork at a great price. That's it. With that in mind, we've taken a nod from those books we grew up with and decided to print on newsprint. This allows us to offer backers more bang for their buck. These same books on glossy paper would have cost $25 plus shipping.We have received extremely positive feedback from fans and reviewers alike.

story:
Who I am:

My name is Jeff, I'm an amateur writer and former graphic artist who has spent the past few years doodling a goofy pint-sized private eye on spare scraps of paper to the amusement of my friends and co-workers. After many questions from them I turned the little guy into a more fleshed out character, Chibi Detective, and over a number of conversations and jokes a whole subset of characters, events and situations sprung up. So much so that I began writing them down to not forget them.

I've been a fan of newspaper comics like Calvin and Hobbes since I was a child so a while back I tried my hand at independently producing a comic strip following the misadventures of Chibi Detective, now working for the Metro Police Department,  and his companions: Detective Callahan from INTERPOL, Lt. Sourpatch and the other members of the Chibi S.W.A.T. team as they try to save the city from criminals.

You can see the rest of those pages in the media gallery on this page or here on my DeviantArt gallery along with other pieces of work.

Unfortunately I was only able to produce a handful of pages before I became frustrated with the quality of the work I was capable of creating in my off hours from my actual sales job. I scrapped my drawings but I continued to write scripts and sketch thumbnails for comics because I always thought Chibi deserved a second chance.

What I would like to accomplish with this campaign is to raise enough money to hire a more experienced artist to assist me in bringing my vision to life and share it with the world once more. I am drawing on my past work experience as a graphic artist, prepress technician and production manager assistant to ensure that the items we will be creating for this campaign will be of the highest quality and produced with a minimum of problems and will be delivered as quickly as possible.

What We Need

Simply put: the funds collected from this campaign will be used to directly fund the development of the comic. Reaching goal will fund at minimum the initial 52 comics which will be done in full color in an 8.5 x 11" format to be published weekly on its own website, chibidetective.com which I already own the domain rights to.

Funds collected will go towards the following:

  • Production cost of perk premiums
  • Payment for contracting out a proper artist
  • Software licensing as needed
  • Website hosting setup, fees and advertisement

What You Get

We're working hard to provide you wonderful contributors with some physical merchandise as a way to raise funds for this project. While supplies last we has the following offerings:

  • 1.5" full color pin-back button

  • Chibi Detective Sticker sheet: 6" x 4" full color

  • *please note this is a mock-up

  • Official Chibi Detective Fan Club t-shirt from CustomInk.com

In addition perk contributors will have their names listed on a special thank you page on our website that can be linked to a website of their choosing. Names will be listed alphabetically by last name and grouped by perk tier. Chibi Detective tier will be displayed on top of the page, followed by Chibi Cop then Chibi Rookie or, for you number people, $25, $10, then $5 contributors.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't make a financial contribution that's ok too! All I ask is that you help spread the word: join our official Facebook group, follow us on Twitter and share the link with all your friends.

story:
WHO:

My name is Rob Rogers and I am the political cartoonist for the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette. One of the highlights of my job is drawing local cartoons, many featuring Pittsburgh's mayors. If you live in Pittsburgh, you know the city has a penchant for novelty mayors, whether elected or not.

WHAT:

I have been drawing cartoons about Pittsburgh and its mayors since the mid '80s, but I've only been drawing my local weekly comic strip Brewed on Grant since the '90s. This book is my first Brewed on Grant collection.

The local comic strip is set in a fictitious diner on Grant Street in downtown Pittsburgh. Grant Street is home to the Mayor’s office, City Council Chambers, County Courthouse and the old County Jail. In other words, a lot of crazy stuff goes down on Grant Street. Brewed on Grant is by far the most popular cartoon I draw each week, especially among Pittsburgh readers.

The drawing above is the rough sketch for my very first Brewed on Grant comic from 1993.

The book contains over 170 cartoons featuring the exploits of Richard Caliguiri, Sophie Masloff, Tom Murphy, Bob O'Connor, Luke Ravenstahl and Bill Peduto. With the exception of some early cartoons in black and white, most of the book will contain full-color cartoons. If you are not familiar with Pittsburgh politics that's OK., Each cartoon will have a line of explanatory text to help the reader with history and context.

The foreword was graciously provided by my good friend Lynn Cullen.

WHEN:

The book will be out by August or September of 2015. 

WHY:

Because the cartoons are funny, dammit, and you'll enjoy reading them! Plus, as I mentioned, this is my very first collection of Brewed on Grant cartoons (not to be missed) ... and the perks are awesome! Lastly, if you don't get a book ... I'll scratch yer eyes aht!

WHY INDIEGOGO:

Many cartoonists, artists and writers are using crowd-sourcing as a way to fund their creative projects. It helps them gauge interest and know how many books to print. The old model of publishing has proven to be too expensive for publishers to take a risk on a small local book project like this. A crowd-sourcing campaign enables me to offer unique perks to my fans while at the same time ensuring that I can afford to publish the best book possible.

WHERE THE MONEY GOES:

Thank you in advance for your support! The money raised through this campaign will go directly to pay for the printing and shipping of 5,000 books. Anything above and beyond the initial goal will go to offsetting the cost of designing the book and the cost of creating prints and t-shirts for perks. If we go way above the goal (that would be awesome!) it will allow me to print more books ... and help me pay my city taxes so Mayor Peduto gets his cut.

story:
I'm looking for help to print Mars Needs MILFs #1, an adults only sci-fi comic starring Adult Video News Hall of Famer and adult film legend (and, I'm happy to say, friend) Debi Diamond.  Debi is super excited about this project and it features her in all sorts of, ahem, action.  This comic will have a print run limited to only 150 copies, so this is sure to be a highly collectible item for Debi's fans.

Artwork and lettering on the book is complete.  I only need help with the printing fees.  Your donations will not be put toward art fees, coloring fees, photography fees, or anything that involves the artwork.  All fees go toward printing the comic and shipping it to anyone who donates enough to get a copy.

Speaking of getting a copy, that's one of the perks of this campaign.  Anyone who donates $20.00 gets a copy of the book signed by me.

Anyone who donates $50.00 gets not only the comic signed by me, but a limited 11" x 17" print of Debi by Xavier, the back cover artist of the book.

Anyone who donates $75.00 gets the signed comic and a "non-censored" 11" x 17" print by the book's artist, Tejlor Szabo.

Donate $100 and get both prints and the signed comic.  How cool is that?

There may be more perks to come later.  I hope you can help.  If you can't help financially, please spread the word.  That helps, too, and Debi and I will appreciate all the help you can give.

story:
Welcome to the TALES OF THE DARK TUNNEL 40 page comic book Indiegogo. Thanks for checking us out. Look around and consider backing this amazing project. We have many add-ons available including 6x9 prints and single issues of Freaks & Gods. Thanks again!

 

WHAT’S THIS ALL ABOUT?


The trio of Flame Girl, Magno, and Atoman find themselves in the middle of a forest. Each one was taken away at a crucial moment leaving loved ones behind in mortal danger. They do not know why they are there, what the Dark Tunnel is or even if they’ll get home in this action packed 30 page story.
The 10 page backup story follows Scarlett Dalton, a young puritan woman from 1692. She was betrayed by her fiancé and burned as a witch. But her spirit was bound to a statue and she roams the multiverse via the Dark Tunnel helping those whom are ensnared by the supernatural. In this story she stumbles across a lost child who is captured by a soul eater as Dr. Haunt watches and does nothing!
This book is 40 pages of content and will remind you why you fell in love with comics in the first place.


ARE YOU A FAN OF GOLDEN AGE SUPERHEROES?


Do you love comic books and/or comics from the 1970’s & 80’s, golden age superheroes, fantastic stories, bizarre cosmic gods,  great characters and that sense of wonder and awe... this is the book for you!


WHAT’S THE DARK TUNNEL?


The Dark Tunnel is what ties my comic book universe together (or the Dark Tunnel Universe- DTU).  It brings our characters (some from different public domain publishers) together.  Below is the Dark Tunnel's explanation within the comics universe.


 

 
WHO MADE THIS?


Hi, I’m Chris Dreier. I started my comic book career as an inker back in 1994. I’ve worked for Antarctic Press, Chaos! Comics, Dark Horse, IDW and Joe Books just to name a few,
I create, write, ink and color my ongoing series called Freaks & Gods which is published by 215Ink. From the very beginning I knew I was creating a very unique universe, something I wanted to expand on since the first issue of Freaks & Gods was finished. So here comes Tales of the Dark Tunnel #1.


The main story Disc World of the Great Filter is penciled by Giuseppe D’Elia. He is the Freaks & Gods series penciler. You can contact Giuseppe via email giuseppe.delia@alice.it  if you’re interested in his work.


The backup story A Terrifying Visitor is pencils by Shawn Van Briesen. Shawn has worked on The Creeps magazine. You can contact Shawn via his website (www.shawnvanbriesen.com) if you’re interested in his work.


It’s important to know that you do NOT need to read Freaks & Gods to follow this book. It takes place in the same universe (the Dark Tunnel Universe) but with different heroes. It’s like this—say it’s 1982 and you go into a comic shop and think the X-men look interesting. You would not need to read Avengers to follow along.


This book is completely finished! All we need is your support to bring it to life! 


 Sneak Preview

The Perks!

 

Risks & Challenges

The risks are low. The book is complete just waiting for the funding to print. Once the campaign is over and funded it’s off to the printer. There may be a bump in the road along the way when it comes to printing and shipping. But we will handle them as they come and get the rewards out to you. I put everything into my comics. It’s what I love and I believe in. Any remaining money will help fund the next Dark Tunnel project.

The Perks!

There may be a bump in the road along the way when it comes to printing and shipping. But we will handle them as they come and get the rewards out to you. I put everything into my comics. It’s what I love and I believe in. Any remaining money will help fund the next Dark Tunnel project.

story:
Short Summary

Back in 1994, I published a comic book anthology entitled COSMIC WAVES.  Only a handful of issues were ever published, and after Diamond decided to stop carrying it, I was unable to produce new issues.  The book ended up being a platform for my friends and colleagues to get their work published, and we all had a lot of fun.  At the same time, I had written several stories of my own, that I hoped to someday publish in a future issues of COSMIC WAVES.  Of course, the book ceased being published, and those stories remained in the vault.


Fast forward to 2016.  As many of you know, I have recently put together a line of graphic novel reprints, which have seem to strike a cord with folks.  Books like A Sailor's Story by Sam Glanzman and The Puma Blues by Stephen Murphy and Michael Zulli have grabbed some great reviews in places like The New York Times and The A.V. Club (just to name a couple), and I am really honored to have helped get such books back on the shelves after so many years out of print.  Of course, as awesome as it has been to see those books come out, I haven't had much time to work on my own projects.  Which brings us to today.

Having recently stepped away from that reprint graphic novel line, I began thinking about my own projects.  And immediately it hit me, THE LOST STORIES!  I have tried publishing these in one form or another in the past, but it was never the right time.  Finally, I have hit on what I think is the right package to finally bring those early stories of mine to the light of day.  COSMIC WAVES: THE LOST STORIES.

This collection will consist of over 60 pages of story, told through six different science fiction tales.  Let's take a look...


1. THE COVER UP (illustrated by Tony Lorenz & Larry Blake)

Aliens are real...and you won't believe just how deep THE COVER UP goes!


2. AND EVEN THE PEOPLE ARE FORGOTTEN (illustrated by Russ Miller)

In the far flung future, one zookeeper tries to save some very familiar animals!


3. THE PARABLE OF TWO MARTIANS (illustrated by G.M. Danzey)

Life lessons can be rather tough...especially on the surface of Mars! 


4. ONE (illustrated by Chris Eisert)

An extraterrestrial struggles with the fate of ONE human child.


5. THE COST OF FREEDOM (illustrated by Helmut Eppich)

People love to fight...and hate.  Both now, and in the future.


6. UNIQUE (illustrated by Yul Tolbert)

What if the artificial life we create doesn't want to live?


What We Need & What You Get

  • I am looking to raise $3000. This money will go towards touching up the art.  The art itself is fine, but some of the source materials have been damaged over time, and some of the work needs to be re-created. I also need to pay a professional letterer to re-letter many of the pages.  I would also like to throw a few dollars at a friend of mine who designs books for a living, to make sure the final product really stands out on the shelves.  Of course, beyond those production costs, the bulk of the funds will go to getting the book printed and shipped.
  • As for rewards, I have tried to keep it simple.  For $10 flat, you get a digital copy of COSMIC WAVES: THE LOST STORIES sent to your e-mail box.  For $15 (plus $5 s&h), you get a physical copy of COSMIC WAVES: THE LOST STORIES mailed to your front door.  For $25 (plus $5 s&h) you get one of each!  For $30 (plus $5 s&h) you get one of each, plus a random copy of the original COSMIC WAVES comic book anthology, published in the early 90s!  For $75 (plus $5 s&h), retailers can get 10 copies of the book at 50% off the cover price!  For $100 (plus $5 s&h) you can pick up both print and digital copies of the book, and receive a phone call from me to talk comics and such.  For $250 (plus $5 s&h) you get both print and digital copies of the book, a phone call from me, and my personal editorial notes on any ONE comic book script you are working on (not to exceed 32 pages).  I have done plenty of editing in my former 9-5 job, and was lucky enough to work with some of the top creators in comics on a variety of comic book and graphic novel related projects.  I will be more than happy to pass along any editorial knowledge I may have picked up along the way.

The Personal Impact

Over the last several years, I have been really honored to help many top creators get some of their most important comic book work back into print.  But I am also driven to write my own stories, and it means so much any time I am able to share those stories with others.  To finally get this collection of my early stories published would be tremendously gratifying, and something for which I would be forever grateful.

Risks & Challenges

  • While working on that recent line of graphic novels, I learned a massive amount about putting a project like this together, and getting it done right!
  • Aside from any hold-ups from outside freelancers working on the project, I do not foresee any real risks.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help out.  Please use Facebook, Twitter and any other social media platform available to you to help get the word out about this campaign.  THANK YOU!

This money will go towards touching up the art.  The art itself is fine, but some of the source materials have been damaged over time, and some of the work needs to be re-created. I also need to pay a professional letterer to re-letter many of the pages.  I would also like to throw a few dollars at a friend of mine who designs books for a living, to make sure the final product really stands out on the shelves.  Of course, beyond those production costs, the bulk of the funds will go to getting the book printed and shipped.
As for rewards, I have tried to 
keep it simple.  For $10 flat, you get a digital copy of COSMIC WAVES: THE LOST STORIES sent 
to your e-mail box.  For $15 (plus $5 s&h), you get a physical 
copy of COSMIC WAVES: THE LOST STORIES mailed to your front 
door.  For $25 (plus $5 s&h) you get one of each!  For $30 (plus $5 s&h) you get one of each, plus a random copy of the original COSMIC 
WAVES comic book anthology, published in the early 90s!  For $75 (plus $5 s&h), retailers can get 10 copies of the book at 50% off
 the cover price!  For $100 (plus $5 s&h) you can pick up both print and digital copies of the book,
 and receive a phone call from me to talk comics and such.  For $250 (plus $5 s&h) you get both print and digital copies of the book, a phone call from me, and my personal editorial notes on any ONE 
comic book script you are working on (not to exceed 32 pages).  I have done plenty of editing in my former 9-5 job, and was lucky enough to work with some of the top creators in comics on a 
variety of comic book and graphic novel related projects.  I will be 
more than happy to pass along any editorial knowledge I may have 
picked up along the way.

   The Personal Impact Over the last several years, I have been really honored to help many top creators get some of their most important comic book work back into print.  But I am also driven to write my own stories, and it means so much any time I am able to share those stories with others.  To finally get this collection of my early stories published would be tremendously gratifying, and something for which I would be forever grateful.
  Risks & Challenges    While working on that recent line of graphic novels, I learned a massive amount about putting a project like this together, and getting it done right!
 Aside from any hold-ups from outside freelancers working on the project, I do not foresee any real risks.
    Other Ways You Can Help I understand that some of you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help out.  Please use Facebook, Twitter and any other social media platform available to you to help get the word out about this campaign.  THANK YOU!

story:
Who we are!

Illustrator:

Luke Radl is a full-time freelance artist and designer for web and print, and was recently exhibited at Drawing Conclusions: The Editorial Cartoon.  His work has appeared in Dark Horse Comics, Cartoon Movement, Citizen Radio, and We're Not Broke. In 2011 he participated in Occupy Boston and Occupy Wall Street, and in 2012 he covered the NATO protests in the graphic report "Chicago is My Kind of Town".  He attended the Joe Kubert School of Cartoon and Graphic Art in 2006.

Writer:

Jeffrey Wilson received his MA in Anthropology from Columbia University where he examined how ethnographic fieldwork could be written in graphic novel form.  Recently he interviewed comic book journalist Joe Sacco.  It was written in comic book form and  and published in Geographical Review.  He is currently a PhD student in Human Geography at the University of Arizona.

We are working on a Graphic Novel based on an interview with Noam Chomsky—and we need your help!!

The graphic novel is based off an interview Jeffrey conducted with Noam Chomsky in the summer of 2012. Chomsky is well know for being generous with his time and granting numerous interviews over the years. Despite the volumes of Chomsky related material available, few publications have researched and elaborated on the many references and examples that Chomsky employs.  The purpose of this graphic novel is to do just that!  We take the historical examples used and give them a depth that might otherwise be glossed over. For example, when Chomsky mentioned the Free Speech Movement of the 60’s during the interview, we do the research and take you back to that time period so it is not just a passing reference but a real and dynamic moment.  This work is important because it will offer not only an introduction to the thoughts and insights of Chomsky but the graphic novel form allows us to layer information and move the reader through time and space in unique ways. With your help we intend to create a book that is both accessible to a wide range of readers and insightful!  No easy task, but we are up for the challenge!

**Book will be released by AK Press in the Fall of 2014

Our Plan and your help

We need 15K to bring this important project into the world. This will go to both the writer and illustrator.  The money will help us work nearly full time on the graphic novel for the next 6-8 months. Any money we can raise beyond 15K the better, in that it will allow us to dedicate 100% of our time to the project.  It will also allow us to create a dynamic and interactive web version of the comic.  Both of us have successfully published so we know exactly what it takes to bring such a project into the world.  While the funds we raise are crucial you can also help out by spreading the word and letting interested friends and family know about the book.   Keep up with us on Twitter and Facebook. Feel free to email us with any questions.  And thanks again for taking time to read this!

Initial art work from the Noam Chomsky Graphic Novel



Below are examples of Luke's work.

Chicago Is MY Kind of Town By Luke Radl. 

Found at http://www.cartoonmovement.com/icomic/38

Luke's Blog 

http://www.lukeradl.com/illustration/


An excerpt from Jeffrey's interview with Joe Sacco.

Fieldwork and Graphic Narratives

By Jeffrey Wilson 

Illustration by Jay Jacot

NEW ART!


**This project is not directly associated with Noam Chomsky.  It is based on an interview done with Chomsky by Jeffrey in the summer of 2012.

story:
MIDNIGHT THEATRE: REVENGE of the OCTAGON is the story of Victory City's first crime fighter, Silvershade, who destroyed a criminal organization known as the Octagon 12 years ago. Since then he has retired and recruited new protectors while the city has enjoyed a golden age of general peace and prosperity.

But now there are whispers in the dark alleys of Victory City. Now the denizens of the underworld are trembling in fear as rumors of a new Octagon begin to spread. The police force is falling prey to graft and corruption once more as the eight sides of the Octagon extend their wicked grasp ...

This Octagon is different. This Octagon has a terrifying central mastermind controlling its schemes and plots. The sides of the Octagon give open allegiance to the center, the dread name being whispered in the dark ...

... GRAYSMOKE ...  

GRAYSMOKE has a singular goal ... a malicious intent that is focused solely on Silvershade and the destruction of everything he cares about. GRAYSMOKE is going to take Silvershade's city, his Victory Knights, and everything in his life as billionaire Steven DeWitt. When he's done, GRAYSMOKE will have destroyed everything in Silvershade's life and then he's going to take even more from DeWitt.

Eight sides. One center. ONE REVENGE.

MIDNIGHT THEATRE: REVENGE OF THE OCTAGON is planned as a 192-page graphic novel to be serialized as eight issues at 24 pages each. 

The entire graphic novel is written, so now comes the grind of production. Making a comic book is not as easy as it looks and can be time-consuming, hence the decision to serialize the book in eight issues. The money to be raised is for production and printing. We'll likely be outsourcing some of the talent, such as lettering and coloring. The rest -- pencilling, inking, trade dress -- can be handled internally.

We've got some great rewards for backers, especially our PROPAGANDA level award in which we'll draw you into a period-style poster which will actually be seen within the pages of the book, and two exclusive awards NAMING ACTUAL SUPPORTING CHARACTERS IN THE BOOK AFTER YOU (OR THE PERSON OF YOUR CHOICE).

Our Indiegogo goal is for the first issue of the series and we have modest push goals that will allow us to continue on with the series uninterrupted. If we can push past our $10k number then we'll start unlocking issue after issue with new rewards until all eight sides of the Octagon are complete! If we should manage that we'll have a final unlock that will allow us to move the series into a full-graphic novel production with production back matter, script excerpts, story additions (prose side-stories that contribute to your overall immersion in MIDNIGHT THEATRE) and ADDED BONUS PAGES!

----------------------------------------

Our risks include the usual ups and downs of working with printers and distributors, but given that we're publishing a comic book to the direct market (i.e. comic shops and other comic-specific sales venues such as book stores) and the mechanisms for doing so are already in place, we don't predict any unusual hurdles in that area.

That said, we are a completely unknown, independent comic company making MIDNIGHT THEATRE one of our first major ventures into full publishing. We'll be pushing publicity and attending comic conventions to raise awareness of the book, but grass roots campaigns can take time.

We're also going to push to put the book in the hands of a publisher -- probably one of the indies out there -- to see if we can maximize their resources for the benefit of MIDNIGHT THEATRE. We are an unknown quantity with publishers and getting them to take a chance on us could prove entirely fruitless, but the modern comic market is a diverse place and we believe MIDNIGHT THEATRE has a place waiting for it on comics shelves across America!

----------------------------------------

We're incredibly excited to launching this project and truly looking forward to your participation! Remember, every Sky Bond goes towards the next page in the thrilling tale of MIDNIGHT THEATRE: REVENGE OF THE OCTAGON! Making this book a success means we can tell other stories in the MIDNIGHT THEATRE, like HATE WEARS JACKBOOTS and INTERGALACTIC!

Visit wickedstudiosllc.blogspot.com for more Wicked Studios projects and preview art, and visit http://voirdire99.daportfolio.com to see MIDNIGHT THEATRE creator Scott Griffin's portfolio. Wicked Studios can be found on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Wicked-Studios-LLC/267701849917707?ref=hl. Any MIDNIGHT THEATRE-specific questions can be handled by shooting Griffin a message on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/scott.griffin.969 or emailing him at scott.griffin74@gmail.com.

Thank you for joining us on the journey to making MIDNIGHT THEATRE: REVENGE of the OCTAGON a reality. You're in for a unique comic book experience and we won't fail to satisfy!

story:
************NOTE***************

The featured package and the tree package have already been reclaimed, so I took them down. But I have your name and really can't wait to give you your booty!!!

************ITALIANS*************

Il Pacchetto Gruppo Supporto Fotografi Pigri che trovate in fondo a destra e' un laboratorio online di fotografia lungo un anno: ogni mese riceverete lezioni, contenuti  e materiali didattici e ci sara' un forum ad accesso privato che permettera' di condividere foto ed esperienze. 

Se avete dubbi o domande, andate qui http://www.saralando.com/blog/?p=1994

**********************************

 

 

 

A widowed woman unable to carry on and who only lives in the odd chapters.
A fundamentally optimistic man who lives in the even chapters and is about to find out a shocking truth about his own identity.

These are the premises of Magpies, graphic novel about loss, love and the quest for the real self.

 

Magpies is a labor of love – it’s a very special project and it's ready to be printed!

If you’d like to know more about it and preview the whole thing you can go HERE. 

The digital edition of Magpies is already available (and you get to set the price for that) but even if digital is supercool, I think nothing beats the feeling of flipping from one page to the next under a blanket.

 

 

Book Specs

The perfect bound book will be 160 pages, will measure 8x10 inches and will be printed on high quality paper.  Every page will be printed in full-color and will be awesome.

I decided to print in Italy rather than abroad in China like many larger companies do, to have full control over the printing process.

The plan is to send Magpies to the printer in January, after the Christmas madness. The printing process will take about 2 months for the proofs, printing and shipping to happen. This means I'll probably be getting the books around March or maybe April if something goes wrong (and let's assume it will: hope for the best and prepare for the worst).

But I'm hoping I'll be able to get my copies sooner than that, so that I'll be able to start shipping right away.

 

 

How does this work?

If you're not familiar with IndieGogo or crowdfunding in general, here's a brief overview. 

For the next 30 days, you'll be able to make pledges to help support this project, ranging from $5 to whatever you can afford without going broke or having to divorce. You can select one of the perks on the right, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only being awesome: you are also receiveing stuff as proof of that! 

Your credit card or paypal account will not actually be charged at the time you make your pledge.

If the final deadline comes and we've reached our goal, then everyone gets charged the amount they pledged at the same time, and after Indiegogo and paypal get their share, I start printing and mailing books and t-shirts and whatnot. But if for some reason we don't meet our goal, the whole thing is called off. No one gets charged, no fees are applied, everyone just keeps their money. 

Of course, if we fail to meet the goal, then no one gets any rewards, and this is pretty sad.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to raise $20,000 to pay for the cost of printing ($12.000) and producing perks ($6500), and cover the Indiegogo fee (that will take 4%), the PayPal fee (that will take 3,5% of what's left) /bank fees.

What's left is going to help cover part of the shipping costs, which are insane.

The money won't cover any my costs for making Magpies: I have already happily paid for that out of my own pockets. And I'm not trying to make a profit either: that will come later, when I'll be selling the copies that I'll have left.

In exchange for your support, you'll be able to choose between some basic rewards and some really amazing packages: they're all listed on the right, so pick your favorite! 

If this campaign goes over its funding goal, I already have lots of ideas for additional rewards: more pages, cooler additional rewards for those who already backed, special limited editions, original artworks, a juggling monkey… maybe not the monkey.

If the goal is not reached before the end of the 30 days, though, then you will not be charged anything. You only pay if the project reaches its goal before the deadline!

Shipping costs are already built into the rewards and I'll be paying most of it: retail price will be 30$ plus shipping, which will be 13 dollars for Italy and 25 for International shipping. So you might want to get your copy now and save some money!

If you still have questions, don't be afraid to ask: I will be setting up a FAQ tab in the next few days.  

 

 

 

 

Bird is the word

Finally, please use the share tools at the top of this page to tweet, e-mail, and let people know about Magpies.

Even if you're unable to contribute, you can still make a huge difference and help us make Magpies happen by spreading the word about this campaign.

Thank you in advance and we look forward to this crazy adventure!

 

 

 

Who am I?

Hi, my name is Sara Lando and I am a commercial photographer who also likes to tell stories. 

I live in the north of Italy with a husband who is forced to wear masks made out of masking tape for my weird projects.

Magpies is my first graphic novel.

I live in the north of Italy with a husband who is forced to wear masks made out of masking tape for my weird projects.

story:
Freaks N Squeaks is about the lives of mice that live in a little boy's bedroom starring two intelligent teenage girls mice. The mice date, hold elections, travel through time, fight appendix-eating zombies, encounter cyborgs... you know, typical mouse stuff.

The very first Freaks N Squeaks strip (October, 2002). The art gets better. I promise.

Honestly, it's very hard to describe FNS in brief. The strip has been running since 2003, written and drawn by me,  the Marvelous Patric (Lewandowski). The cast is Simpsons-esque. It usually focuses on Ginny and Janis, two teen girls, but there's also boy genius, Al, Ginny's little sister, Janie, the Schrewish kid Schmoikel, his friend Chuck, plus former Prez Tex, former Prez Obamarama, and current Prez Blump.  

Tex, the George W. Bush analog.

Blump, the Trump analog. Yes, he's a potato. Told you the art got better.

It's easiest to say Freaks N Squeaks is a satire of anything and everything. It follows whatever I'm interested in, which is often politics and sarcastic humor. There are over 2,000 strips and there have been some books printed over the past 17 years, but never anything consistent and there's a lot of the newer material that's never been in print and older material out of print.

That's where you come in.

The current Ginny and Janis models.

Al is a lover of iStuff. But he's also really smart. I swear.

The goal of this campaign is simple: collect all the Freaks N Squeaks comics (so far) into uniform books so that future books will also use a consistent design language. This is meant to be the definitive collection of Freaks N Squeaks. We're going to print all FIVE books at once instead of running different campaigns for each volume. It's a one-stop-shop! 

Plus, EXCLUSIVE TO THIS CAMPAIGN, we're going to have a ONE VOLUME HARDCOVER! This is the thing for the loyal fans and collectors out there. Just like music fans will buy the vinyl, this edition promises to be something special to show off. 

Ginny's little sister, Janie.

Here are the core details:

FIVE PAPERBACK BOOKS: Each volume is around 120ish pages, with all color strips printed in color for the first time EVER. Each book will be standard comic book size (6.5x10). 

Also, printed in color for the first time EVER, the original 3 page comic, "Of Mice and Bernoulli." 

EBOOK VERSIONS: If you aren't into dead trees, you can get the digital versions of each book. Plus, each print version comes with its electronic sibling. 

HARDCOVER: Instead of 5 paperbacks, you get everything in 1 book. Of course, it comes with the ebook version! The hardcover will be slightly larger in stature at 8.5 x 11.

FAQ:

Q: Do I have to buy all 5 books? A: No! In an effort to be clever, there are packages for people who just want to try out FNS for the first time. Also, if you have been a reader all these years and have purchased previous books, I've worked really hard so you can just get the stuff you're missing...

Q: How do these editions fit with previous editions (The big blue book, the pink book, and the yellow book?) A: If you have the big blue book (Pretty Much Everything Vol.1) that would now be books 1 and 2. Sad Little Life is in book 3. The yellow book (the rarest) is in part of book 3 and part of book 4. Most of book 4 has never seen print, and all of book 5 is new to print.

Schmoikel and Chuck.

Sometimes I set up the joke in one strip....

...and the joke pays off in a later strip.

Freaks N Squeaks has always worked best when read en masse. This campaign seeks to be the ultimate Freaks N Squeaks reading experience. It will collect all the FNS comics so far and help chart the course for years to come. Because, yes, there will be more strips.

There will always be more Freaks N Squeaks.

Thank you! I love you all!

-The Marvelous Patric

Risks and challenges

The only work to be done on this project is finishing the prepress which is well underway. It is entirely possible the books will be shipped before the holidays, but I'm saying January 2020 just in case.
story_txt:
Freaks N Squeaks is about the lives of mice that live in a little boy's bedroom starring two intelligent teenage girls mice. The mice date, hold elections, travel through time, fight appendix-eating zombies, encounter cyborgs... you know, typical mouse stuff.

The very first Freaks N Squeaks strip (October, 2002). The art gets better. I promise.
Honestly, it's very hard to describe FNS in brief. The strip has been running since 2003, written and drawn by me,  the Marvelous Patric (Lewandowski). The cast is Simpsons-esque. It usually focuses on Ginny and Janis, two teen girls, but there's also boy genius, Al, Ginny's little sister, Janie, the Schrewish kid Schmoikel, his friend Chuck, plus former Prez Tex, former Prez Obamarama, and current Prez Blump.  

Tex, the George W. Bush analog.

Blump, the Trump analog. Yes, he's a potato. Told you the art got better.
It's easiest to say Freaks N Squeaks is a satire of anything and everything. It follows whatever I'm interested in, which is often politics and sarcastic humor. There are over 2,000 strips and there have been some books printed over the past 17 years, but never anything consistent and there's a lot of the newer material that's never been in print and older material out of print.
That's where you come in.

The current Ginny and Janis models.

Al is a lover of iStuff. But he's also really smart. I swear.
The goal of this campaign is simple: collect all the Freaks N Squeaks comics (so far) into uniform books so that future books will also use a consistent design language. This is meant to be the definitive collection of Freaks N Squeaks. We're going to print all FIVE books at once instead of running different campaigns for each volume. It's a one-stop-shop! 
Plus, EXCLUSIVE TO THIS CAMPAIGN, we're going to have a ONE VOLUME HARDCOVER! This is the thing for the loyal fans and collectors out there. Just like music fans will buy the vinyl, this edition promises to be something special to show off. 

Ginny's little sister, Janie.
Here are the core details:
FIVE PAPERBACK BOOKS: Each volume is around 120ish pages, with all color strips printed in color for the first time EVER. Each book will be standard comic book size (6.5x10). 
Also, printed in color for the first time EVER, the original 3 page comic, "Of Mice and Bernoulli."

A: If you have the big blue book (Pretty Much Everything Vol.1) that would now be books 1 and 2. Sad Little Life is in book 3. The yellow book (the rarest) is in part of book 3 and part of book 4. Most of book 4 has never seen print, and all of book 5 is new to print.

There will always be more Freaks N Squeaks.
Thank you! I love you all!

story:
Due West: A Travel Memoir

Hello! I’m Alix West, a writer and illustrator. Currently, I am working on Due West, a serialized graphic memoir about traveling with my dead grandmother.

About five years ago, I discovered that my parents had been casually hoarding a box of my grandmother's travel journals since she died in 1999. Being twelve at the time of her death, I have only vague but rosy memories of Gramma. Seeing her writing as an opportunity to know more about the woman I'd idolized in my youth, I started sifting through them. 

Her journals span from 1978 to 1996. The earliest recounts a tour of Greece and the Soviet Union. Recently widowed, Gramma decided she would try solo travel and discovered that she loved it. Over the next twenty years, she would add a few more entries to her list of travels.

Next Spring, I plan to follow in her footsteps. Using her journals, I will travel to places she visited before me and create a serialized graphic memoir contrasting my experiences today against hers in decades past. I have funding to recreate her first trip in 1978, but in order to expand the project, I am also raising money here, on Indiegogo.

In writing this travel series, I want to not only examine my relationship with the women in my own family, but also to look at the broader ideas of maternal inheritance and reaction to change. The world is a vastly different place today than it was 38 years ago. In the context of ever-increasing globalization and seemingly exponential technological advances, I hope we don’t forget to consider what has been left to us, and what we leave behind in return. Building on my grandmother's legacy, this project will be part of my own.

Budget & Timeline

I will be traveling during the Spring of 2017. The comics won’t be finished for some months after I return, since it is rather difficult to travel with my drafting table, flatbed scanner, large notebooks, etc. However, backers will receive regular updates during my trip that will likely include limited artwork.

In addition to the money I raise from crowdfunding, I have already received partial funding for this project from Wellesley College’s Mary Elvira Stevens Traveling Fellowship. My budget projection is based on my fundraising goal of $5,000 in combination with my fellowship funding. Here’s a pie chart:

*This breakdown is ultimately pointless because it is highly unlikely that I will meet my exact campaign goal, no more, no less. Certain costs are fixed vs. variable, and that’s how economies of scale work. But I am led to believe that people like charts in this section, so...

Perks

Here are some backer perks! They are available in various combinations, but I thought you might like some better descriptions than what’s over in the right sidebar there.

Postcard

I will send you a postcard from my trip! You can express a preference from where you would like to receive such a missive, I guess, but I reserve the right to ignore your wishes.

Hand-drawn Postcard

Exactly what it says on the box.

Comics

For every country I visit, you’ll receive a digital comic. I cannot, at this time, predict how many issues that will be, because that is entirely dependent on the amount of money I raise. However, thanks to that sweet fellowship money I got from Wellesley, you’ll be receiving a minimum of three (3) issues. Even if I don’t meet my goal! Of course, if you want more comics than that, you’ll have to give me all your money and convince all your friends to give me their money, too.

Additionally, you’ll receive a digital prologue comic before I embark, because I already wrote it. It features my baby niece throwing things around in the background of several panels, because she is a confident lady who knows what she is about.

Souvenir

I will send you a small trinket or such from travels. Who knows what it will be! One time, I came very close to buying a Venetian glass combination bottle-opener/toenail clipper for my brother-in-law, and then I didn’t, because I am a complete and utter dunce. It is truly one of my life’s greatest regrets. I shan’t be making that mistake again.

Whatever your treasure may be, it will most likely contain some marginal utility. Despite my artist sensibilities, I am a Spartan at heart.

Digital Cartoon Portrait

Do you want a cute cartoon portrait of yourself? I’ll draw one for you. Here's Cartoon Me quoting Oscar Wilde:

Portrait of Your Grandma

I will create a portrait of your grandmother/other maternal figure, provided you send me a picture first. (I’m not a mindreader; I don’t know what your grandma looks like.)

But Alix, you say, what about a portrait of my Grandpappy Ephraim? I liked him much better than my shrill harpy of a Grandmother Josephine, who only ever gave me self-help books for Christmas, even when I was a toddler. I am very sorry to hear about Grandmother Josephine. She sounds… well-meaning, if nonetheless terrible. Unfortunately, the entire point of this project is grandmothers and maternal inheritance. Maybe you have a Great-Aunt Suzy you always liked? If no, please come back in a few years when I decide to write something about my dad’s side of the family.

Medium negotiable. I specialize in watercolor, line art, screenprinting, and pasta art.

Original Artwork

I will create some custom artwork from my travels for you to suit your personal interests, both in terms of medium and content.

Risks

My risks are normal travel risks. Getting sick, having my stuff stolen, dying in a fiery plane crash. Basically, things that could happen any time, independently of this project. I’ll have insurance.
