story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT

Since the publication of ArchEnemy, the third volume of the best-selling Looking Glass Wars trilogy, Frank Beddor & The Hatter M Institute have received many inquiries from fans about the fate of Wonderland after the creation of the Everqueen. Following many years of transdimensional research, we've uncovered the harrowing tale of CrossFire. Documented as sequential art, the Institute is now preparing to publish Looking Glass Wars: CrossFire, a graphic novel sequel to the Looking Glass Wars trilogy. It's the first of a duology that will conclude with Looking Glass Wars: UnderFire.

CrossFire is complete and ready to go to press and we are asking for your support to finance the first printing. We've been told readers love the high-quality color, well-bound graphic novels we've been creating for Hatter M and want CrossFire to be just as beautiful.


ABOUT LOOKING GLASS WARS: CROSSFIRE

After the creation of the Everqueen, Alyss Heart of Wonderland faces great difficulty as she fends off political assaults from rival suit families while struggling to maintain diplomatic relations with the tribes of Boarderland. More vulnerable now than ever before, she barely escapes an attempt on her life. No longer sure whom to trust, she aligns with controversial new allies in order to keep Wondertropolis safe and prevent havoc on Earth. And yet the fight, the battle, finds her—as it seemingly always does—and Alyss discovers that all decisions, even the right ones, have consequences.



CrossFire is an all-new 160 page graphic novel. We're making it available in three separate editions: paperback, hardcover, and a hardcover with a bookplate exclusive to this IndieGoGo campaign featuring exclusive art by Sami Makkonen and signed by Frank Beddor, Sami Makkonen, and Curtis Clark.


 ABOUT US

Literary Sleuth and world creator Frank Beddor dared to expose the true story of Wonderland in the New York Times bestselling young adult trilogy The Looking Glass Wars. To satisfy the awakened curiosity of his readers he continued to tell the parallel adventures of Royal Bodyguard Hatter Madigan’s search for the lost princess in the Eisner-nominated graphic novel series Hatter M. He lives in Los Angeles.

Finnish artist Sami Makkonen illustrated the graphic novels Blue (2008) and Deadworld Slaughterhouse (2009) for Desperado before signing on to visually document the travels of Hatter Madigan. A first place recipient of the 2007 Sarjis award for best fantasy comic (writer and illustrator) Sami is a graduate of the University of Tartu Estonia and has illustrated web comics for Chemistry Set and Split Lip as well as CD covers for Finnish artists Ródsogarden and Anssi Kela.

Curtis Clark was raised the son of a farmer in the small town of Wacousta, MI. His work has grown from picking rocks to building worlds. As a lifelong comic book fan, he couldn’t be more excited for the publication of his first graphic novel. Curtis currently lives in Los Angeles where he also writes for film and television.

THE PERKS

We’ve got a lot of exciting perks for supporting CrossFire. The graphic novel is being offered in 3 editions: paperback, hardcover, and signed hardcover with a bookplate exclusive to this IndieGoGo campaign signed by Frank Beddor, Sami Makkonen, and Curtis Clark. Everyone who orders the book will get a glow-in-the-dark wristband and a PDF of the graphic novel. The PDF will be sent in early January.

When we go to cons and meet you, our wonderful fans, we’ve always gotten requests for t-shirts, hoodies, and LGW swag. As part of this campaign, we’re producing exclusive t-shirts and hoodies with the LGW logo and a mug with magic ink. It hides in plain sight as a normal black mug, but fill it with hot tea or coffee and it changes color to reveal art from the World of the Looking Glass Wars.

Sami has graciously offered up his original, hand-drawn art from CrossFire for the campaign. We’ve posted a batch of six spectacular pieces in the gallery. If you back this tier, message us immediately to claim the piece and we’ll mark it as sold.

At $250, we’re offering professionally framed and mounted 18x24 prints on archival paper of the most popular art from the series. Choose from Queen Redd, Warrior Alyss, or Bill Sienkiewicz’s watercolor Hatter Madigan!

For die-hard Looking Glass Wars fans, we’re offering exclusive perks. At $105, go UnderFire as a character in the graphic novel sequel to CrossFire. For $250, Bibwit and Frank will send you a personalized video. You can enter Wonderland in a hand-created portrait by Sami Makkonen and for the ultimate fans, here's your chance come to Los Angeles for a tea party with Frank, Bibwit, and other characters from Wonderland!

Aspiring writers, take note of the $2,500 perk. This is your opportunity
get your book edited by a New York Times best-selling author (over 800,000 copies in print)!




RISKS & CHALLENGES

CrossFire has already been completed and is ready for press. We’re working with Transcontinental, a Canadian printer who prints graphic novels for DC, Image, Boom, and many other publishers. We are experienced in fulfillment from our last three Kickstarter campaigns and can deliver on schedule once we receive the books from our printer. The only possible risk is a delay due to international shipping from the printer to us.

SHARE WONDER

Going into the holiday season, we know budgets are getting stretched thin. Even if you can’t support the campaign, you can spread Wonder by telling your friends and getting the word out on social media using the share tools at the top of the page, posting our campaign video on your facebook/twitter/tumblr or by sharing our campaign link: http://igg.me/at/lgwcrossfire

Thank you for supporting Wonder!

http://igg.me/at/lgwcrossfire

story:
FOR MATURE AUDIENCES ONLY!!

 

Creative Team

  • Honors II - Creator and Writer 
  • Cole Anderson - Art, Lettering, Character Design and Cover Artist ​(Twitter- @CThomasAnderso1)
  • Drew Pritchett - Variant Cover (Twitter- @DPCHARLIES34)
  • Wikid Publishing- Publisher (Twitter- @WikidPublishing)

Cover

Variant Cover

What is Holger: The Last Viking!?

28 Pages of great art and story!

Holger: The Last Viking, is about the remaining survivors of Viking culture. To the outside world, Vikings and their culture have been abolished. However, this is not the case. Holger and the rest of the Viking descendants have created a tenuous peace, and are living together on a remote land known as, Frida. As King, Holger will face a lot of troubling situations as he tries to maintain peace and stave off war on their own land.

 

The Land of Frida Explained

Frida is the land that the descendants from Viking voyages migrated too. As big as a continent, Frida is a self sustaining land with more than enough resources for its people. It is split into 4  "Factions".  With their own twist of Viking culture and traditions.

  • Faction 1: North African
  • Faction 2: Norway, Denmark, Sweden
  • Faction 3: Mediterranean
  • Faction 4: Greenland and Iceland

 

The people of Frida live in harmony, but it wasn't so simple when the land was first discovered. Vikings did what they knew best, fighting, raiding and trading. It wasn't until the chieftains came up with a notion to live in harmony by appointing a leader of, Frida. The only way one becomes King or Queen is through a bloodshed tournament they call... RAGNARÖK!  

Ragnarök

Ragnarök (named after destruction of the cosmos) is the ONLY time the land of Frida allows for unpunished bloodshed. Each faction must put up their greatest warriors, in a fight to the death tournament. There can only be ONE survivor! The warrior who wins the tournament grants his/her faction to choose its King or Queen to rule over, Frida.

 

Issue #1 PREVIEW!

Issue one starts off with our main character, Holger. He is training his only son, Njal personally to get him ready for the upcoming event, Ragnarök.

 

 

Whats The Plan!?

The first issue of Holger: The Last Viking #1, is near completion! This book means a lot to me and I want to share it with the world. The money made from this campaign will be used to fund Holger: The Last Viking #2. My plan is to make this series 8-10 issues. With your support, I believe it's very possible. 

Also if you choose Perk #3, you will receive this awesome postcard of, Holger! So choose Perk #3, TODAY!

Frida is the land that the descendants from Viking voyages migrated too. As big as a continent, Frida is a self sustaining land with more than enough resources for its people. It is split into 4  "Factions".  With their own twist of Viking culture and traditions.

Faction 1: North African
Faction 2: Norway, Denmark, Sweden
Faction 3: Mediterranean
Faction 4: Greenland and Iceland

 
The people of Frida live in harmony, but it wasn't so simple when the land was first discovered. Vikings did what they knew best, fighting, raiding and trading. It wasn't until the chieftains came up with a notion to live in harmony by appointing a leader of, Frida. The only way one becomes King or Queen is through a bloodshed tournament they call... RAGNARÖK!  
Ragnarök
Ragnarök (named after destruction of the cosmos) is the ONLY time the land of Frida allows for unpunished bloodshed. Each faction must put up their greatest warriors, in a fight to the death tournament. There can only be ONE survivor! The warrior who wins the tournament grants his/her faction to choose its King or Queen to rule over, Frida.
 
Issue #1 PREVIEW!
Issue one starts off with our main character, Holger. He is training his only son, Njal personally to get him ready for the upcoming event, Ragnarök.


 
 
Whats The Plan!?
The first issue of Holger: The Last Viking #1, is near completion! This book means a lot to me and I want to share it with the world. The money made from this campaign will be used to fund Holger: The Last Viking #2. My plan is to make this series 8-10 issues. With your support, I believe it's very possible. 
Also if you choose Perk #3, you will receive this awesome postcard of, Holger! So choose Perk #3, TODAY!

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone, my name is David Sandoval and I'm the creator to our Awesome Project The Cursed and the Damned. I've been writing comics for about 2 years and I've managed to self publish 2 books on my own. Our Project The Cursed and The Damned is a story I have been wanting to tell for some time. I took 2 characters and put them against each other. Werewolves vs Zombies. I've been a fan of horror since I was about 10 years old and grew up with George Romero's zombies and loved all the Howling movies. Taking these 2 great ICONS and putting them in a story together meant reliving a part of my childhood and telling a story that would satisfy any horror and comic fan at the same time. Not only are Contributors helping finish this project but at the same time giving it life. I've personally funded the other 2 books published through N.A.S Studios but with The Cursed and The Damned I need help funding it. I went all out and now need your help in making it happen. Funding this project helps pay everyone working on the project (all Artist), designers, printing and distribution.    

Synopsis - The Cursed and The Damned is a story about Werewolves taking on the horrific result of playing God. As the Werewolves come together they bring about a war where no Zombie or Human is Safe. Can they fix what they started or watch as humans become prey and the real enemy watches from the shadows?


What We Need & What You Get

To finish The Cursed and the Damned and get it into your hands we need your help. Financing the product and getting everyone paid for there hard work is a main priority for us, we all believe in this project and decided to start production with out any budget. After determining how big we wanted to go with the project we decided to budget and try Indiegogo to get everyone paid for there hard work and added our printing and distribution cost as well. To break it down a bit more here is a list of everything needing to get taken care of. 

- Pencils, Inks, Flats, Colors, Lettering, Writing, Printing and Distribution    

NOW !!! for a little on our rewards. We have a few one of a kind covers that will only be available on here. The Cursed and The Damned #1 will have an exclusive cover which will only be available as a reward here on Indiegogo. Plus our Exclusive Blank Cover which will be limited to only 150 copies. Original art is one of a kind and that will be available as well. From the covers to pinups created just for our project. 

The Creative Team: 

Story by: David Sandoval

Written by: Luis M. Cruz

Pencil and Inks by: Francesco Iaquinta

Colors by: Jasen Smith

Flats by: Josh Jenson

and Letters by: Austin Janowsky 

 If our project is only partially funded the funds will be divided between the Artist, Printing and Distribution. 

Rewards:

Original Art: All Originals come with 11x17 Color Print.

PinUps


COVERS

The Cursed and The Damned #1 

The Cursed and The Damned #1 Variant Exclusive

The Cursed and The Damned #1 Blank Cover - Limited to 150 copies

The Cursed and The Damned #1 Wrap Cover 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us by Sharing The Cursed and The Damned Indiegogo with all your friends on Facebook and Twitter. 
  • Tell all your Friend and Family about it. Anyone you think would be interested in the Project.
  • Indiegogo has provided us with easy share tools, PLEASE... Use them. 
  • And THANK YOU.

story:
Tier 1: Postcard

Are you some kind of leprechaun who lives in a tiny house and needs something to hang on your wall? Then you’re in luck! For five U.S. gold, you can receive this POSTER FOR LEPRECHAUNS. Rendered in beautiful pixel art and mailed without an envelope (so as many people as possible can see it), this work of art features a small yellow cat, a dramatic sunset, and a signed “thank you" message on the back. What a deal!


Tier 2: Tapestry Pack

“But I’m not a leprechaun, I’m a human!”, you cry out! “What will *I* hang on my normal, human-sized walls?”

Well, human, you are in luck! For a mere 25 U.S. gold, you can receive a FINE TAPESTRY. Printed with bold colors on ye olde polyester knit, these tapestries are essentially posters that don’t fold or tear, are machine washable, and can be crumped up and sent in a regular envelope rather than an expensive poster tube. Choose between two designs: the 18”x28” “Scale” by Kazerad (with coloring help from Ben Hale), featuring Yellow Cat Thing in a large, detailed environment, or the 28”x14” “Unity” by Cheryl Kerr, reminding you that all fantasy races can get along if they really try, and are naked.

And if THAT weren’t enough, the tapestry pack also includes TWO unsigned postcards (so you can send them to your leprechaun friends!) and a sheet of KATIA STICKERS. Featuring six tiny pictures of Yellow Cat Thing giving weird looks in varying direction, these stickers are perfect for introducing a bit of judgmental staring to your other wall decorations.

And, if even THAT wasn’t enough, this and all larger packages also come with an exclusive signed RECEIPT MINICOMIC! Ordinary receipts are stupid and boring and probably invented by elves, so this receipt is a little illustrated story that changes based on the items you purchase, starring the comic’s second-best human character, Asotil.

(Also, by popular request, you can now choose to switch the stickers out for the sew-on patch listed further below. Within a few days of purchase, you should receive an email where you can specify which tapestry you want and whether you'd like stickers or a patch.)



Tier 3: Tote Pack


($5-$10 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

Now, you might be wondering: "but what if I have no walls? What if I'm a wild and rugged adventurer with no home to call my own?" 

Well, as any adventurer will explain before selling you a bunch of vases and wordlessly going to sleep on your couch, the most important thing an adventurer can have is a sturdy bag with which to carry all your questionably-obtained vases. And if you want such a thing, you're in luck! For 25 U.S. gold can receive two postcards, a receipt minicomic, and your very own WITCHHHUNTER TOTE BAG. 

Printed with swirly magic nonsense on both sides, this polyester tote has extra little pockets inside and an extra side pocket on the outside so you can pretend you’re organized as you completely ignore them and throw everything in the main pouch. Use the tote bag to carry your clothes, or to carry your groceries, or to run away with your enemies’ groceries! The possibilities are endless. 

And want even more adventurer-worthy gear? Well, in this pack and every one after it, every 50 cents you pay over the listed price will net you a random FOUR-LEAF CLOVER PIN. Get enough to cover your entire body, making you so lucky you will become LITERALLY INVINCIBLE*.

*disclaimer: This was a lie! You will not be invincible! You’ll just poke your shirt full of holes.



Tier 4: Apparel Pack

($5-$10 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

Posters and totes not your thing? Well, with winter rapidly approaching, your frail, human body needs insulation! One excellent way to achieve this is with a KATIA TORSO COZY, available for the fair price of 35 U.S. Gold.

Screen-printed with breathable, waterbase ink on Port&Co tees, these cotton shirts are available in two designs: a STEALTHY COSPLAY based off Yellow Cat Thing’s armor, or a piece of SWANKY, SILHOUETTED CHARACTER ART drawn by notably-awesome artist SambaNeko.

But wait! In addition to that, two postcards, and a signed minicomic, you will also receive a SEW-ON KATIA PATCH. Beautifully embroidered and measuring just shy of 4 inches in height, the glossy, pineapple-shaped patch is the perfect thing to make your leather biker jacket look 100% less intimidating. That way, your enemies will underestimate you!

(Also, by popular request, you can now choose to switch the sew-on patch out for the stickers listed up above. Within a few days of purchase, you should receive an email where you can specify which shirt you want, as well as your size and whether you'd like stickers or a patch.)




Tier 5: Candy Lizard Pack

($5-$10 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

Have you ever looked at a bunch of irregularly-shaped items and said "wow, it would sure be difficult to find a box or envelope the appropriate shape to affordably send those"? Chances are you haven't, because buyers don't think about that sort of thing! This is probably why so many of you requested the playing cards from the higher-tier packs be available on their own.

Fortunately, your consumer desires have been answered! For 35 U.S. gold, you will receive a deck of AMPHIBIOUS LIZARDPERSON PLAYING CARDS. Based off the deck of cards that appeared early in PREQUEL, this 52-card, poker-sized deck comes with a plastic box for storage and, like its in-comic doppleganger, is completely waterproof. It is the perfect table decoration to let all your visitors know you’re the type of weirdo who always chooses the reptilian race in games, even though you’ve never, ever won a game of Wesnoth as Drakes, or had a decent Slithzerikai character in Avernum. You’ll claim it’s just because you like their stats, but everyone will know the truth.

Still not sold? Well, this pack also comes with a bag of KATIA CANDIES.  Will hard candies survive being sent in bundle of tape and paper or however we decide to mail this?  Will the postal system pulverize them into a fine, sugary dust? Will a folded up copy of the minicomic be enough to protect them? I have absolutely no idea! Think of it as a mirror of Yellow Cat’s own journey.


Tier 6: Double Pack

($5-$10 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

Is your human mind wrought with indecision over whether to get a t-shirt or tapestry? Solve this problem by getting both! For the mere price of 60 U.S. gold, you can receive the DOUBLE PACK.

“But 60 U.S. gold is just as much as ordering a tee and tapestry separate!” your feeble human mind cries out. Well, hold onto your socks, because this is called the “double pack” for a reason. In addition to your choice of one tee and one tapestry, the double pack comes with TWO patches, TWO sticker sheets, and four blank postcards! That’s twice as much stuff as you’d get otherwise, perfect for when you fuck up sewing on a patch, applying a sticker, or addressing a postcard.

Plus, like the Candy Lizard pack, you'll get a bag of KATIA CANDIES! Will being sent in an envelope make them any more likely to survive the trip? We just don't know.


Tier 7: Treasure Chest

($10-$25 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

So let’s say you want to guarantee your hard candies get there in one piece. They’ll need to be sent in a box. And, if you’re gonna be getting an entire box, it makes sense to fill it with all sorts of other stuff that won’t fit in an envelope.

Well crack out your fucking coinpurses, humans, because this is where we get into the cool stuff. For 100 U.S. gold, you will receive the TREASURE CHEST, featuring your choice of any two shirts or tapestries, plus two patches, two sticker sheets, two bags of candy, the receipt comic, the playing cards, the tote bag, a stack of eight postcards, and six random clover pins. Wowie gee!


Tier 8: GIVE ME EVERYTHING

($10-$25 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

Still can’t make up your mind on what to get? Circumvent this issue with the GIVE ME EVERYTHING pack.

For 140 U.S. gold, you will receive both tapestries, both tees, the tote, the cards, and the minicomic. Plus, you’ll get a stack of eight postcards, two bags of candy, two patches, three sticker sheets, and twelve random clover pins! You are now the ultimate PREQUEL reader and everyone will love you*.

*disclaimer: This is also a lie! Only some people will love you.


Tier 9: Give me everything… BUT the Unity tapestry

($10-$25 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

What’s that, human? Rainbows make you cry? You’re afraid of joyful diversity staring at you every day?

Lucky for you, for a mere 145 U.S. Gold you will be sent everything except the Unity mural. Instead, you can just get an extra copy of a tee, the tote, the cards, two each of the patches/stickers, or the other tapestry. Or a bunch of clover pins.


Tier 10: GIVE ME EVERYTHING BUT MAKE THE UNITY TAPESTRY NINE FEET WIDE

($10-$25 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

What’s that, human? You’re COMPLETELY AWESOME and have ENTIRELY TOO MUCH MONEY? Well, celebrate your extravagance with a nine-foot wide rendition of Cheryl Kerr’s “Unity” mural. Easily capable of covering an entire wall, this near-life-size duplicate of the mural from the comic is the perfect decoration for a formal dining room. Your guests will show their appreciation with sparse, awkward side-glances to the mural, trying not to talk about it lest they spend inordinate amounts of time basking in its glory. “Wow,” they’ll say, “the man/woman/other who owns this house sure is a normal and functional human being”.


Estimates are hard, and last time PREQUEL’s author ran a crowdfunding campaign, it made over eight times as much money as expected! What happens if this campaign receives inordinate amounts of gold?

At $50,000, after accounting for production costs, shipping, et cetera, and assuming he can do a big run of new merch every year or two, PREQUEL’s author will no longer need a job. While this won’t necessarily lead to him making more comic updates (since that would constitute being paid to write fanfiction!) it will certainly remove the biggest hurdle to pursuing such hobbies full-time.

At $100,000, PREQUEL’s author will have an obscene amount of money! This is a person who cannot fathom a level of luxury that costs more than 30k a year, tops, and would have no idea what to do with anything beyond that. In celebration of money no longer mattering at all, he’ll draw a tiny Katia in a day-appropriate hat every single day.

At $150,000, PREQUEL’s author will hold SADCATCON once per month. It won’t actually be a convention, it’ll just be him camping out at a mall all day and doing sketches for anyone who shows up and/or requests one over a stream.

Q: I just paid for one of the tiers! How do I tell you which tapestry design I want, or what my shirt size is?

A: Spectacular question, fictitious human! Within a day of paying, you should be emailed a link where you can specify the designs you want and the size needed for each (just in case your torso is different sizes depending what color shirt you wear!). If you do NOT receive a link, it’s time to get angry! Send a very angry email to a@foxmage.com demanding you get the link NOW.

(NEW) Q: What shirt sizes are available?

A: Everything from Women's Extra Small to Women's 4XL, Men's Small to Men's 4XL, and Tall Large to Tall 4XL (do tall people have genders? Nobody knows!). One of the advantages to paying for the shirts before they are ordered is that they can be printed on whatever size is needed.

Q: How long will production/shipping take after the campaign ends?

A: Probably one to two human months. After all the minigames with prizes, PREQUEL’s author has gotten very good at packing and sending hundreds of packages. Most of the merchandise items take 1-3 weeks to produce, with T-shirts being the slowest.

Q: I am a penniless human who is not going to buy anything! Will I still be able to read the receipt minicomic?

A: Fear not, innocent peasant! The comic will be uploaded to the "Side Stories" page later, given that it’ll find its way onto the internet regardless within minutes of the first package arriving someone’s house. But this is your one chance to get a SIGNED, PHYSICAL COPY of the comic! Surely, that is worth taking the cushion off your couch and searching for 100 quarters (they are there! Trust me!).

Q: I am a weird person who wants to give you money and receive nothing in return! Can I do that?

A: Indiegogo will let you do that, but that’s weird! Buy a shirt instead. Or, get a postcard and enter your head-of-state’s address instead of your own. Presidents love webcomics!

(NEW) Q: I want a very specific combination of things (e.g. two shirts)! Can I buy two tiers, or even two of the same tier?

A: You most certainly can! In fact, this is an optimal choice for people who want two copies of the minicomic, so they can put one in front of each eye and read in 3D.  

(NEW) Q: I am a to-the-point person who only wants one particular item with no minicomic or extras! Will items be sold individually after the Indiegogo campaign is over?

A: Some extras will be sold, but they'll be limited in supply - everything is going to be printed in one go. Getting them here will cost you less and also guarantee you don't miss out on the limited supply sold afterwards.

Q: Everyone should donate blood to the red cross! It is not ran by vampires.

A: Wow! That is not a question, but I am glad you have taken the time to say this completely true statement that everyone should know.


If you have any additional questions, email them to a@foxmage.com so they can be added to this list! If not, go read some of the new sidestories or buy some awesome swag!

What’s that, human? Rainbows make you cry? You’re afraid of joyful diversity staring at you every day?
Lucky for you, for a mere 145 U.S. Gold you will be sent everything except the Unity mural. Instead, you can just get an extra copy of a tee, the tote, the cards, two each of the patches/stickers, or the other tapestry. Or a bunch of clover pins.


Tier 10: GIVE ME EVERYTHING BUT MAKE THE UNITY TAPESTRY NINE FEET WIDE


($10-$25 shipping will be added outside the U.S.)

What’s that, human? You’re COMPLETELY AWESOME and have ENTIRELY TOO MUCH MONEY? Well, celebrate your extravagance with a nine-foot wide rendition of Cheryl Kerr’s “Unity” mural. Easily capable of covering an entire wall, this near-life-size duplicate of the mural from the comic is the perfect decoration for a formal dining room. Your guests will show their appreciation with sparse, awkward side-glances to the mural, trying not to talk about it lest they spend inordinate amounts of time basking in its glory. “Wow,” they’ll say, “the man/woman/other who owns this house sure is a normal and functional human being”. 



Estimates are hard, and last time PREQUEL’s author ran a crowdfunding campaign, it made over eight times as much money as expected! What happens if this campaign receives inordinate amounts of gold?
At $50,000, after accounting for production costs, shipping, et cetera, and assuming he can do a big run of new merch every year or two, PREQUEL’s author will no longer need a job. While this won’t necessarily lead to him making more comic updates (since that would constitute being paid to write fanfiction!) it will certainly remove the biggest hurdle to pursuing such hobbies full-time.
At $100,000, PREQUEL’s author will have an obscene amount of money! This is a person who cannot fathom a level of luxury that costs more than 30k a year, tops, and would have no idea what to do with anything beyond that. In celebration of money no longer mattering at all, he’ll draw a tiny Katia in a day-appropriate hat every single day. At $150,000, PREQUEL’s author will hold SADCATCON once per month. It won’t actually be a convention, it’ll just be him camping out at a mall all day and doing sketches for anyone who shows up and/or requests one over a stream.


Q: I just paid for one of the tiers! How do I tell you which tapestry design I want, or what my shirt size is?
A: Spectacular question, fictitious human! Within a day of paying, you should be emailed a link where you can specify the designs you want and the size needed for each (just in case your torso is different sizes depending what color shirt you wear!). If you do NOT receive a link, it’s time to get angry! Send a very angry email to a@foxmage.com demanding you get the link NOW.


(NEW) Q: What shirt sizes are available?
A: Everything from Women's Extra Small to Women's 4XL, Men's Small to Men's 4XL, and Tall Large to Tall 4XL (do tall people have genders? Nobody knows!). One of the advantages to paying for the shirts before they are ordered is that they can be printed on whatever size is needed.
Q: How long will production/shipping take after the campaign ends?
A: Probably one to two human months. After all the minigames with prizes, PREQUEL’s author has gotten very good at packing and sending hundreds of packages. Most of the merchandise items take 1-3 weeks to produce, with T-shirts being the slowest.
Q: I am a penniless human who is not going to buy anything! Will I still be able to read the receipt minicomic?
A: Fear not, innocent peasant! The comic will be uploaded to the "Side Stories" page later, given that it’ll find its way onto the internet regardless within minutes of the first package arriving someone’s house. But this is your one chance to get a SIGNED, PHYSICAL COPY of the comic! Surely, that is worth taking the cushion off your couch and searching for 100 quarters (they are there! Trust me!).
Q: I am a weird person who wants to give you money and receive nothing in return! Can I do that?
A: Indiegogo will let you do that, but that’s weird! Buy a shirt instead. Or, get a postcard and enter your head-of-state’s address instead of your own. Presidents love webcomics!

(NEW) Q: I want a very specific combination of things (e.g. two shirts)! Can I buy two tiers, or even two of the same tier?
A: You most certainly can! In fact, this is an optimal choice for people who want two copies of the minicomic, so they can put one in front of each eye and read in 3D.  


(NEW) Q: I am a to-the-point person who only wants one particular item with no minicomic or extras! Will items be sold individually after the Indiegogo campaign is over?
A: Some extras will be sold, but they'll be limited in supply - everything is going to be printed in one go. Getting them here will cost you less and also guarantee you don't miss out on the limited supply sold afterwards.
Q: Everyone should donate blood to the red cross! It is not ran by vampires.
A: Wow! That is not a question, but I am glad you have taken the time to say this completely true statement that everyone should know. 
If you have any additional questions, email them to a@foxmage.com so they can be added to this list! If not, go read some of the new sidestories or buy some awesome swag!

story:
The Seer #1 is an Afro-punk story about a man who lives on the lower Eastside of Oklahoma City who is tormented in his dreams by God. He soon comes to the realization that his dreams are parallel to his reality and finds himself later gifted with superhuman powers and abilities. 

He soon takes his position as an anti-hero who uses his gifts in the name of "street justice" in order to better the Eastside of OKC from corruption.

The Seer #1 is a milestone in Oklahoma history as the 1st original comic book based on a black hero living in OKC. The Seer #1 is both written and illustrated by black creators. 

The Seer #1 is Rated: T – TEEN 

– Appropriate for readers age 12 and older. May contain intense violence, extensive profanity, nudity, sexual themes and other content suitable only for older readers.​

**T-SHIRTS NOTICE* 

If you chose any of the T-Shirt perks, please indicate what size T-shirt you would like in the Name box field located in checkout.  For example: "John (Large) Doe"

 

Original Artwork & Sketches:

 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FINE PRINT

All projects come with some risks, however the risks with The Seer #1 are relatively low. The book is 100% complete and ready to print, the campaign is just for printing funds - so as soon as the campaign funds, the books will be ordered, and I will ship them out as soon as I get them.

There is some risk that there could be unforeseen problems with the printer or delivery that would be out of my control. I will do my best to mitigate these issues, and of course keep you all updated on any potential delays.

There is also some risk that the books could be damaged in delivery to you. I will do my best to prevent any damage, however if such damage does occur, I will happily ship you a replacement.

Finally, due to COVID-19, I will not be able to ship outside of the U.S. for this campaign. I apologize for this inconvenience. There are digital-only tiers that are available for international backers. Also, once the book is published, there should be options to order it outside of the U.S.

story:
Retrograde is an eerie sci-fi tale about man’s relationship with his best friend. Are men and dogs truly what they seem?

Hi Sci-Fi fans!  The full color 114 graphic novel "RETROGRADE" is now completed!  We need your help in getting the first 500 copies printed and shipped to various comic stores.  Retrograde is a great story with additional potential for the "Big Screen" as we are also currently marketing the full screenplay the novel was developed from.  Subsequently, copies of the graphic novel and cover posters, particularly signed copies may be worth their weight in gold in the future.

Artist Ken Bastard is also known in the graphic comic world for his NONESUCH TALES  series and other fine art work which can be seen at the links below:

http://thenonesuchtales.thecomicseries.com/

http://kenbastard.com

http://kenbastard.tumblr.co

Any additional funding we obtain through IndyGoGo will be used to create more copies, marketing and paying for any unseen costs in shipping out rewards.  Thanks ahead of time for your support!

Alexander "Al" Julian, author of "Retrograde"

Risks and challenges

The only possible obstacle we could foresee would be a slight delay in our mailing rewards, if printing should take longer than expected.

story:
Introduction


(NOTE: International orders please include an extra $5 for shipping)

TARZAN STORY WRITTEN BY DENNIS P. EICHHORN

Hi.  I'm Albert Frank Asker.  I am a comic book fan from from Boise, Idaho.  Recently, I have given presentations on the history of comic books in Idaho at the 2013 Library Comic Con and the THATCamp 2013: Forging Digital Frontiers conference at Boise State University.  I have also recently written an article for The Blue Review called, "The Wild West of Sequential Art: A History of Comic Books in Idaho."

In order to commemorate the second annual Library Comic Con, and to celebrate our Idaho sequential arts heritage, I am starting this campaign to launch "Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho" comic book anthology.  This anthology will showcase the comic book talent from right here in the Gem State.

This is an officially licensed Tarzan comic book from Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. in Tarzana, California.  After the comic book has been printed, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. will keep eight copies of our comic book on file in their archives.  You can see some of Scott Pentzer's wonderful art on the Tarzan story above.  We plan to continue the Tarzan story in next year's anthology.

Edgar Rice Burroughs lived in Idaho on three separate occasions in his life and is a big part of our Idaho sequential arts heritage.  That is why we have decided to license his most famous character for our anthology. 

Some of the writers and artists involved in our anthology include:

  • Charles Soule* (Superman/Wonder Woman, Death of Wolverine)
  • Dennis P. Eichhorn (Real Stuff, Real Good Stuff, Extra Good Stuff)
  • Todd Clark (Lola)
  • Steve Moore (In The Bleachers)
  • Allen Gladfelter (Disney/Pixar's CARS, Occupy Comics)
  • Dame Darcy (Meatcake)
  • Randall Kirby (BOP! Comics)
  • Steve Willhite (FUBAR)
  • Scott Pentzer (Rose & Gunn, Sade, Rock 'n' Roll Comics)
  • Jim Sumii (Tura and Eva)
  • Julia Green (Mystic Pets)
  • Jon Keithley (Shivertown)
  • Shanae LaVelle (Shivertown)

* An adopted son of Idaho for the purposes of our anthology

What We Need & What You Get

Here is why we need money.  We need:

  • $250 for the Tarzan licensing fee
  • $500 for printing costs
  • $50 for shipping costs

The artists and writers donated all of the talent, time, energy, blood, sweat, and tears for the good of the Friends of the Boise Public Library.  We again thank them for their efforts.  I will donate the cost of shipping the incentives out if it is over $50. However, it is preferred that donors pick up the comic book in person at the 2014 Library Comic Con on Saturday August 30th where the anthology will make its debut.  If there is any extra money left over, that cash will go to the Friends of the Boise Public Library.

The Impact

You will be able to own a piece of Idaho sequential arts history and help out a great cause at the same time.

Risks & Challenges

We're waiting on a couple of creators pieces so making the deadline will be a little stressful for the editor (yours truly).  We have already obtained the Tarzan license so that won't be a problem.  Also, this is the first time that we have worked with this printer so hopefully they will be able to turn out a quality product for us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's about it.  Thanks in advance for your help.

story:
we've reached $10,000!! - Every backer will receive An exclusive artist edition print of the original pencil art from super-star comic book artist David Finch. cover art print Measures: 11"W x 17"H (same size as the original.)

A 32 page full color comic book series. The art work is 95% completed.

Jimmy Reyes Cover for issue #1,  colored by Andrew Dalhouse (Bloodshot, Lobo) and lettered by Eric Weathers (Battle Brick Road.)

 

 

 

Virgin cover and Sketch cover are also available.

 

What's It About?

Well, like Jimmy said, it's about a girl named Nuri who can turn into a dragon. She was an orphan and a field servant for the kingdom of Blackcliff. Now she's a young woman, adjusting to a more comfortable lifestyle as a weapon of the monarchy.

But the surrounding kingdoms don't want to live in the shadow of a dragon. And when Nuri begins to learn the truth about her past, she realizes she may be a danger to the very people she's trying to protect.

 

 

 

Great Add-on Perks!

Once you become a Backer you will see these perks when you go through the check out process.  Backers may continue checking out without adding any add-on perks, select one additional add-on perk, or select multiple add-on perks.

 

 

 

The first 30 backers get FREE bonus goodies, such as a button, die-cut sticker and trading card.

The next 31 - 200 backers get a FREE DRAGONRAGE: A Cradle Of Embers pre-launch edition collector's trading card.

Plus, DragonRage: A Cradle Of Embers contains a free additional back-up story by David Philpott, Sarah Perryman and Mark Goldfine.

Welcome!

I'm Dave Philpott, writer for DragonRage and one of the big brains behind Page One Comics. Not long ago, I was talking to Jimmy Reyes (you know, the artist for DragonRage and other big brain behind Page One Comics) about an idea he had. You see, he thought, "What if there was a girl who could turn into a dragon, right? And she protects the village she lives in, but she has to fight another dragon who is attacking her village who may or may not be her father?" And I was like, "Okay." 

And I sat down and wrote DragonRage: A Cradle of Embers.

Meanwhile, Jimmy went to work, building a YouTube channel, doing livestreams, penciling and inking the comic I wrote, developing a website, and pretty much doing all the heavy lifting. And it's because of his hard work and dedication that you are here now, looking to back our comic.

 

Why Should You Care?

I mean, look at the artwork! Jimmy has really outdone himself, evoking the hyper-detailed style of your favorite '90s comics, but with a flavor all of his own. And the story is packed with 32 full-colored pages of action and fighting, dashing young men and beautiful women, a monstrous villain, and most important of all... dragons.

And besides all that, look at the talent we're bringing you! We have superstar colorist ANDREW DALHOUSE in the house! You've loved his gorgeous work on several DC comics, from Batman to Wonder Woman. The color palette he's bringing to DragonRage is BEYOND amazing! (I bet his Crayola game was strong back in the day.)

Oh, and did we mention who penciled our cover? He's only rockstar funny-book legend DAVID FINCH! That's right! The Man Himself blessed us with this absolutely STUNNING cover, exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign! You heard me! This will be one of the rarest Finch covers around, and we've got it!

 

Okay, Okay! So, What Do We Need?

First, take a look at the goodies we have in our tier packages. Check out the add-on perks available for each tier! Go ahead. Look at them.

Bad ass, right?? And get this: we are offering an EXCLUSIVE David Finch cover, beautiful coloring by Andrew Dalhouse, amazing pencils and inks by Jimmy Reyes, and a pretty damn decent story by yours truly, plus all the cool stuff you see here, all for the low, low budget cost of $6000.

And what are we gonna do with that money, you ask? We're going to pay our creative team, we're going to place a premiere-quality comic book in your hands, and here's the best part, we're going to fund the launch of Page One Comics! You heard it here, kids! We've met so many ultra-talented people these past few months that we want to  put their stuff in your face. And by backing DragonRage: A Cradle of Embers, you can help us do just that.

 

 

All Right, So What's The Catch?

Well, honestly, not much.

Unlike many campaigns, we have a book that is mostly complete. Jimmy has a handful of pages left to render, and the Magnificent Mr. Dalhouse is coloring pages for us as we speak. We're working with the same reputable company who printed our free preview, so unless the various institutions of parcel delivery all collapse at once, you're getting what you paid for!

 

 

So, What Are You Waiting For??

Pick a tier that works  best for you, and we'll send you a sexy, shiny new comic, along with any extras you've chosen, all for a ridiculously low backing contribution. Don't forget to check out the add-on perks!

 

You are the reason we are making this happen. You are the reason we can make this happen.

 

Thank you, thank you for your support!

 

 

Campaign Launch for Dragonrage with David Finch

Superstar Artist David Finch (Batman, Moon Knight, Avengers) joins us to celebrate our first campaign on Indiegogo.

We're working with the same reputable company who printed our free preview, so unless the various institutions of parcel delivery all collapse at once, you're getting what you paid for!  So, What Are You Waiting For??Pick a tier that works  best for you, and we'll send you a sexy, shiny new comic, along with any extras you've chosen, all for a ridiculously low backing contribution. Don't forget to check out the add-on perks! You are the reason we are making this happen. You are the reason we can make this happen. Thank you, thank you for your support!  Campaign Launch for Dragonrage with David FinchSuperstar Artist David Finch (Batman, Moon Knight, Avengers) joins us to celebrate our first campaign on Indiegogo.

story:
Mia is one of the best engineers on Terralympus and there's never been a problem that she can't fix.  After discovering a conspiracy aboard the space station, Mia stows away on an expedition spacecraft. Can the expedition crew be trusted or has Mia found herself in an even worse situation? 

Terralympus Volume 2 is the perfect bound 56 page Black & White (Greyscale) graphic novel for anyone who loves science fiction grounded in reality, compelling characters and an exploration of what lies out there in vast realm of space. Your help and support will bring  this story to life! Free Shipping for Australian backers (excluding original art rewards).

 

There are 2 covers for Terralympus Volume 2. The standard cover with artwork by Von Randal and coloured by DC Alonso and a variant cover by Sebastian Navas. The variant cover will be a limited run at approximately a 1 to 10 ratio compared to the standard cover. The cover mock ups are featured below with the final layout to be finalised.

Standard Cover - Von Randal

Variant Cover - Sebastian Navas

I'm really excited to be able to showcase some amazing pages from Terralympus Volume 2. The artist Von Randal has done an awesome job and I'm blown away by his artwork. 

 

Want to see more? I thought so! Here's some additional pages to get you even more excited. It's always fun to show some action sequences.

Terralympus Volume 2 is a 56 page (Final page count to be confirmed), Black & White graphic novel printed on 150gsm glossy interior paper and a 250gsm cardstock cover at standard comic size 260mm x 170mm (10.2" x 6.7"). (For those unfamiliar with gsm, I'm a bit of a paper snob and this is high end paper!) 

Terralympus Volume 1 is a 48 page, Black & White graphic novel also printed on 150gsm glossy interior paper and a 250gsm cardstock cover at standard comic size 260mm x 170mm (10.2" x 6.7").

 

If you haven't read Terralympus Volume 1, please don't worry! The PDF copy of Volume 1 is available at almost every level. There's also print copies of Volume 1 still available to be pledged on. There's also a quick one page recap in Volume 2 so you can jump straight into the excitement. 

Volume 1 (Standard Cover) - Von Randal

 

These are the available rewards that are on offer with this campaign. Check out the different reward levels to find one that suits you.

  • PDF of Volume 1 & 2
  • Print Copy of Volume 1
  • Print Copy of Volume 2 (Normal Cover) Pack
  • Print Copy of Volume 2 (Variant Cover) Pack
  • A5 (5.8 x 8.3 inches) Print Pack
  • Original Artwork

 

What is the Volume 2 Pack?

Each print copy of Terralympus Volume 2 (NORMAL or VARIANT) will include :

  • Exclusive A5 Print (Postcard - 5.8 x 8.3 inches)
  • Exclusive Card

The card is the VIRGIN cover of Volume 1 with artwork by Von Randal and coloured by DC Alonso. The A5 Print is a special CHIBI piece by David Jaxon.

Volume 2 (Standard Cover) - Includes Card & A5 Print

Volume 2 (Variant Cover) - Includes Card & A5 Print

 

What is in the A5 Print Pack?

A5 (Postcard - 5.8 x 8.3 inches) Print Pack consists of 3 awesome limited edition prints with artwork by Von Randal (coloured by DC Alonso) and Brian Lim!

 

What Original Artwork is available?

All original artwork by Von Randal are unique creations by the artist. There are A4 in size (8.3 x 11.7 inches) on artboard and perfect for framing. You get everything in the EXCLUSIVE reward level as well as one of these amazing pieces!

There are only 6 available (so be quick!) :

  • Batgirl (NEW!)
  • Batman
  • Phoenix (Jean Grey)
  • Supergirl
  • Venom
  • Wolverine
  • Wonder Woman

Shaun Keenan (Creator / Writer)

Shaun is a staple in the Australian and New Zealand  convention circuit under his company Comics2Movies. His first comic series XCT has gone from strength to strength with every issue building  on the last. Terralympus is the science fiction series he is very proud to finally bring to life.

Stephen Kok (Creator / Writer)

Stephen has written about cats, dogs and dragons but this is his first foray into the world of science fiction. A childhood of  Star Wars, Star Trek, Babylon 5, Macross etc. has prepared him for this very moment.

Von Randal (Illustrator)

Von is one of the most talented illustrators currently  working in comics. His resume includes Street Clothes, XCT and more. One  of his passions is science fiction and working on Terralympus is an amazing experience for him.

DC Alonso (Colourist)

David has worked for some of the top creative companies  including Blizzard and IDW. He has provided his expertise in adding the colours to the cover and pin ups for Terralympus.

Darren Close (Letterer/ Greyscale)

Darren is the creator of the series Killeroo and is helping out with the lettering for Terralympus and providing some greyscaling on top of Von's works.
story_txt:
Mia is one of the best engineers on Terralympus and there's never been a problem that she can't fix.  After discovering a conspiracy aboard the space station, Mia stows away on an expedition spacecraft. Can the expedition crew be trusted or has Mia found herself in an even worse situation? 
Terralympus Volume 2 is the perfect bound 56 page Black & White (Greyscale) graphic novel for anyone who loves science fiction grounded in reality, compelling characters and an exploration of what lies out there in vast realm of space. Your help and support will bring  this story to life! Free Shipping for Australian backers (excluding original art rewards).
 

There are 2 covers for Terralympus Volume 2. The standard cover with artwork by Von Randal and coloured by DC Alonso and a variant cover by Sebastian Navas. The variant cover will be a limited run at approximately a 1 to 10 ratio compared to the standard cover. The cover mock ups are featured below with the final layout to be finalised.

Standard Cover - Von Randal

Variant Cover - Sebastian Navas

I'm really excited to be able to showcase some amazing pages from Terralympus Volume 2. The artist Von Randal has done an awesome job and I'm blown away by his artwork. 







 
Want to see more? I thought so! Here's some additional pages to get you even more excited. It's always fun to show some action sequences.

story:
Do you like horror? Comics? Gritty, thoughtfully written storylines with deep characters, and beautifully dark illustrations? If so Sharpe Knives will be right up your alley! My name is Anthony Cotter (known in the music world as AcidBrain), author of the series Sharpe Knives, a slasher comic being illustrated by my friend, and underground horror art extraordinaire Martin Trafford! 

Following the great success of our first issue, we have set an even more ambitious goal of $3000 for this campaign for Sharpe Knives#2!! We really went all out here with FOUR different covers!! The official Martin Trafford cover, along with three character-centric variants, all by different artists!! We will also be releasing a very limited first press of issue #2 with the official cover, in the same tradition as #1, as a high quality, glossy cover, graphic novel style art book! These will be very limited based on demand! We've got some awesome new t-shirt designs as well, some killer collectors bundles, and there WILL be more CAMEO tiers this issue, for anyone who wants to be drawn into the next issue!!! Another new feature of #2 is we have graduated to type-lettered dialogue, to make your reading experience easier! The big reason we chose Indiegogo to help raise funds, is because here, even if we don't reach our goal, we'll still be able to use whatever we do raise, to ensure that everyone who contributes gets what they expect! Everybody wins!

We truly hope for this comic to make a splash in the underground horror world, and your support could allow us to continue the franchise throughout more issues, and see it through to its bloody conclusion! I've been developing this story for a decade working my like hell to mix the best writing possible, with the most carnage possible, and all while keeping things real and gritty... and Martin Trafford's artwork just speaks for itself! The guy is a legend and he's been devoting countless hours of his time and energy into knocking the illustration of Sharpe Knives out of the park! Our ultimate long term goal remains for Sharpe Knives to one day become a full length feature film!

Even if you can't afford to contribute at this time, please give our campaign a share! Any exposure we can get is helpful and hugely appreciated!

story:
We're Making a Comic Book!

REFORM SCHOOL NINJA GIRLS is a new comic book written by Corey Reid and drawn by Dave Knox. The script is written, the characters are designed, and we've finished up an 8-page Prologue you can read on our website.

This story is about five awesome ninja girls and their stuggle to do the right thing and save the day, even when nobody will believe in them. There's action and suspense galore, and beautiful art to go along with it, and we can't wait to share it with everyone. The world needs more ninja girls! And YOU can make it happen!

What We Need & What You Get

We've gotten a long way already. We have a script that covers four full issues (with plans for many more), top-notch character designs, a wild fantasy setting (that you can contribute to), and we'll be posting an eight-page full-colour prologue on our website for everyone to read. The $10,000 we've raised will go straight to paying Dave, our artist, so he can work full-time and finish up the first issue.

We have some really cool rewards for our backers. Of course everyone gets a copy of the book when it's done, but we'll also have pins for different ninja clans, so you can show your ninja pride, an exclusive sketchbook of art and writing, or even original art and the chance to make up your own ninja clans that will be featured in future issues of REFORM SCHOOL NINJA GIRLS.

Not Just a Comic Book; It's a Whole World!

The world of REFORM SCHOOL NINJA GIRLS is a collaborative setting, available under a Creative Commons license. You can check it out at DINO-PIRATES OF NINJA ISLAND. By supporting this comic book you are helping to support a flourishing collaboration that anyone can contribute to or derive from.

We've been building and expanding the world of the DINO-PIRATES for years now, and REFORM SCHOOL NINJA GIRLS is the first traditional narrative to be released from this setting. We've already released a successful role-playing game based on the setting, and several supporting products including a full-on adventure with characters you can use to create your own stories.

The fantastic excitement of DINO-PIRATES OF NINJA ISLAND should belong to everyone! Fund this comic book and be a part of it!

But Wait, There's More!

At our website we'll be posting updates, both art and story. You'll get to see full-colour pages from the Prologue, telling the story of what happened when Masayo first arrived on Ninja Island, and who was waiting for her.

You can get in on the fun with our ongoing "Ask a Ninja Girl" advice column -- post your questions for the girls to answer, but don't blame us if a bunch of delinquent ninja girls come up with some terrible advice.

Spread the Word!

In addition to pledging your support, you can also help us out by TELLING OTHERS about this project. Tweet it, Facebook it, chat about it over coffee. Indiegogo has sharing tools right here on this page, so please push those buttons. Every eyeball helps!

story:
*Important notice*

Even if the Mega Pod isn’t fully funded you will still receive your perks when the funding has ended. You will receive an email when your boxes are ready to be shipped.



Summary

MegaPod is a new monthly subscription box similar to MyGeekBox and LootCrate. Every month there will be a different theme in which the MegaPod will follow. They will be full of merchandise from different games, TV shows and films! The boxes will include items such as T-Shirts, figures, posters and other collectables! There will also be Pop Funko’s in some boxes for all of the collectors out there (ourselves included).


As well as the MegaPod we will also be providing a MiniPod. The MiniPod’s will follow the same monthly theme as the MegaPod however they will not be available for monthly subscriptions to begin with. MiniPod’s will be slightly smaller but will still include amazing merchandise and cool items!


In every MegaPod and MiniPod you will receive a mini Pokemon figure so you may get a MetaPod in your MegaPod *hehe*. The mini Pokemon figures in every box will be on going so you can collect your own pokemon and catch them all!


MegaPod will give you something to look forward to each month and with a different theme each time, you will never get the same item twice!



The Team

MegaPod and MiniPod is managed by a young couple from the North East. We both have a high interest in games, films and TV shows and are very passionate about all things nerdy. With the help of some of our friends we have developed the MegaPod to share our interests with everyone else!



Target and how it will help us:

We have set a target of £2000, this will:

  • Help us buy the best quality stock for our followers,
  • Help us in creating our own custom t-shirts and posters which will be designed by the team,
  • Go towards the packaging to make sure not only is the contents amazing, but the packaging looks like a gifts itself,
  • Making sure you as our subscribers get the best product we can offer!


With this target we will be able to bring you amazing merchandise every month in both the MegaPod and the MiniPod at a low monthly price!



A little more about MegaPod

MegaPod will be offering products which are at high interest to our followers and will fill them with excitement! As well as offering the same excitement in our smaller MiniPod. We shall be offering a new theme every month in both the MegaPod and the MiniPod, there will never be the same items in both the MegaPod and the MiniPod. There will be prizes given away every month in random boxes so you might even be the lucky winner!

We want our customers to feel important and part of our lives. We want you to be as excited as we are about MegaPod and MiniPod. Our first followers will be offered launch boxes which can be purchased on this site at a low price. The launch boxes will be a taster of what is to come very shortly! The prices of a subscription when our site launches will be as follows for the MegaPod:

1 month subscription - £16.99

3 month subscription - £16.49

6 month subscription - £15.99

12 month subscription - £14.99


The MiniPod will be £9.99 for each month and will follow the monthly theme however it is not available for subscription as yet. Post and Packaging to the UK will be free and there will be a small charge for international shipping.


The money raised will help us purchase the last of the boxes for the MegaPods and MiniPods. We want our subscribers to know that we value every bit of help you can give us, without you there would be no MegaPod or MiniPod.



Any other ways I can help?

Share and spread the word. Post a link on your blog, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram! Getting the word out would help us so much in building our following base and getting to know our subscribers even more! We couldn’t do this without you.


From us two over at MegaPod, thank you very much! :)

story:
I remember gasping. I was amazed to have stumbled upon the wreckage of a pirate's ship. Despite my father's warnings, I got closer. I needed to explore this treasure. I cared little for whatever cargo there was to loot. I needed to see that ship. 
The Siren's Scream.
It screamed. It screamed, and it called. It called. And I answered.

I let my father have what he wanted of that ship. There were chests overflowing with gold. Martin said I was foolish to let my father have what he wanted. The petty finder's fee I was afforded was just that. But it was just enough to commandeer myself a ship. I was only sixteen at the time. Barely a woman and hardly a pirate. Martin came with me though, and – with him – came the bulk of my father's crew.

I left him to his gold and never looked back. 

Gone are the days of swashbuckling stories shoving women and the queer community into the background. Gone are the swoons and corsets and impractical heels. Embrace an adventure that lays siege to issues of gender, race and sexuality while engaging readers in the tale of a captain who always gets her girl.

Black Gold follows the story of Captain Jacqueline DeBeau and the crew of the Siren Queen as they sail the 19th century waters of the Mediterranean raiding merchant ships in the name of fortune and fame. Captain Jaq steers her ship with an iron fist. She demands respect and accepts nothing but utmost loyalty from her men. The crew of the Siren Queen never takes prisoners. Jaq DeBeau disallows the trade of human flesh - either for labor or pleasure - making her the toughest pirate captain to serve under. 

After a loot job gone bad, Jaq finds herself the steward of a dozen African slaves. Men, children and one striking woman who captures the attention of the crew - and the captain's heart. When a crew driven nearly mad by greed and starvation threatens mutiny, Jaq is faced with a compromise of her moral convictions that could leave her without her loot, her love or even her life.

             


Answer the Siren's call.

Growing up gay just wasn't an easy thing in the 90's. There were a handful of lesbians in the media, and those were either cheating heart breakers (sorry Mr. Geller) or complete subplot (ie Xena). Thanks to mainstream media, I saw a lot of stuff online that no teenager should ever be exposed to. So, when I was finally handed my college degree, I knew there was only one route to take. I had to use my powers for good.

Jacqueline DeBeau came to me in a dream, and her whole story was carefully planned only hours later. 

Black Gold isn't about forcing a woman into a man's role - or a lesbian into the fray. My goal is to simply give comic readers a great story with the action and adventure (and a hint of romance) they crave - with a protagonist who just so happens to be a lesbian. No token characters - just to say they're there - but characters who are people. Normal people.

Because, in the end, Black Gold isn't about nuance or novelty; it's about normalcy.

I had to use my powers for good.Jacqueline DeBeau came to me in a dream, and her whole story was carefully planned only hours later. Black Gold isn't about forcing a woman into a man's role - or a lesbian into the fray. My goal is to simply give comic readers a great story with the action and adventure (and a hint of romance) they crave - with a protagonist who just so happens to be a lesbian. No token characters - just to say they're there - but characters who are people. Normal people.Because, in the end, Black Gold isn't about nuance or novelty; it's about normalcy.

story:
Comics From the Farthest Corner of the Earth

Every year, Cloudscape Comics releases a new graphic novel anthology built around a specific theme. This year, we are proud to present our seventh compilation: Waterlogged - Tales from the Seventh Sea.

Prepare yourself for a gorgeous hardcover tome printed in blue & black and featuring over 30 different artists from British Columbia!

Waterlogged is overflowing with all sorts of nautical goodness: explorers, kraken, pirates, mermaids, naval officers, ghosts, and more can all be found between the pages. Living as we do on North America's rainy northwest coast, the sea is always on our artists' minds. Each story is one creator's unique response to our great blue neighbour.

Cloudscape Comics

The Cloudscape Comics Society is a nonprofit artists' group based in Vancouver, dedicated to supporting indie comics creators of all sorts. We have weekly gatherings, run events for the public, host a studio space for our members, and of course create comics. We have a lot of experience making good books but without a publisher to back us, we rely on eager readers like you to fund each print run. We need your help to make this project a reality.

What We Need

Because this project is a bit more ambitious than most we've done, the print cost is a little higher. With printing and shipping costs, Cloudscape needs to raise at least $6500 to get this going. If we make more than that, then more books will be printed! We have some stretch goals in mind too.

What You Get

Waterlogged is going to be Cloudscape's best book yet! Filled with beautiful seafaring tales, the collection boasts works from such fantastic artists as Sam Logan (Sam & Fuzzy), Angela Melick (Wasted Talent), Nina Matsumoto (Yokaiden, Bongo Comics), Colin Upton (Postmodern Mini-Comics), Gabriel Frizzera, Lucy Bellwood (Baggywrinkles), Jonathon Dalton (A Mad Tea-Party), Laura Bifano, Jeff Ellis (Teach English in Japan) and many others. 

The book will:

  • be hardcover
  • have a limited palette of blue and black
  • be over 200 pages!
  • have more than 30 artists and writers' work inside

We are selling a variety of our other creations as part of this fundraiser, including:

  • many of our previous anthologies
  • members' personal graphic novels
  • ebooks
  • prints
  • your personal avatar drawn by one of our artists 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Cloudscape relies on our community of fans to spread the word. Retweet us, pass our video around, and tell your friends about this campaign!

Etsy: http://www.etsy.com/shop/cloudscapecomics

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Cloudscape?fref=ts 

Twitter: https://twitter.com/CloudscapeComic 

Tumblr: http://cloudscapecomics.tumblr.com/ 

And our main website: http://www.cloudscapecomics.com

 

More information on the "Siren's Avatar," "Spoils of Drawing Day," and "Waterlogged Original Pages"

All three of these rewards ask you to make some choices and email them to us or leave us a message. All of the information you need to know (and the galleries of Spoils drawings and original pages) can be found in one place:

http://www.cloudscapecomics.com/commissions/waterlogged-avatar-commissions/

 

* Retailers, send an email to comm(at)cloudscapecomics(dot)com if you want to pre-order books at wholesale prices and with bulk shipping.


We'd like to thank the Vancouver Maritime Museum for generously allowing us to film goofy fundraiser videos at their facility!

Thanks for your support!

WE DID IT!

Thank-you to everyone who contributed! We did it! We made the goal! And we couldn't have done it without you. There's only a little over a day left, but at this point I think it's time to start unleashing some stretch goals! Here are the extra things we can throw in if we make the following targets:

At $7500:

- Two new ebooks will be added to the "Barrel-Full of Ebooks" at no extra charge. One will be Chop Suey by Jonathon Dalton, and the other will be a surprise (I'm still securing the rights to the book that I want to include).

- Every reward at $45 or more will get a sticker of our Cloudscape coat of arms from Giants of Main Street, and a sheet of six temporary tattoos based on the gorgeous tattoos some of our artists drew for the title pages in Waterlogged.

At $8000:

- Every reward that needs to be physically mailed to backers will include one temporary tattoo and one sticker.

- Every reward worth $45 or more will also include a minicomic version of This Is How F***ing Scary the Ocean Is by Colleen Webber, which was originally going to be a part of Waterlogged, but couldn't be included because of its unusual size.

story:
Short Summary

From the books which were entered at SPACE (Small Press & Alternative Comics Expo) 2015, we are awarding the 2015 SPACE Prizes. The prizes will be presented in four categories- General, Graphic Novel, Minicomic / Short Story and  Webcomic. The winners will be picked by three voting bodies in each category.
Two  judges and the registered SPACE 2015 Exhibitors.


The winners of the General and Graphic Novel SPACE prizes will each win a cash prize of $300.00 and a plaque.
The winners of the Minicomic / Short Story  and Webcomic categories will each win a $100.00 cash prize and a plaque.
 The plaque presentation will be held during SPACE 2016 on April 9, 2016 at the
Northland Performing Arts Center in Columbus.

Bill Knapp the winner of the first SPACE Prize

The SPACE Prizes have been awarded at the Small Press & Alternative Comics Expo in Columbus, Ohio since 2008. It has grown from a single prize in 2008 to it's present four categories in 2013. Go to SPACE Prize for all the previous winners.

SPACE is dedicated to providing small press and independent comics producers an inexpensive option to exhibit their work.  The SPACE Prize was the next step to help out the small comics producer by providing  the exhibitors with recognition for their work and also a little cash.

The SPACE Prize has been awarded since 2008 and regardless of the outcome of the campaign it will be awarded for the 2015 class. SPACE has always been economically sound and supports itself along with the SPACE Prize.  We are offering free admission this year and expect increases in operating cost going forward so we are hoping to get ahead with this campaign to insure that both SPACE and the SPACE Prize continue for years to come.


Lora Innes, winner of the 2009 SPACE Prize for The Dreamer.

Even if you can't afford to contribute you can help by sharing this campaign with others.
Thank you.

4152-3124-5062-7093

https://www.facebook.com/Meteorix5.9NoAprobado

  

UPDATE  : Rifa de ejemplar de coleccion "Erotic-Fan, especial de Katzandra"  (09/07/2013) 

 

Cortesia de Jorge Break  , a las personas que nos apoyen apartir de hoy y hasta el cierre de la campaña participan en la rifa del ejemplar de coleccion autografiado:

 "Erotic-Fan, especial de Katzandra"

 Las basese son la siguientes:

  1. Participan todos los donadores a partir del 09/07/2013 
  2. Por cada $5 dolares obtienes un boleto para participar  
  3. Deberan se mayores de  18 años o mayoria de edad en su pais de origen, debido a que el contenido del ejemplar es estrictamente para adultos.
  4. El ejemplar se rifara el viernes 2 de agosto de 2013 a traves de la pagina https://www.sortea2.com/
  5. Lo no estipulado se resolvera con los organizadores

 

UPDATE  : Nuevo video, bio de Katzandra Komplex (07/07/2013) 

Bio de Katzandra

http://youtu.be/pkm5XX6QmCs

UPDATE  : Nuevo video, bio de Centella Azul (03/07/2013) 

Bio de Centella Azul

http://youtu.be/tYEQgwSs6IQ

Breve reseña

 

Katzandra, el iconico personaje del exitoso comic Meteorix 5.9 no aprobado, creado por el talentoso Jorge Break aparece de forma estelar en este crossover uniendo fuerzas con la Agente Libre del Orden Centella Azul , personaje creado por Jorge De la Rosa

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Requerimos una inversion para la impresion de 1000 ejemplares de 20 paginas, tamaño comic. Portada a color.

Por tu apoyo recibes el ejemplar en tu propior hogar, y dependiendo de tu entusiamo, posters, camisetas y dibujos autografiados

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Puedes ayudar compartiendo con tus amigos y fans del comic este proyecto , dando like en nuestras paginas en facebook

https://www.facebook.com/CentellaAzul

https://www.facebook.com/Meteorix5.9NoAprobado

 

Si te apasiona dibujar ¿Por que no compartirlo con nosotros? tenemos muchos amigos que nos comparten su talento :

http://justsitback.deviantart.com/?rssQuery=gallery%3Acentellaazul%2F39055653&s=8%2C3%2C0

story:
This Campaign

allows you to get 1 of only 100 limited edition virgin covers of White Lily #4 offering this image.

Overview

”White Lily" was the aviator call sign (translated from Russian) of the world's highest scoring female fighter ace, Lydia "Lilya" Litvyak. Also featured is her wing man, Yekaterina "Katya" Budanova, who was the only other woman to earn the title of "Ace" fighter pilot. Both of these incredible women flew for the Soviet Union in the war against Nazi Germany in the early 1940's. Our story follows their battles, both in the air and on the ground.

The Story

Here is the team that brought you issue 4: 

Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): Preston Poulter (Writer / Creator): This is my passion project. As I search for meaning and purpose in my own life, I often reflect on what it must have been like to serve one horrible regime in order to fight another. The story of Lilya Litvyak speaks to me, and this project allows me to share her story with others.

Jake Bilbao (Penciler) is a freelance Comic book Artist that has worked on titles like Bloodrayne, Pathfinder, Wolverine.

Jag Kumar (Inker) Jag is an award winning inker from New Delhi who has been published by IDW, Dynamite, Zenescope, DC and more.  His current work can also be seen in the GI Joe series.

Blond the Colorist (Colorist and Editor): Industry veteran colorist from series such as Superman, Green Lanterns, and Red Hood & The Outlaws.

Issue 4 finds our two main characters, Katya and Lilya, fighting for their lives over the skies of Stalingrad against an enemy that is better equipped, better trained, and more experienced.  

Why this project?

I have always had a strange fascination with self-destructive genius. Those people who have amazing ability to create and influence, but can't seem to find any compelling reason for their own existence. 

n fiction, we cloak these figures in noble ambitions towards unrealistic ideals and often give them superhuman powers to defy the odds. Inevitably, these stories become a quest for redemption measured in the number of times the day got saved. But what if it was your self-destructive nature itself that was your superpower?

This story finds Lydia Litvyak, the White Lily of Stalingrad, falling further and further into the grip of her own death wish. And yet, it is that disregard for her own safety that makes her such a fearsome opponent. 

It is in her story that I have found the quintessential tortured genius. 

How does this project compare to others?

Fans of Lady Death by Brian Pulido, Cyberfrog by Ethan Van Sciver, Gabriel Picolo's Icarus and the Sun, Mike S Miller's Lonestar: Heart of a Hero, Jon Malin's Graveyard Shift, Mitch Breitweiser's Red Rooster: Golden Age / Futurists, or Richard C Meyer's Jawbreakers: Lost Souls / G0d-K1ng will all be disappointed as those books are far superior to anything I will ever produce. Now, in comparison to Vestige, the book is far superior. I've seen the creativity from WarCampaign. Nuff said.

Also, my book is historical. So, there's that.
