story:
UPDATE, 6/23/11:

We've reached our goal! Thank you, donors! Any money collected after today will go to the Joplin Public Schools' Adopt-a-Classroom Fund to replace classroom supplies. Donors will still get the comic book(s) and other rewards promised for their level, and the money will still help the kids in Joplin.


Thank you!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Why Make Comics for Kids in Joplin?

Last month, Joplin, Missouri, was hit by one of the deadliest tornadoes in U.S. history. About 8,000 buildings were damaged or destroyed, or around 30% of the city. Thousands of families lost their homes and are living in shelters.

 

Relief agencies are taking care of immediate needs: food, clothing, and housing.

 

We decided to offer what we can: astronauts, an octopus with glasses, and talking hot dogs.

 

When we heard that kids in Joplin have been struggling to cope with the disaster, we decided to create Comics Express, a 24-page, FREE comic book just for them. It'll be packed with funny comics and stuff to do from some of the most creative, original, and well-known cartoonists.

 

The comic book will give young kids up to teens something more fun to think about than damaged neighborhoods and uprooted lives. The Joplin Public Library will coordinate with local groups to distribute the comic books to kids FREE in July.


All cartoonists, editors, and designers are donating their work. We need your help to pay for printing 5,000 copies and shipping them to the children of Joplin.


How Can You Help?

Please help us raise $6,000 to cover the costs of printing and shipping Comics Express to Joplin. Anything you donate will help us create something fun for kids there, many of whom lost everything.


Contributors who give $20 will get a copy of this amazing, limited-edition comic book. And if you're a comics fan, you're going to want one! Some pretty impressive artists are involved (see below).

A copy of Comics Express is also a great gift for kids in your life. Each $20 copy of Comics Express you buy pays for 16 copies for kids in Joplin.


If you can give more than $20, our famous cartoonists will share even cooler rewards with you: posters, comic book collections, graphic novels, t-shirts, and original art.

How Will the Money Be Used?

The $6,000 will go only towards printing and shipping the comic book, and to send rewards to donors.


We're already at work on Comics Express, so if you donate and we don't reach our goal, you're still guaranteed to get as many copies as your reward level promises. 

Any money we receive over our goal will go to the Joplin Public Schools Adopt-a-Classroom fund.

Please join us in making this original collection of awesome comics to benefit the kids of Joplin!

Who Are We?

We're a group of cartoonists, editors, and designers who used to work at Nickelodeon Magazine. For 16 years, we kept millions of kids entertained on a monthly basis.


The award-winning comic artists in Comics Express include:

Bill Alger - Nickelodeon Magazine, Cartoon Network Presents, Homeboy

Corey Barba - Yam

Ana Benaroya - illustrator and hot sauce lover

David DeGrand - Heeby Jeeby Comix

Chris Duffy - Bizarro Comics

Ellen Forney - I Love Led Zeppelin; I Was Seven in '75

Felipe Galindo (Feggo) - Manhatitlan; cartoonist for The New Yorker

Amanda Geisinger - illustrator

Jennifer Holm - Babymouse, Squish

Matthew Holm - Babymouse, Squish

Caitlin Keegan - illustrator of Shakespeare's Love Sonnets

Robert Leighton - cartoonist for The New Yorker

Alec Longstreth - Phase 7

Mark Martin - Gnatrat

Dan Moynihan - Heeby Jeeby Comix

Travis Nichols - The Monster Doodle Book

Dave Roman - Astronaut Academy: Zero Gravity; Teen Boat 

Johnny Ryan - Angry Youth Comix; Prison Pit

Karen Sneider - cartoonist for The New Yorker

Raina Telgemeier - Smile; The Baby-Sitters Club


The editors, writers, and designers putting Comics Express together are: Carmen Morais, Laura Galen, Chris Duffy, Dave Roman, Rachel Roswal Bozek, Andrew Brisman, Lori Crook, Tim Jones, Caitlin Keegan, Yael Lewin, Susan Mitchell, Steven Stern, Catherine Tutrone, Paul Tutrone, and Julie Winterbottom.

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have friends who:

    • like comics?

    • like kids?

    • like Missouri?

    • hate tornadoes?


Send them this link http://www.indiegogo.com/ComicsExpress and ask them to join you in creating Comics Express. For just 20 bucks, they can get their own copy, plus cover the cost of giving the comic to 16 more kids in Joplin.


Thank you!


[p.s. Cover image above by Alec Longstreth; lettering by Caitlin Keegan.]
story_txt:
UPDATE, 6/23/11: 
We've reached our goal! Thank you, donors! Any money collected after today will go to the Joplin Public Schools' Adopt-a-Classroom Fund to replace classroom supplies. Donors will still get the comic book(s) and other rewards promised for their level, and the money will still help the kids in Joplin.

Thank you!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Why Make Comics for Kids in Joplin?Last month, Joplin, Missouri, was hit by one of the deadliest
tornadoes in U.S. history. About 8,000 buildings were damaged or destroyed, or around 30% of the city. Thousands of
families lost their homes and are living in shelters. 
 
Relief agencies are taking care of immediate needs: food,
clothing, and housing. 
 
We decided to offer what we can: astronauts, an octopus
with glasses, and talking hot dogs.
 
When we heard that kids in Joplin have been struggling to
cope with the disaster, we decided to create Comics Express, a 24-page, FREE
comic book just for them. It'll be packed with funny comics and stuff to do
from some of the most creative, original, and well-known cartoonists. 
 
The comic book will give young kids up to teens something more fun to think about than damaged neighborhoods and uprooted lives. The Joplin Public Library will coordinate with local groups to distribute the comic books to kids FREE in July. 

All cartoonists, editors, and designers are donating their work. We need your help to pay for printing 5,000 copies and shipping them to the children of Joplin.

How Can You Help?
Please help us raise $6,000 to cover the costs of printing and shipping Comics Express to Joplin. Anything you donate will help us create something fun for kids there, many of whom lost everything.

Contributors who give $20 will get a copy of this amazing, limited-edition comic book. And if you're a comics fan, you're going to want one! Some pretty impressive artists are involved (see below).

A copy of Comics Express is also a great gift for kids in your life. Each $20 copy of Comics Express you buy pays for 16 copies for kids in Joplin.

If you can give more than $20, our famous cartoonists will share even cooler rewards with you: posters, comic book collections, graphic novels, t-shirts, and original art.

How Will the Money Be Used?
The $6,000 will go only towards printing and shipping the comic book, and to send rewards to donors. 

We're
 already at work on Comics Express, so if you donate and we don't reach our goal, you're still guaranteed to get as many copies as your reward level promises. 

Any money we receive over our goal will go to the Joplin Public Schools Adopt-a-Classroom fund.

Please join us in making this original collection of awesome comics to benefit the kids of Joplin!

Who Are We?
We're a group of cartoonists, editors, and designers who used to work at Nickelodeon Magazine. For 16 years, we kept millions of kids entertained on a monthly basis. 

The award-winning comic artists in Comics Express include:
Bill Alger - Nickelodeon Magazine, Cartoon Network Presents, Homeboy

Felipe Galindo (Feggo) - Manhatitlan; cartoonist for The New Yorker
Amanda Geisinger - illustrator
Jennifer Holm - Babymouse, Squish
Matthew Holm - Babymouse, Squish
Caitlin Keegan - illustrator of Shakespeare's Love Sonnets
Robert Leighton - cartoonist for The New Yorker
Alec Longstreth - Phase 7
Mark Martin - Gnatrat
Dan Moynihan - Heeby Jeeby Comix
Travis Nichols - The Monster Doodle Book
Dave Roman - Astronaut Academy: Zero Gravity; Teen Boat 
Johnny Ryan - Angry Youth Comix; Prison Pit
Karen Sneider - cartoonist for The New Yorker
Raina Telgemeier - Smile; The Baby-Sitters Club

The editors, writers, and designers putting Comics Express together are: Carmen Morais, Laura Galen, Chris Duffy, Dave Roman, Rachel Roswal Bozek, Andrew Brisman, Lori Crook, Tim Jones, Caitlin Keegan, Yael Lewin, Susan Mitchell, Steven Stern, Catherine Tutrone, Paul Tutrone, and Julie Winterbottom.

Other Ways You Can Help
Do you have friends who:
    • like comics?
    • like kids?
    • like Missouri?
    • hate tornadoes?

Send them this link http://www.indiegogo.com/ComicsExpress and ask them to join you in creating Comics Express. For just 20 bucks, they can get their own copy, plus cover the cost of giving the comic to 16 more kids in Joplin.

Thank you!

[p.s. Cover image above by Alec Longstreth; lettering by Caitlin Keegan.]

story:
So what is this comic about?

At the start of Under Fire, Pvt Jeremy "Sparky" Sfakanos doesn't come home, and Pvt Adrian Baker is coming home haunted.  What he thinks is going to fix him -- his small town, his family, his old life -- turns out to be no less fractured than he is. 


That seems like a strange thing to write a comic about.

It's a story that I don't think gets enough attention-- whether real or fictional.  Besides, Under Fire is about a lot of things.  It's about coming back from life-changing events.  It's about holding onto the people you love when circumstances push you apart.  It's about being brave.  It's about wounded warriors.  It's about mental health.  It's also about family, hindsight, discrimination, and the unexpected.


The comic itself includes historical notes -- in the process of piecing together this story I learn more than I ever thought I'd know about problems with humvees, the history of camouflage, and the way we treat our returning soldiers.  Some of this shows up in nearly unnoticeable ways, but other pieces are so important or interesting that they need to be highlighted in text.


Why a "starter & convention kit"? 

This is still a work in progress.  It's going to take a lot of time and work to finish, at which point I'd like to sell it as a perfect-bound graphic novel, all in one piece.  If all goes well (i.e., if I have an income), I'll even be able to put a large portion of the profits toward organizations dedicated to returning service members that serve their mental health needs as well as their physical ones.  But to get there, we need two things: materials, and support. 

Support comes in the form of exposure, which we'll be able to get by presenting a piece of Under Fire at ConBust, SPACE, and MoCCA this summer by way of a super kind friend -- Kristina Stipetic, creator of 14 Nights (comic occasionally NSFW) -- offering to share table space.  So in order to get our materials ready for the con circuit much sooner than we'd ever expected, we need your help to fund the printing of a small preview of Under Fire with authors notes, plus some prints of comic-related artwork.

Under Fire is made with pencil, pen, and markers.  The tricky thing about traditional media is that it runs out.  Unfortunately the last set of markers purchased turned out to be counterfeit -- they've already started to dry up.  Some of your donations will be put toward purchasing a set of refillable Shin Han Touch Twin markers (much more affordable than other art markers) and the ink to refill them.

If both of these things can happen, it will put Under Fire on a surer track to being completed and shared with the world.

If this is just a preview, what are the long-term plans?

Eventually this will be released, at its completion, as a full one-shot graphic novel project.  I say graphic novel project, and not only graphic novel, because the story also includes some prose and nonfiction/educational/historical notes, so it's slightly "mixed media."


My dream is not to make any substantial profit from this project, but to use it to raise awareness about the issues it includes in the story and, if it does make money past breaking even, to put a significant portion of the proceeds towards organizations that help address those issues (especially those dedicated to assisting returning veterans with rebuilding their lives stateside, maintaining housing, and coping with compromised mental and physical health).


Where does the money go?

Funds are going, in order,:

  1. to have previews printed
  2. to have prints made
  3. toward necessary art supplies


Extra funds will help us purchase a plane ticket to get to SPACE in Ohio.


What do I get?  How do I know this is going to happen?

If you back the project, in addition to the perks listed with the pledge levels, anyone who donates will receive an email invitation to the website where Under Fire will begun updating online sometime in March or April.  In addition, you can follow the Bombshell Cat Studio website for updates on the comic as it's being created, including character sketches, notes, and snippets of prose that lends to the scripts and may be published separately later on.

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money for a small print run of a hardcover book version of my webcomic "A Redtail's Dream". So if the goal is met this is basically a grand preorder event for the book, and as with other crowdfunding campaigns; if the goal isn't reached all the money will be automatically refunded to everyone. In that case "A Redtail's Dream" will simply stay in its purely digital format on the web and the universe moves on. But let's aim for a book!

If you stumbled upon this campaign without knowing about the comic beforehand, you can already read it for free over here if you'd like to.  I started drawing this comic in spring 2011 during my second year of university, and finished it at 550 pages just a few months ago. The final chapter is currently being published online at a pace of six pages per week so you can still hop on and experience the end together with all the other wonderful and kind readers! The story is about a young Finnish lad named Hannu Viitanen and his shapeshifting, talking dog Ville, who are on a journey to bring back the souls of their fellow villagers from the realm of dreams. Much of the story is inspired by Finnish mythology, and it is quite child friendly and lighthearted (apart from a couple of mythological monsters here and there).


I asked once what kind of book my dear readers would like the hypothetical aRTD book to be if there was one, and the overwhelming majority wished to see the whole story in one big tome rather than splitting it into two or more separate books. So that's the way it'll be, and here's my little mock-up of the planned book:

The specs of the book: 608 pages - Full color - Hardcover - Sewn binding - Rounded spine - Matt coated interior pages - about 40 pages of bonus content in the back of the book - the book will be the English version of the comic. *Update* Because of reaching stretch goals the book will now also have printed endpapers and silver-colored foiling and embossing on the cover, and a red chapter band!

Reaching the goal will cover the cost of a 500 book print run (the common minimum order for traditional, high quality offset printed books), freight costs to get the books to me, shipping the books and other goodies to you guys, and Indiegogo's cut of the raised funds. If we raise more than the goal I can make the print run bigger and the book even fancier. In a best case scenario I might even start making a profit and will be able to dedicate my time to making more comics for all of you.

This will be the only print run I'm planning on of making of this comic, so the book will be pretty much a limited edition. I'll get enough books printed so that those of you who can't grab a copy during this campaign can snap one up later on, but they won't stay in abundance.    

 

 

Since the initial goal has been met let's see if we can make this book even fancier by knocking down some stretch goals! *Update* Weeeeelll, all stretch goals are met! So much extra stuff, ahh!


 

It's of course possible to just donate funds to the print drive, but I'm sure most of you are interested in the goodies that come with the different reward levels, and especially the book itself.  Here's a little visual chart of what each level will get you:

So what's up with that 75$ Northern Star level? How does it work? Well, it's basically the same as the 90$ level, except it has the lower shipping cost for people within the Nordic coutries. So if you're going to have your book shipped to Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark or Iceland and want to save on shipping, pick this one. But wait, it's also the tier international folks can pick if they already have chosen a level with the book + international shipping and want to add a book to the same package. You can add as many as you want to!

To upgrade the Northern Star Level to include things from levels above it, simply change the amount to the amount of the level you want minus 15$. So for example: if you're living in Finland and want the lower shipping option for the 150$ Bumbling Bear Level, pick the Northern Star Level but change the amount to 135$. Simple! But you can only do this up to the 170$ level, the ones above that contain original artwork that'll need extra protection during shipping, so if you'd like one of those please pick the "real" level for that.  

I've got quite a few questions about upgrading a level after picking one, so I made this little guide on how to both upgrade to a higher level and to add items to your package. If you're not using an Indiegogo account, make sure you enter the same name and email in your info, that way I'll be able to keep track on all the extra stuff for each individual package. After the campaign is over I'll check with everyone what upgrades and/or extra items the additional contributions re for. So writed down what you're adding if you're going for a lot of extra stuff and have a horrible memory!

Upgrade to a higher level:  Click on "contribute now" to make a second contribution, choose "no perk, I just want to contribute" and enter the difference between your current level and the level you want in the dollar amount field. For example: you already have the 90$ Scornful Squirrel Level but would want the 125$ Mighty Moose Level instead. 125-90=35 so you simply make a second contribution of 35$.

 

Adding postcard print packs: some of you wanted to have extra postcard packs so that you could actually send some to people and keep a pack for yourselves, and here's how you do it. Click on "contribute now", choose "no perk, I just want to contribute" and enter 20$ x (the number of packs you want) in the dollar amount field. So if you just want one more pack it's 20$, if you want three extra packs make it 60$. (It's the same for both Nordic and international folks.) 

 

Adding more books: Once you already have a level that includes the full shipping cost for your area (either Nordic or international) you can add more books with reduced shipping to your package. Pick the Northern Star Level (that I brilliantly misspelled as Northern "Start") and change the dollar amount to correspond to the book you want as shown in the image above. You can add as many books you want! (Note: If you're a Nordic person and want to add a 65$ book use the same contribution method as for the postcard pack instead as Indiegogo naturally won't let you change the Northern Star level amount to below the default 75$)

In-book drawing upgrades: I've had some requests for a smaller drawing option for those who can't quite get reach the Bear Level and an option for a two-character drawing, and now that is possible. If you have a book that has the signed bookplate you can include the simpler mini-drawing with an extra 15$. If you have a book that includes the normal, default drawing you can upgrade that to a two-character picture with an extra 20$.

~

If you want to add several things to your package you can also add them all in one big contribution rather than with separates ones for each item. For example: if you live outside the Nordic countries and want to add 2 postcard packs and 1 signed book to your package, you can simply make a new contribution of 130$ (20+20+90). And it won't really matter if you do it via a "no perk" contribution or the Northern Star Level, using the NS level just helps me keep some kind of track on the amount of books involved before the campaign ends.

 

Since the campaign has been so successful the postcard pack will contain 9 different postcard prints sized 148 x 105 mm (A6, or about 6 x 4 inches for you silly yankees) instead of the initially announced 5. One card for each of Ville's forms in the comic! Here's the first four designs:


 

For those of you who would like something really special alongside your book there's the option of getting a piece of original "A Redtail's Dream" themed artwork by me. These original artwork levels also include all the goodies up to the Hostile Hare Level, and the book that comes with them will be signed, numbered and have a small ink drawing in it. Here's samples of what what the different  art pieces are like:  

 

The Supreme Swan Level: the piece of original art included in this level is a black and white mini-painting featuring Ville in any form you wish.  It can even be something outside the forms he takes in the comic! As shown in the sample the background will have a light brown watercolor wash, white highlight areas will be painted in with acrylics and the piece will be autographed by yours truly. The size is 14,5 x 11 cm (approx. 6 x 4 inches)

 

The Kokko Level:  with the Kokko level you get a black and white ink painting of approximately 25cm x 17cm (or about 10 x 7 inches). It will feature Hannu and Ville in whatever form+getup you wish, even something that wasn't in the comic.In case you'd like the painting to instead be of some other two characters from the comic (or maybe just a single character) that can be arranged too.

 

The Bird's Path Level: The size and other specs of this painting are the same as for the artwork in the Kokko Level, except it's in full color. The painting will be in ink, watercolors and acrylics. 

 

All the Levels from the Hopeless Human Level and up will include the e-book version of the full book in PDF format, and all 10-page side story minicomics, also in PDF format. The minicomics will be the two that I've already made and one brand new one! 

 

I can't contibute until a couple of weeks from now! Is there a risk that some of the levels might sell out? Nope, no risk, I haven't limited any of the levels so you can jump in at any time and get exactly the one you want. And the campaign will be running all the way until the end of the month, even after the goal is passed.

Can I change my address after making my contribution? I entered it wrong/might be moving soon.Yes you can, but don't worry about that yet. Once the books are printed and ready to be shipped you'll all receive a survey where you get to
submit your addresses. That's still a while from now, so move in peace.

I want to upgrade my level. Can I do that?
Yes you can. Check the upgrading and add-ons guide in the middle of this page. 

When will the book be ready? I'm aiming to have the whole thing cleaned up, proof-read and prepped for print by the end of the year, so it should be printed and ready to be shipped during springtime in 2014. I'll keep you guys updated on the progress along the road.

How can a poor person with no money help out? By spreading the word! It doesn't even have to be about this campaign, just letting people know about the webcomic itself is greatly appreciated and any new readers will equal pure happiness! 

Who were you again? Oh, right: hi, I'm Minna Sundberg, a Finnish-Swedish lady currently living in Sweden. I'm 23 years old and I just got my bachelor's degree in graphic design from Aalto University in Finland. I wanted to make A Redtail's Dream as a practice in drawing and writing comics, and it grew way out of its planned proportions during these two years, both in regards to size and readership. I wasn't even planning on ever publishing it as a book, but my wonderful readers slowly coaxed me into it. Right now I'm working on my next comic titled "Stand Still. Stay Silent" which you will all get to start reading online for free right after the last pages of A Redtail's Dream are published. I think that would be...November? This year anyway. I'm hoping to one day be able to support myself with my comic work and therefore dedicate all my time to it, and perhaps this book will help me along that path.

 

 ~

 

That's it! And do leave a comment if you have any questions or anything, I'll try to answer as best I can. Thanks everyone, and let's enjoy the last chapter of A Redtail's Dream while this campaign runs its course! Oh, and spread the word if you can, I will appreciate it greatly.

Upgrade to a higher level:  Click on "contribute now" to make a second contribution, choose "no perk, I just want to contribute" and enter the difference between your current level and the level you want in the dollar amount field. For example: you already have the 90$ Scornful Squirrel Level but would want the 125$ Mighty Moose Level instead. 125-90=35 so you simply make a second contribution of 35$. 
 

Adding postcard print packs: some of you wanted to have extra postcard packs so that you could actually send some to people and keep a pack for yourselves, and here's how you do it. Click on "contribute now", choose "no perk, I just want to contribute" and enter 20$ x (the number of packs you want) in the dollar amount field. So if you just want one more pack it's 20$, if you want three extra packs make it 60$. (It's the same for both Nordic and international folks.) 
 

Adding more books: Once you already have a level that includes the full shipping cost for your area (either Nordic or international) you can add more books with reduced shipping to your package. Pick the Northern Star Level (that I brilliantly misspelled as Northern "Start") and change the dollar amount to correspond to the book you want as shown in the image above. You can add as many books you want! (Note: If you're a Nordic person and want to add a 65$ book use the same contribution method as for the postcard pack instead as Indiegogo naturally won't let you change the Northern Star level amount to below the default 75$) 

In-book drawing upgrades: I've had some requests for a smaller drawing option for those who can't quite get reach the Bear Level and an option for a two-character drawing, and now that is possible. If you have a book that has the signed bookplate you can include the simpler mini-drawing with an extra 15$. If you have a book that includes the normal, default drawing you can upgrade that to a two-character picture with an extra 20$. 
~
If you want to add several things to your package you can also add them all in one big contribution rather than with separates ones for each item. For example: if you live outside the Nordic countries and want to add 2 postcard packs and 1 signed book to your package, you can simply make a new contribution of 130$ (20+20+90). And it won't really matter if you do it via a "no perk" contribution or the Northern Star Level, using the NS level just helps me keep some kind of track on the amount of books involved before the campaign ends.
 
Since the campaign has been so successful the postcard pack will contain 9 different postcard prints sized 148 x 105 mm (A6, or about 6 x 4 inches for you silly yankees) instead of the initially announced 5. One card for each of Ville's forms in the comic! Here's the first four designs:


 

For those of you who would like something really special alongside your book there's the option of getting a piece of original "A Redtail's Dream" themed artwork by me. These original artwork levels also include all the goodies up to the Hostile Hare Level, and the book that comes with them will be signed, numbered and have a small ink drawing in it. Here's samples of what what the different  art pieces are like:  
 

The Supreme Swan Level: the piece of original art included in this level is a black and white mini-painting featuring Ville in any form you wish.  It can even be something outside the forms he takes in the comic! As shown in the sample the background will have a light brown watercolor wash, white highlight areas will be painted in with acrylics and the piece will be autographed by yours truly. The size is 14,5 x 11 cm (approx. 6 x 4 inches)
 

The Kokko Level:  with the Kokko level you get a black and white ink painting of approximately 25cm x 17cm (or about 10 x 7 inches). It will feature Hannu and Ville in whatever form+getup you wish, even something that wasn't in the comic.In case you'd like the painting to instead be of some other two characters from the comic (or maybe just a single character) that can be arranged too.
 

The Bird's Path Level: The size and other specs of this painting are the same as for the artwork in the Kokko Level, except it's in full color. The painting will be in ink, watercolors and acrylics. 
 

All the Levels from the Hopeless Human Level and up will include the e-book version of the full book in PDF format, and all 10-page side story minicomics, also in PDF format. The minicomics will be the two that I've already made and one brand new one! 
 

I can't contibute until a couple of weeks from now! Is there a risk that some of the levels might sell out? Nope, no risk, I haven't limited any of the levels so you can jump in at any time and get exactly the one you want. And the campaign will be running all the way until the end of the month, even after the goal is passed.
Can I change my address after making my contribution? I entered it wrong/might be moving soon.Yes you can, but don't worry about that yet. Once the books are printed and ready to be shipped you'll all receive a survey where you get to submit your addresses. That's still a while from now, so move in peace.
I want to upgrade my level. Can I do that? Yes you can. Check the upgrading and add-ons guide in the middle of this page. 
When will the book be ready? I'm aiming to have the whole thing cleaned up, proof-read and prepped for print by the end of the year, so it should be printed and ready to be shipped during springtime in 2014. I'll keep you guys updated on the progress along the road.
How can a poor person with no money help out? By spreading the word! It doesn't even have to be about this campaign, just letting people know about the webcomic itself is greatly appreciated and any new readers will equal pure happiness! 
Who were you again? Oh, right: hi, I'm Minna Sundberg, a Finnish-Swedish lady currently living in Sweden. I'm 23 years old and I just got my bachelor's degree in graphic design from Aalto University in Finland. I wanted to make A Redtail's Dream as a practice in drawing and writing comics, and it grew way out of its planned proportions during these two years, both in regards to size and readership. I wasn't even planning on ever publishing it as a book, but my wonderful readers slowly coaxed me into it. Right now I'm working on my next comic titled "Stand Still. Stay Silent" which you will all get to start reading online for free right after the last pages of A Redtail's Dream are published. I think that would be...November? This year anyway. I'm hoping to one day be able to support myself with my comic work and therefore dedicate all my time to it, and perhaps this book will help me along that path.
 
 ~
 
That's it! And do leave a comment if you have any questions or anything, I'll try to answer as best I can. Thanks everyone, and let's enjoy the last chapter of A Redtail's Dream while this campaign runs its course! Oh, and spread the word if you can, I will appreciate it greatly.

story:
Stories can inspire you to do any number of wonderful things. Stories have the power to make the weak strong, to help the disenfranchised find their voice, to turn ordinary people into extraordinary beings. With that a super hero needs to be heroic, that is why Graphation makes “Comics That Care.” For every dollar you spend on our comics, half goes to an associated charity. Getting funds to organizations and causes that dearly need it. Each comic book is carefully paired with a specific charity because there is nothing quite like a super hero team-up. Two exceptional entities coming together to tell great stories and do good. Comics That Care. Great Stories. Doing Good. I Comic. I Care. Do you?


Our “Pillars Of Power” represent our stretch goals, starting at a basic launch of the bare minimum line of comics. However the more money we raise the more spectacular stories we can tell and the more wonderful organizations we can help! So please help us not only reach our first Pillar of Power, but exceed that Pillar and help us become a fully funded force of philanthropy and reach the moon!


We here at Graphation have devoted our lives to creating a business that tells great stories while helping the world. Now we're ready to share what we've achieved and with the help of the Graphation community do more AMAZING things, but doing so can be expensive! Our artists are extremely talented and deserve to be paid fairly, not to mention the costs of design and web and tech costs. Please join us on this FANTASTIC voyage!



Outsider Andrew McGregor is chosen to become Captain Africa, the long forgotten champion of the continent. Granted the powers of flight, strength, and invulnerability to battle, an ancient lurking evil, ready to devour Africa, and Earth! Written by Josiah Golojuh & Andrew McGregor - Art by Mike D. Kim (No. 1) & Sean Joyce (ongoing)


The ongoing story of Pittsburgh, the super hero capital of the world! Ravaged by terminal cancer an experimental treatment turns Patrick into the Illuminator, but what do all the other super powered beings in the city want with this insignificant person? - Written by Josiah Golojuh - Art by Wolfie Stickel (Issue 1) & Howard Simpson (ongoing)


When Frank wakes up with a bandaged head and no memory of the night before, he is scared nearly to death to find his best friend Gary as a rotting-stinking-walking-corpse in his kitchen. The story of Gary and his dog, it just so happens that Gary is a ZOMBIE! Written by Josiah Golojuh - Art by Caitlin Elise Willis


Because of her affinity for robots, A.N.I. believes she must be a robot herself, but she is in fact a real girl. She and her robotic friends go on amazing adventures literally making new robot friends and discovering new technology along the way! - Written by Josiah Golojuh with Annika O’Brien - Art by James Scotty Shoemaker


Andrew McGregor (AKA Captain Africa) Co-Founder / CEO
Josiah Golojuh (AKA The Rustbelt Ragamuffin) Co-Founder / Creative Director
Judy Golojuh (AKA Wonder Judy) Administrative Coordinator
Thien-Phuong Le (AKA The MighTHY) In House Designer / Illustrator



Provides community members in conflict, post-conflict, and underreported regions with the equipment, training, and affiliations necessary to report their stories and improve their lives. http://tizianoproject.org/


Dedicated to raising funds for cancer research and patient care, as well as Austin’s Playroom Project, an initiative that creates playrooms for children and families in medical facilities. http://www.mariolemieux.org/


The LA Robotics Club is a free open membership group for anyone interested in robotics and electronics. They provide work space, computers, tools, supplies, and experienced people to help with projects. http://www.laroboticsclub.org/


There is enough food in the world for everyone and yet tonight one in eight people will go to bed hungry. Together we can change this.


Thank you so much for helping us! We’re trying to make the rewards as awesome as possible. Meaning that the stuff you get here you can ONLY get here!


Once we are funded the first digital content will be instantly available, this includes the completed Captain Africa No. 1 and Super City No. 1, with A.N.I. The Robot Girl and I Was A Teenage Zombie to follow soon after. For physical items we’ll obviously need more time, but it’ll be well worth the wait!


Once we are funded and our comics are on the market we’ll take 50% of the profit from the sale of each comic and place the money into individual accounts. Then during the holidays, Captain Africa will deliver a check for the total sum of the money placed in that account to each charity! Graphation will remain transparent with its sales numbers, to assure the charities and our readers that the charities are receiving their fair share.



Our first Pillar will get us into the world with the four comics mentioned in the video, as well as our own online platform for reading the comics, it’ll also send Captain Africa and our team to a few conventions, and of course cover your rewards!

The more money we raise the more content we can create! So the more you give us now the more our production costs are taken care of. Therefore we can tell more stories and give away more money!



The second pillar does pretty much everything we do on the first one, but allows for three additional comics in our line, meaning more stories told and more good done!

Here is where things start get really good! At Pillar 3 we can have a full line of comics, plus fund the second issues for some of those books.

Once again, more comics, our entire line is covered! Plus additional books and more second issues for some of those books and a significant presence at comic cons!

This is our dream goal, this is the moon we’re shooting for! With it we will be funded for an entire year! That means multiple issues of all our comics as well as more conventions to send Captain Africa and our team to! And maybe just maybe at this level Andrew & Josiah can actually get paid, up to this level all money goes to artists and other contributors.

A download of the comic of your choice!



Your name written on the “Graphation Guild of Givers” website & actual wall at The Graphation Shop inside The Hive Gallery in LA, and in the first issue of each comic.



A hand written Thank You note from co-founding creators Josiah or Andrew!



An “Indiegogo Only” Print Comic, these won’t be available anywhere else! Your choice of comic. 



Astounding Tales of Adventure no. 1 & 2! Signed copies of both of our rare original print comics!



A digital copy of The Illuminator, the short film that spawned the Super City comic!



2 All Action Passes to our exclusive launch celebration in Los Angeles where you can hobnob with our team and our famous friends and get VIP treatment! Travel and lodging not provided.



A classic comic book from Josiah’s collection, with a handwritten letter explaining why that particular issue is special to him!



A Graphation Universe Exclusive Print featuring all of our awesome characters in one place printed on archival paper!



Hand Crafted Comicollage, made from Josiah’s comic collection! Each comic is carefully cut apart, and lovingly reassembled, collaged on wood, metal, or canvas. (Your choice of comic book character, assuming he has it)



An original sketch of your favorite Graphation character from one of our talented artists! You can also choose a popular non-Graphation character or a zombie or something cool.



A Visual and Written Early History of Graphation: Legacy Edition Art Book. This tome will tell epic tale of Graphation’s early glory, and include all our work to date! With variations, previously unpublished comics, art and other stories. It also includes a special bonus DVD.



Become a character in a comic! Have your likeness become a character in one of our comic books. This includes a signed canvas print of your first appearance, and 10 exclusive print copies.



Have a special single issue 20 page comic book created just for you! Written and drawn with your input by the team at Graphation. Includes a digital download, 25 print comics (more available at additional cost of $5 per copy), and a signed canvas print of the cover.




- Single Issue Download, but really, why bother? The good stuff starts at $25!


- 2 Single Issue Downloads
- Name on the “Graphation Guild of Givers” Website & Wall
- Hand written Thank You Note
- Single “Indiegogo Only” Print Comic


- All of the above, plus...
- 4 Single Issue Downloads
- All 4 “Indiegogo Only” Print Comics
- Classic comic book from Josiah’s collection, with a handwritten letter
- Digital copy of The Illuminator cartoon

- All of the above, plus...
- Astounding Tales of Adventure no. 1 & 2
- 2 All Action Passes to our Launch Reception
- Graphation Universe Exclusive Print

- All of the above, plus...
- Hand Crafted Comicollage


- All of the above, plus...
- A Visual and Written Early History of Graphation: Legacy Edition Art Book with DVD
- Original sketch


- All of the above, plus...
- Become a character in a comic  


- Special comic book created for you


The more noise we make, the more money we’ll raise, and the more likely this campaign will keep Graphation and our community growing. The more stories we tell, the more good we can do.

To incentivize you to get all of your friends and neighbors to join in on the fun, we’re putting up a one-of-a-kind reward up for grabs, San Diego Comic Con with Captain Africa! We will fly you from anywhere in the US and bring you to Comic Con (in 2014) with Captain Africa himself! But we have to make our first stretch goal for this one!

We’ll be awarding Comic Con with Captain Africa to whoever brings the most contributions in using IndieGoGo’s sharing tools. So even if you can’t afford to contribute yourself, you can still earn this reward if you manage to shepherd in the most money through your own connections and campaigning.

If you can’t contribute and want a visit from Captain Africa be sure to create an IndieGoGo account and use their sharing tools!


As we said earlier, there’s nothing quite like a super hero team-up, and we hope you’ve decided to partner with us, regardless we thank you for your time, and we hope you’ll consider investing in the future of not just Graphation, but our partner charitable organizations. With your help, we can continue to tell stories and do good. I Comic. I Care.

Excelsior,
Andrew, Josiah & Team Graphation

story:
Short Summary

Phantom Zone Comics is a locally owned comic book store that has been open for last 2 years in the town of Lynnwood, WA. Within the area we are known as one of the most customer service oriented comic stores there is but we are also known for the size of our store. 

Phantom Zone Comics is one of the smallest comic book stores on the west coast weighing in at 145 square feet. We have been told that we are like the TARDIS, we look small on the outside but open the door and there is a ton of awesomeness on the inside. 

When we first opened the size of our store was right for us but as we have become more established we have started to outgrow our space and are not able to do cool things for our customers like have artist and writers signings, game nights, or even Friday Night Magic. 

This is where you come in. We are looking to expand into a new and bigger store where we can carry more items that won't fit in our current location, bring in local artists and let them show off their work, Host game nights and events and just be a great place where people can hang out and get their geek on. 

We need your help to get this done!

What We Need & What You Get

  • All funds raised will go to our expansion. We are asking for $12,500 which is about half of what we need to move into a new location. These funds will help with the build out of the new location as well as inventory.
  • Even if we don't reach our goal every dollar collected will go to our expansion. And we will pay out on all donations whether we reach our goal or not.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us reach our goal in other ways!

Just share this page with anyone you know who loves comics and wants to support a great local comic book shop!

Thank you and EXCELSIOR!

story:
Please head over to City of Venus: Dead City campaign for your last chance at getting  The Art of Vinnie Tartamella Vol.1 & Vol.2      https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/city-of-venus-dead-city/x/20449593#/

I am excited to put together this 52 page art book, in a comic book format (So you can keep it with your comic collection) Thick cover, amazing quality, This book will feature a collection of fan favorite pieces, heroes, villains, monsters, hot pinup art, portraits, original pieces,  & more!!    
 

 

  • Bellow is the cover from Vol.2, Yes it is Another full color 52 page art book!!



 




 

I value you the fans and supporters!  

        Over the years, I've traveled to many shows, and have met some many amazing people.      Many of you guys encouraged me to take this step, so I thank you in advance!    

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can donate, please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends, share/link on facebook, instagram, twitter, and anywhere else you can think of!

Use the Indiegogo share tools/links/etc!

        Over the years, I've traveled to many shows, and have met some many amazing people.      Many of you guys encouraged me to take this step, so I thank you in advance!    
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can donate, please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends, share/link on facebook, instagram, twitter, and anywhere else you can think of!
Use the Indiegogo share tools/links/etc!

story:
The Story

Pavel has just arrived in London and tries to make a living as a rikshaw driver, earning the rent for his rather modest room in the suburbs.
But soon he is being pulled into a series of unsettling events, when he notices some strange behaviour among the local pigeons.

At a tower block in his neighbourhood two colonies of street pigeons are engaged in a violent conflict.  Pavel starts out to investigate the affair. But it soon becomes evident that pigeon society is far beyond his understanding and all his efforts for brokering peace are seemingly doomed to fail.

Watching an unstoppable spiral of violence go down towards a looming catastrophy, he begins to ponder about the fabric of urban society and what is necessary to make peaceful coexistence possible in a global metropolis...

 

About The Project

  • My name is maleek and I am a comic book artist and illustrator from Berlin. I regurlarly contribute to a variety of publications and sell my zines and prints at comic festivals. Shoot-Up-Hill is my first Graphic Novel.
  • I started writing Shoot-Up-Hill  about three years ago, while working on other projects. Finally, in late 2017, I had the script ready and started production. By summer 2018 I had finished the artwork on the first volume ("Nesting"). My goal is to get it into print by November 2018 and you can help me with the production cost by pre-ordering the book through this crowdfunding campaign.

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • As the artwork is already finished, this campaign is simply to help me with printing costs. I have set the goal at 1500 Euro (you may see the amount in your local currency). This would cover for 300 copies. If the goal is not fully reached, the amount of copies produced will be reduced accordingly. Similarly, more money will mean more copies ( and a happier artist).
  • I work with a local printer in Berlin to assure the best  quality in both paper and printing.
  • Once the campaign expires in November, production and shipping will start. So, depending on your location, you should be able to get your book somewhere in November or December.
  • I will make sure that all  books are shipped in time for christmas , in case you are considering it as a gift.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out  and share this campaign on social media. If you're a fan of comic books, I'm sure you know one or two people who would just love to read Shoot-Up-Hill.
  • Stay in touch with maleek illustration. Once volume one is in distribution, work on volume two will begin. Follow me on facebook or instagram to see the progress.
  • https://www.maleek-illustration.com/
  • https://www.facebook.com/HandsomeMonkeeKing
  • instagram: maleekillustration or #Shootuphillcomic #maleekillustration

Thak you for your support! 

maleek

story:
STRETCH GOALS!!!!!!


**UNLOCKED!!** $1,500 Stretch Goal: "The Harlem Hellfighter" Bonus Story. This additional story brings the page count to 40.

$3,000 Stretch Goal: All copies signed (Gold signatures for 'Signed Copy' buyers, Silver Signatures for regular ones).

$5,000 Stretch Goal: Upgrade of paper stock, gold foil for the 1st Edition stamp, additional 10 pages of sketches and previous drafts, bringing the page total to 50.

 

 

J.P. PLACK & EMI UTRERA PRESENT: "EUDAIMONIA"

EUDAIMONIA is a word from ancient Greek philosophy that means, "the good life," the life that is worth living despite the inevitable pain and hardship of the human condition. It is something which all seek yet many are unable to find.

EUDAIMONIA is a multi-genre story that takes place between 1909-1959, featuring interwoven stories about a small town with a secret, a traumatized soldier in the trenches, a runaway girl with remarkable gifts, and a son not so prodigal. These seemingly disparate tales come to form the circular narrative, as characters claw their way towards their Eudaimonia.

EUDAIMONIA #1: THE SECRETS WE KEEP, THE SONG IN OUR HEARTS

'Eudaimonia: The Secrets We Keep, The Song in Our Hearts' is the first of three issues in the series. It consists of 30 full-color pages written and designed by me and drawn, colored, and lettered by the amazing Emi Utrera. The story is also told using (almost exclusively) third-person narrative verse. This unorthodox style is a deliberate homage to the many actual soldiers who fought in the war and composed poetry using this style.

 

 

What Your Support Will Get

We are working closely with a trusted printer to put the highest quality book into your hands, which will include:

  • 30 pages in glorious full color to let Emi's amazing art shine thru.
  • High quality gloss finishing to make sure his masterful use of color pops off the page
  • Aaaaaaaand.

The First Edition Promise

Backers of this first Indiegogo run will get the 1st Edition featuring this gold stamp (gold foil if stretch goals are met). This will not be printed on future runs. The 1st Editions will also be sequentially serial-numbered, meaning that however many people get in on this will be how many of these unique prints exist. Those backers who purchase the 'Signed Copy' will be given the lowest numbers, signed and numbered in gold paint, all others will be silver.

As of right now the first book has been written and we have 20 pages finished. We are putting a lot of care into each page so, realistically, we hope to have the book ready to send out digital copies in December, and the print sent to the printer by January 2020.

 

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to my on Twitter @EudaimoniaBook or by email joshuaplack80@gmail.com

story:
About this project.

Hello. My name is Jon Sommariva. I would like to make a really nice, high quality art book that collects my work from the past few years. I need $3500 to make a small print run of this book. I will be offering some great perks for anyone who wants to contribute. I'm excited about keeping my contributors updated with photos of the perks as I get them done and progress reports on the design of the book itself. I also plan to show you some of the work that didn't make the cut for the book. Don't forget to click that Facebook "like" button above and help me spread the word about my book. Thank you!

You can see more examples of my art and keep up to date with me via:

  • Twitter
  • Deviant Art
  • and my Blog

Who is Jon Sommariva and what are Ozmosis Chills?

Ozmosis Chills - noun

  1. The emotion and tingle you get up your spine when you see a work of art that fills you with inspiration. "I watched the Lion King and it gave me Ozmosis Chills. The Avengers also gave me Ozmosis Chills which I hadn't felt in a long time."
  2. The title given to a series of art books featuring the work of Jon Sommariva.

Origin: early 1990's - term coined by Jon and his friend, Mark.

  • Ozmosis comes from the sound you can hear a crowd make when they see something awe-inspring or impressive. "Whoa, ozmosisozmosisozmosis"
  • Chills describes the tingle you get up your spine when you see something so cool it fills your inspiration meter to full capacity. 

I am Jon Sommariva. I'm a comic book artist and illustrator from Sydney, Australia. I have been working as a professional artist for the past 13 years or so. I have been published by Image Comics, DC Comics and Dakhorse Comics and I have also done design work for Disney. I love to draw, and I draw A LOT! Some of the things I draw are published and released into the world, while the majority is not. That is why I would like to create this book compiling my recent work which will allow me to share my art with you.

Double the size, Double the fun. Tell me about the book!

The goal of this campaign is to create the best version of Ozmosis Chills III for people across the world who want to own a copy of a book that collects my art. 

It will include:

  • new art previously unseen anywhere
  • commissions
  • con sketches
  • unpublished work
  • experiments

All in various forms from thumbnails and sketches to inked and coloured works. 

I want the book to have a real polished finish to it with high production values. My goal is for Ozmosis Chills III to be a much bigger and even better looking book than the first 2 volumes. The original books were A5 in size (that's roughy 5x8 inches for my friends in the U.S) and Ozmosis Chills III will be more than double the size of the last book in every way.

Ozmosis Chills III Stats:

  • Full Colour 
  • 8 x 10.5 inches (20.3cm x 26.6cm).
  • 84 pages
  • More than 50% of the art is new and unseen.

History:

You may have noticed that this is the 3rd Ozmosis Chills art book. I self published Ozmosis Chills and Ozmosis Chills II in 2008 and 2009, respectively. Both of these books have sold out. I published a small run of a preview edition of Ozmosis Chills III in 2011. This also sold out at New York Comic Con the same year. The version you are contributing to here will be a beefed up, slicker version of that book. As such, the cover artwork you see here will also be touched up slightly to help set this new version apart from the preview edition. As a contributor you will receive updates on the progress of the cover work.

Talk is cheap! Let's see some of your art...

For those unfamiliar, here are some examples of my art as well as a preview of the book layout. If you like this art, then you can expect much more of this on the pages of Ozmosis Chills III.

Below: A preview of the layout for Ozmosis Chills III. This is an example of what you can expect to find in this book. From sketch idea to pencils to finished piece.

Perks, Rewards and your Contributons.

To make this book a reality, I need at least $3500 to cover the initial design work and printing costs. This will also cover Indiegogo fees, as well as currency conversion. I am also absorbing some of the shipping cost here. The downside to living in beautiful Australia is that shipping gets very expensive to the rest of the world, so part of my goal is to keep the shipping reasonable for anyone outside Australia.

It's time for the Perk-ulator! It's time for the Perk-ulator!

Please help me get the word out there to anyone who YOU think might enjoy this book. All tweets, facebook posts and bloggings will make me eternally gratefull. A big THANKS to everyone who contributes to this campaign. I will be designing a special thankyou page in the book to acknowledge you guys. Now please enjoy your perks in visual form below... I mean really... why use words when you can use pictures!

For those unfamiliar, here are some examples of my art as well as a preview of the book layout. If you like this art, then you can expect much more of this on the pages of Ozmosis Chills III.
Below: A preview of the layout for Ozmosis Chills III. This is an example of what you can expect to find in this book. From sketch idea to pencils to finished piece.

To make this book a reality, I need at least $3500 to cover the initial design work and printing costs. This will also cover Indiegogo fees, as well as currency conversion. The downside to living in beautiful Australia is that shipping gets very expensive to the rest of the world, so part of my goal is to keep the shipping reasonable for anyone outside Australia. 
It's time for the Perk-ulator! It's time for the Perk-ulator!
Please help me get the word out there to anyone who YOU think might enjoy this book. All tweets, facebook posts and bloggings will make me eternally gratefull. I mean really... why use words when you can use pictures!

story:
Short Summary

The Sundays is a serialized graphic novel by Kevin L. Sheath and Scott Ewen. So far we've gotten halfway through issue three but we need funding to finish it! This Indiegogo campaign is going to help us finish the third issue to get it into your hands.

If we don't make funding, this comic might never get completed! It's only if you help us out and throw a few bucks our way that we have a chance of finishing the third issue.

What We Need & What You Get

The script's already been written. The first thirteen pages have already been drawn. There are 11 pages left to go and all I'm asking for is $100 per page to pencil, ink, and letter it. That money allows me to make The Sundays my #1 priority for the time it will take me to finish it.

Everything helps, even just a dollar! If you absolutely can't spare a dollar, please consider helping by sharing a link on Facebook or Twitter. 

Donate at the $30 level to snag this Indiegogo exclusive edition with a drawing by me on the cover:


The latest page I've finished (hasn't gone up on the website yet because I haven't had time to color it): 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Post a link on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, etc. Help people find out about the comic and hopefully we'll meet our funding by Oct. 12!

story:
Short Summary

Hey! My name is Omri Pitaru and I'm an aspiring writer. I've been writing some short stories and comic strips in the last few years but this is the first long term project that I'm committing myself into.

I've been working on a web comic called 'Old Future', which is basically an old mage living in the future in a world ruled by corporates. The comic is going to involve magic, guns, corruption, chaos and monsters. The best way to describe it would be Doctor Strange living in a Cyberpunk world with Lovecraftian horrors lurking underneath. How awesome is that?

So far the cover is already posted on my site and by the end of this campaign the next 8 strips or so should  be posted as well.

To visit the site go to:www.greatoldone.net

You are also welcome to visit my new Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/GreatOldOneSite


What I Need & What You Get

So this is a free Web Comic posted on a free website, why do I need money? The reason is simple, currently I do not have enough money to be both paying my bills and paying Oliver (the artist). Oliver is a great guy and an excellent artist, but he doesn't work for free.

Right now I have enough money saved to maybe keep going for another month or two, but after that I'll have to stop. Every month Old Future is running is costing me a few hundred dollars. With this campaign I hope to get enough money to keep this going for at least a few more months. Obviously, the more I get the longer it will last.

If the campaign is successful and it raises more money than I asked for, I will also hire someone to make the site look more professional and easier to navigate. Right now there are ads on the site since I didn't have money to upgrade it (just to be clear, these are not ads I'm making any money of, they belong to the hosting site). The ads will disappear as well if I get enough money to upgrade the site.

If I do not meet my funding goal, the comic will continue as long as I have money to do so. After I'm out of money, I guess there will be a much longer break between each strip. This is my dream and I'm not going to abandon it unless I have to.

***NOTE: I will never take money for the site. It is free now and it will always stay that way.



More About the Story

I've been pretty vague so far about what exactly the story is about since I do not want to ruin the surprise. However, I understand that some people would like to know more before deciding if they want to invest their money. So just a fair warning, this section will contain spoilers about the story. If you do not want to know anything, please move on to the next section.

***SPOILERS***

The story begins in the near future, about 150 years from now. The main character, Vincent Maddox, lives in 'Corp City'. The city is divided to a few districts, with the main one being Central District (or 'The Hub' like the citizens call it). 

Located inside The Hub are most of the headquarters belonging to the strongest corporations in the world. How strong are corporations in Old Future? They pretty much control governments and the big ones also have their own police force, army and hospitals.

Vincent lives in the not-so-friendly part of the city - the River District (or Humble Town/The Graveyard/Box Town). This district is mostly inhabited by poor people, gangs and junkies. Vincent is so old (his magic kept him alive far longer than he should) that he still remembers the great war with the demons, before the corporations took over the world. These days, demons are all but forgotten and Vincent isn't very interested in the rest of humanity.

The story starts when Vincent meets Kasumi, a young Netrunner working in a big corporation, who's being threatened and abused outside his house. Vincent saves her, and through her he starts to learn about what's really happening around him.

Later on in the story Vincent and Kasumi are getting in trouble with a gang and a corporation, while investigating weird unnatural murders that's been occurring around the city.

The story is planned out a lot more than that but I think I'll stop here to not ruin everything :)




    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Letting other people know about this campaign or sharing the website would be awesome. I very much appreciate any help I can get.

Vincent is so old (his magic kept him alive far longer than he should) that he still remembers the great war with the demons, before the corporations took over the world. These days, demons are all but forgotten and Vincent isn't very interested in the rest of humanity.The story starts when Vincent meets Kasumi, a young Netrunner working in a big corporation, who's being threatened and abused outside his house. Vincent saves her, and through her he starts to learn about what's really happening around him.Later on in the story Vincent and Kasumi are getting in trouble with a gang and a corporation, while investigating weird unnatural murders that's been occurring around the city.The story is planned out a lot more than that but I think I'll stop here to not ruin everything :)     Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Letting other people know about this campaign or sharing the website would be awesome. I very much appreciate any help I can get.

story:
"116 PAGES OF ZOMBIE CARNAGE AND BORDER HORROR!!!"

A ragtag group of teenagers must unite and traverse a zombie plagued post-apocalyptic borderland between the U.S and Mexico while avoiding the remnants of drug cartels, a saw wielding maniac, and of course the undead hungry for their flesh! 

With 90% of the book COMPLETED, UNDEAD BORDER: ESCAPE OR DIE is a black and white, 116 page graphic novel, ready to be in your hands!

VARIANT COVER ADDED! 

What happens when the most dangerous border town is invaded by the undead? Welcome to the UNDEAD BORDER. 75% of the local population succumbed to the zombie threat, 3% managed to escape from the city and the remaining 22% have been locked inside an epidemiological fence implemented by the UN to prevent the outbreak from spreading.  

Lawlessness ensues and gives rise to The Commune, a criminal organization that has taken control of the border and woe to those who cross its path!

Tania, Barañas and Parachute, members of the Rot Riders Skate Crew; Rulo, zombie herder, and the meek Emiliano confront The Ogre, the fearsome and eccentric captain of The Commune, and unleash a series of unfortunate events that will only leave the teens with two options… Escape or Die!

 

OTHER FEATURES!

  • SUPPLEMENTAL BOOK (DEAD NOTES).  A mini 24-page supplemental book featuring; concept art, character designs, thumbnails and lore of UNDEAD BORDER: ESCAPE OR DIE.
     
  • SPANISH EDITION (INFESTACIÓN: ESCAPE OR DIE).  Here's the opportunity to acquire a copy of the spanish edition of UNDEAD BORDER: ESCAPE OR DIE, 6" x 9", 128 pages. 
     
  • SILKSCREEN POSTER. A very limited silkscreen poster (24" x 36"). Only 20 available! All posters will be signed & numbered.
     
  • ZOMBIE CAMEO. Have you ever wanted to become a tick infested, cannibalistic shambling corpse? We will make your nightmares come true when you back the “Zombie Cameo” tier.
     
  • ORIGINAL ART. Here’s your chance to snag an original page from UNDEAD BORDER: ESCAPE OR DIE! You can even purchase the very page where you appear as a ZOMBIE (ADD-ON PERK)! All pages will be signed!
     
  • ​ORIGINAL SKETCH (ADD-ON PERK). If you’re looking for that little extra to add to your order. Then why not pick yourself a 6”x 9” sketch from the man behind the art of UNDEAD BORDER: ESCAPE OR DIE!
     

 

STRETCH GOALS! 

Since we’re funded, it’s time to showcase the stretch goals! All backers will receive the bookmark ($4K), sticker ($5K) and mini prints ($6K) with their order for free! All backers at the $50 level and above will receive “The Rot Riders” one shot ($8K), upgraded “Dead Notes” ($10K) and the "Undead Border Trilogy TPB" ($15K) for free!  


THE TEAM

WRITER: Francisco Arce @farce656
ARTIST: Javier Gutierrez @exeiviermx
LETTERER/DESIGNER: Oliver Lee Arce @oleea656
TRANSLATIONS: Ray Ramos @cryptidnals
LOGO DESIGN & TRAILER: Dominique Arce @domoarce656
 

NEED MORE INFO ON THE CAMPAIGN? CHECK OUT THE FAQ! 

If you have a question, you can hit us up on our social media...

Twitter https://twitter.com/656comics
YouTube https://www.youtube.com/user/656er
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/656comics/

story:
Our Story

Hello folks!  The Gut-Man here with some exciting news!  I've written a 20 page short story entitled "Devious Dead Girl" and I could really use your help!  I'm looking to self publish this little ditty as a fully illustrated book!   It's a story I came up with several years ago but was only recently brought to life by the wonderful drawings of April Burril!  April and I put together a great concept for our little Dead Girl and decided to self publish so we could retain complete creative control!  


The Impact

This is your chance to help a struggling writer to get his story out there.  With your help, we can get a professional printing company who specializes in this sort of thing to print our story and advertise it on their own website.  This would enable people around the globe to have a chance to read "Devious Dead Girl".


What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise $3000.   The money will go to publishing as well as marketing the book at various horror conventions around the country.  Those who donate will get name recognition in the book as well as some awesome perks!  Check 'em out!!


Other Ways You Can Help

This is where you all can really help!  SPREAD THE WORD!  Using email, facebook, twitter, etc.  you can tell your friends and ask them for help, too!   Send them a link so they can check us out!   We're trying to reach as many folks as possible through this and we certainly can not do it alone!   Thanks for coming this far; and, literally, every dollar helps!  :-)

story:
Captain Luv is a space trucker and a former war hero. Accompanied by a rogue artificial intelligence, named SPAID, he reluctantly finds himself on adventures that could affect the course of the solar system.

 

ABOUT THE BOOK

"CAPTAIN LUV: THE HERO OF THE CLEANSING" is 72 beautiful full color pages and the first book in an ongoing series featuring Captain Luv. It is the story of how SPAID and Luv meet. This story also explains the legend surrounding Captain Luv and how he became the hero of the cleansing.  This is the essential book in the Captain Luv series.
   

YOU'LL FALL IN LOVE WITH LUV!

     
THIS BOOK IS RATED 'MATURE'. There is sex, violence, profanity, nudity, and other mature themes. This book is not designed for children.
      

"Captain Luv: The Hero Of The Cleansing" is COMPLETED, PRINTED, & FULFILLING.
Delivery is GUARANTEED and product is shipping WORLDWIDE.

 

COVER ART

 

INTERNAL ART SAMPLE

 

EXCLUSIVE VARIANT COVER

    

NUMBERED LIMITED EDITION EXCLUSIVE

Captain Luv is in its FIRST PRINTING and these are EXCLUSIVE NUMBERED LIMITED EDITION books. Each book is numbered in order and first come first serve. 
There are only 800 of these first run original cover books and only 200 of the exclusive variant.


PHOTO FROM HAPPY BACKER

      
WHAT IS NEXT FOR CAPTAIN LUV?

The next book in the series is "CAPTAIN LUV: RISE OF THE PIRATE KING" which will be released in 6 chapters as collectable comic books and then combined into a graphic novel. Chapter one illustrations, and colors are completed and in the lettering process.

 

ABOUT THE TEAM

AUTHOR & CREATOR

Drew Eash: Writer, Musician, Marketing professional 

ILLUSTRATOR

Andrea Bormida: 30 years experience and recently worked on the successful B&W Italian comic Nathan Never.

COLORIST

Slamet Mujiono: Extremely talented gentleman

 

MESSAGE FROM THE AUTHOR

I would like to start by thanking you for taking the time to visit my campaign page. Captain Luv have been a 5 year process from inception to now and I am excited to share it with you. I want you to know that I believe in this project. So much so, that I have invested my entire savings and some of my personal credit to bring it to you. I have paid for this entire project upfront so it could be delivered to you before Christmas 2019. The campaign might not even make enough to cover my investment, thats okay, as long as there is enough to get the printing done and the books into the hands of the backers and fans. That is why I set the goal as low as I did. 

UPDATE: 
Fulfillment was made in time for Christmas and I really was over joyed to see so many book in happy people's hands and reading the great reviews was the best Christmas present I could get. 
Thank you to everyone who bought a book. 

 

RISK FREE

"Captain Luv: The Hero Of The Cleansing" is finished and printed and already fulfilling so everyone who backs this book is guaranteed to get their own copy in a relatively short time. 

 

T-SHIRT DESIGN

​The color choices are expanded to suit most people and in most colors up to 4X is available for either men or women.    

 

TRADING CARDS

​Trading cards will normally be packaged in randomized counts of 3. ONLY in this campaign will all 9 cards be offered together. This is for the collectors who want a full collection.

story:
Thank you to all our contributors, the pledging period is over.

We raised 16% of our goal, and the money has been disbursed.  Although we didn't make our goal of $10,000, the book is still underway, but of course is going to take a little longer.

You can follow the progress of the book at sunsetlegends.blogspot.com, on twitter, facebook or linked in by clicking the buttons below, or come back here and we'll start making more updates.  And if you want to find out how to get any of those perks offered on this website, email wonderealm@gmail.com, subject:mailing list.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

There was a time in this fair land, when the railroad did not run,

When the bold majestic mountains stood alone against the sun.

Long before the white man and long before the wheel,

When the deep, dark forest was too silent to be real.

            - Gordon Lightfoot
                            Canadian Railroad Trilogy


          In the early part of the last century, when the Canadian National Railroad was building a bridge over Pelican Narrows just downstream of the town of Sioux Lookout, there was evidence found that a historical battle between the local Ojibway tribes and another tribe of first nations people had occurred. According to local oral history, the Ojibway and Sioux tribes, longstanding trading partners and rivals in times of war, had played a game of cat and mouse on a trek through the boreal forest, until the Ojibway had finally taken a stand at a small bluff that later became known as Sioux Mountain. Using that historical fact as a springboard, THE LEGEND OF THE SUNSET PEOPLE takes the idea a step further: as they travelled toward their final destination, this tribe of Ojibway encountered powers and beings unfathomable in nature and supernatural in appearance. Using the story of the legend of Sioux Lookout to relay some of the best known myths and legends of the local Anishinaabe, Author-Illustrator Shawn Richter and painter Francesca Zambon create a rich, exciting tapestry which can be enjoyed by fans of historical fantasy from 7 to 77.


          This 180 page graphic novel tells the story of the young boy who escapes the Sioux devastation of his village and a hunter and maiden who rescue him. The boy is brought to their village and with his warning in mind, the Elders decide to flee the oncoming Sioux, in hopes of escaping a similar fate. During their journey they encounter Spirits and other supernatural creatures, talking animals and even hear the voice of their creator. There are many lessons to be learned about how to live in the world and what it means to walk a path that will engender the qualities that any Anishinaabe should aspire to: Wisdom, Courage, Humility, Truth, Honesty, Respect and Love.


          Become a supporter of THE LEGEND OF THE SUNSET PEOPLE and earn wonderful rewards including but not limited to:


  • access to the behind the scenes workblog, with sneak peeks at production art and the development of the story
  • limited edition prints, t-shirts and sketches
  • original art from the graphic novel

          Be a part of history, as the legend of Sioux Lookout is presented to a global audience for the first time in Graphic Novel form! This project is not only important to the town and northern region, but will also offer First Nations youth the opportunity to see people like themselves as part of an epic myth...  that just may have happened!

story:
Hello! (and, for some of you, "Welcome back!") After the success of our crowdfunding project last year to get our "infinity issue" of "The Many Worlds of Daniel Kensington" Steampunk comic off of the ground, we're back (with an even BIGGER fan-base) to get the ongoing series off the ground. So far, TWO different printings of the Infinity Issue have been printed to handle the orders, so we're very optimistic about starting this ongoing comic!

What We Need & What You Get

I am projecting a need for $1800 to handle the cost of paying the artist, inker, letterer, and cover artist for the initial creation of the comic. After that, costs will move into the realm of manufacturing/printing/shipping.

PERKS! PERKS! PERKS!
Your contribution to this campaign comes with a variety of "add-ons" for you!
(IMPORTANT: if you use PayPal, be SURE to pay using "pay for goods/services" and NOT "send money to a friend")

$25 donation: At this level, you will be listed in the credits of the comic (as seen in the video) as a contributor to the comic. Yes, that's right: YOU will have your name in print (forever) in the pages of an actual comic book!
$50 donation: in addition to being given credit in the comic, you will receive a free, autographed issue of the comic (shipping/handling included)!
$100 donation: in addition to the credit and the free issue, if this continues as an ongoing series, we will write YOU into the comic as a character in an upcoming issue (described in more detail in the video)! That's right: you get to see yourself interacting with our heroes!

By all means, don't feel as if you are locked into JUST these three numbers. If you want to donate $35? That's great. If you want to go "whole hog" and donate, let's say, $250? Well, that's even better!

The Impact

Comics have been changing over recent years. No longer are they the "capes & tights" that many of you remember. Nowadays, sequential art is used like any other medium: to tell stories! Crimes, mysteries, revenge, love, betrayal...ANY story can be told this way! Now, YOU can help this medium expand by one more book! I've been reading comics for over 35 years now and this,combined with my love of film and teaching a Film Appreciation class, has enabled me to delve into the creative process needed to formulate original stories.

Risks & Challenges

Since this is my second crowdfunding project, I learned a few things from my first go-around and am prepared to meet this one head-on. Between my personal Facebook page, the Facebook page for the comic (www.facebook.com/daniel.kensington.96), and the Twitter page for the comic (@DKensington2013), I am constantly keeping the public up-to-date with the progress of the comic and even a look at some sneak-peeks of the interior art before it gets published!

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to help financially? That's ok. If possible, spread the word about it! Post on Facebook and/or Twitter. Share the link for this site. Let everyone know about us and what they can do to make this comic a reality!
