story:
Let's re-invent the Comic book "page"

Hi!
I'm Clyde DeSouza, author of the hard sci-fi novel Memories with Maya, picked by Penguin|Randomhouse for a March 2015 print release, after the novel's successful debut on Amazon.
The novel has been reviewed favorably on high profile sites such as iO9.com and Mashable and made it to the IEET's list of publications, sharing space with other noteworthy sci-fi novels.

But... This is about the 360 Motion Comic:

MAYA - the 360 motion novel/comic, is based on the screen-play adaptation of the book.
I'm excited to explore this uncharted land, the challenges, and rewards of visual storytelling in Virtual Reality.
The grammar and rules for this exciting medium have not yet been defined, and I'd like to reach out to you to make it happen, through MAYA.

MAYA the Story: 

MAYA is a story grounded in Hard science.

So, there are no Aliens, FTL, or Supermen and time-travel... oh wait! there is  a form of time travel, but only because it's backed up with science to show how.

The story shows how our lives are augmented by technology... from Long Distance Relationships (LDRs)  to what relationships will be like... even after death.  "Dirrogates" - Digital Surrogates interact with real people, in the real-world and human touch is simulated through haptics.

hard science backs all this, in the story.

(io9's review of Memories with Maya)

Getting back...

MAYA the motion novel will play back on devices such as Facebook's OCULUS RIFT, and the story will also play out IPADS / IPHONES / ANDROID devices as well as versions for various VR devices such as Sony's Morpheus and Samsung's Gear VR

(above: The Durovis Dive. Immersive VR for cellphones)

The hardware is not important... what is important is content, for this new medium of visual storytelling!

Why should you care?

  • After these devices come to market, then what? The content, mostly, will be games. Wouldn't it be great to be one of the first people involved in creating a new story medium that generations will look back to?

  • IT'S LIKE RE-INVENTING CINEMA!  Great stuff to tell your grandchildren some day!

  • There's an undeniably warm fuzziness that goes with doing something new and exciting in technology. If you've never experienced it before, or if you want to again... swallow the VR pill and jump right in!

  • The perks - Yes, there's hard candy for you! Look at the perks on the sidebar.
Most importantly, it is about being part of a collaborative effort to define a new language for visual storytelling. 
By donating to the project, it allows me the freedom to investigate more... to hire artists and programmers to make real... the ideas I've been toying with in my head.

Visual Storytelling ideas such as...

Interactivity - If you look at the main video again, you'll notice the scene starts with a dark room and Maya gazing out the window. 
This scene will have music and her thoughts voiced out... The rest of the room is dark, just as the Story-teller or, "Director" intends it.. However: 
If you turn your head (wearing the oculus rift) or turn your iphone/ipad, the lights switch on, allowing you to explore the room.
Depth of field - 
This is another technique i'm exploring and there are challenges to be overcome in doing it in Stereoscopic 3D and on a full 360 sphere. 
But - with your contribution and involvement, I can explore these by paying programmers and artists to bring these ideas to life and thus create a part of the language for immersive 360 motion novels.
These are just two "tools",., there will be more, as the novel get's done.
Projected Finish Date:  December this year - 2014.

An example scene from Chapter 5:  as proof of concept, is below. This is not what a finished page of the motion comic will be, It was stitched together from 14 renderings.  
Going forward, it won't be a practical way to create every "page" of the Motion novel this way, that's why I've chosen a Game Engine for the final product.

Click the image to give it a spin. Google's Chrome is best. (it won't work properly in IE and Firefox) On Ipads/Iphones/andoids, the gyro allows you to look around.

(or, enable Gyro on your iphone/android and click here: Maya360 room)

Demo Scene for the Oculus Rift:

Check the updates Tab at the top of this page for download links to PC and MAC versions of a demo scene.
For those without an Oculus Rift, the video below is a live stream grab while the Oculus was being worn:


More on the Tech...

The story features real world locations from diverse cities -- Mumbai, India, to Singapore and Dubai.

One location featured in the story is Study Street in Mumbai, India. 

This location will need to be captured in stereoscopic 3D and full 360. The inclusion of "Study street" in the story serves a real world purpose - To inspire tech companies to look at how technology can help the under-privileged. Read about Study Street on the Novel's website.

    Risks & Challenges

    Only a handful of companies... if indeed there are a handful, might be exploring this new medium of visual storytelling, and certainly none I know of are working on a 360 Motion Novel/comic.

    Challenges will be in capturing Stereoscopic 3D 360 images of real-world locations that will form the background or "set" as the story plays out.

    My experience in Stereoscopic 3D allows me to tackle these challenges confidently.

    I should mention, my non fiction book "THINK in 3D" has been peer reviewed by some of the best 3D film-makers out there... from the 3D director of the movie "HUGO" to movies such as "Wrath of the Titans"

    Some of the reviews are on Amazon: "Think in 3D"

    When it comes to contributing to the language of 3D, terminology I've coined in 3D film-making have made their way into the 3D Dictionary published by Technicolor. 



    Alright... but what about the PERKS!!

    Yes the perks... There's interesting ways to be involved and get something back for your faith in the project. 

    Please do pick one (or more) on the sidebar and let's make MAYA - the 360 motion comic!

    Some of you might like the project but can't contribute. You could still be a part of the project:

    • Tweet the project - talk to your gamer friends!
    • Writers aren't social creatures, but I'm sure your friends list is huge on Facebook, Google+ and other sites. Please use Indiegogo's share tools and spread the word!
    • Here's the indigogo address for Maya: http://igg.me/at/maya360

    I will be grateful for this gesture.
story_txt:
Let's re-invent the Comic book "page"
Hi!
I'm Clyde DeSouza, author of the hard sci-fi novel Memories with Maya, picked by Penguin|Randomhouse for a March 2015 print release, after the novel's successful debut on Amazon.The novel has been reviewed favorably on high profile sites such as iO9.com and Mashable and made it to the IEET's list of publications, sharing space with other noteworthy sci-fi novels.
But... This is about the 360 Motion Comic:
MAYA - the 360 motion novel/comic, is based on the screen-play adaptation of the book.
I'm excited to explore this uncharted land, the challenges, and rewards of visual storytelling in Virtual Reality.
The grammar and rules for this exciting medium have not yet been defined, and I'd like to reach out to you to make it happen, through MAYA.


MAYA the Story: 

MAYA is a story grounded in Hard science.
So, there are no Aliens, FTL, or Supermen and time-travel... oh wait! there is  a form of time travel, but only because it's backed up with science to show how.
The story shows how our lives are augmented by technology... from Long Distance Relationships (LDRs)  to what relationships will be like... even after death.  "Dirrogates" - Digital Surrogates interact with real people, in the real-world and human touch is simulated through haptics.
hard science backs all this, in the story.

(io9's review of Memories with Maya)
Getting back...
MAYA the motion novel will play back on devices such as Facebook's OCULUS RIFT, and the story will also play out IPADS / IPHONES / ANDROID devices as well as versions for various VR devices such as Sony's Morpheus and Samsung's Gear VR

Depth of field - 

This is another technique i'm exploring and there are challenges to be overcome in doing it in Stereoscopic 3D and on a full 360 sphere. 
But - with your contribution and involvement, I can explore these by paying programmers and artists to bring these ideas to life and thus create a part of the language for immersive 360 motion novels.These are just two "tools",., there will be more, as the novel get's done.

Projected Finish Date:  December this year - 2014.

An example scene from Chapter 5:  as proof of concept, is below. This is not what a finished page of the motion comic will be, It was stitched together from 14 renderings.  Going forward, it won't be a practical way to create every "page" of the Motion novel this way, that's why I've chosen a Game Engine for the final product.


Click the image to give it a spin. Google's Chrome is best. (it won't work properly in IE and Firefox) On Ipads/Iphones/andoids, the gyro allows you to look around.

(or, enable Gyro on your iphone/android and click here: Maya360 room)
Demo Scene for the Oculus Rift:

Check the updates Tab at the top of this page for download links to PC and MAC versions of a demo scene.For those without an Oculus Rift, the video below is a live stream grab while the Oculus was being worn:

This location will need to be captured in stereoscopic 3D and full 360. The inclusion of "Study street" in the story serves a real world purpose - To inspire tech companies to look at how technology can help the under-privileged. Read about Study Street on the Novel's website.

My experience in Stereoscopic 3D allows me to tackle these challenges confidently.

Alright... but what about the PERKS!!
Yes the perks... There's interesting ways to be involved and get something back for your faith in the project. 
Please do pick one (or more) on the sidebar and let's make MAYA - the 360 motion comic!
 Some of you might like the project but can't contribute. You could still be a part of the project: 
Tweet the project - talk to your gamer friends! Writers aren't social creatures, but I'm sure your friends list is huge on Facebook, Google+ and other sites. Please use Indiegogo's share tools and spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Damien Dickerson aka Skyline19. I'm a rising artist trying to become know for my style. What I'm trying to do is make a comic of two characters from the show My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. Not only that, I also like to be a better artist and deliver the best people has ever seen. I don't really have job and can't have a lot of funds at times so it pretty tough for me.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need is at least $1500. It will go to thinga like digital art software, hardware, and things that will make work more effecient and easier. Now for the perks, it may be a commission of your OC or a print of anything in my DA gallary or both.

 

The Impact

Why am I doing this? I want to make wonder for art not only for the brony community and other communites, but for myself as well. I want to become a better artist for you guys.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but short on cash, you can share this for people see ether on DeviantArt or Tumblr

story:
OLD MAN III

This comic picks up shortly after the end of issue 2. After having gone through the horde and having dealt with a Bishop (a grotesque powerful brute monster), the old man and his crew struggle on in the pursuit of a large beast. Its tracks take them through a charred forrest, to a house. Its a place they can rest but ultimately discover a darker humanity and a cost taxed by the world they now live in. 

This campaign is being put out there to hopefully get this comic in print and to share more of my art through Indiegogo exclusive rewards. Crowdfunding in general has been great for getting people involved and helping create projects that otherwise stall out -and I definitely need the help getting this one done and out there. Im keeping the budget low because the comic is 70% finished and will be done by the end of the campaign. Mostly I'm just rendering and hoping to make it look as good as I'm possible of doing.  So the production is mostly done. Hopefully, it does meet its goal and I have stretch goals planned to make it even sweeter. Stretch goals would include trading cards and possibly a process sketchbook.

story:
*******Shipping Notice*******

Shipping for physical rewards will be collected during the survey AFTER the campaign is complete. We are doing this in order to charge you the lowest amount for shipping possible based on your unique reward. For an estimation of how much shipping will be, please check the shipping breakdown below!

 

 

This campaign Stretch Goals are based on the combined funds between Indiegogo and Kickstarter.

A year ago, we launched the Kickstarter to print the first issue of Temerity: Sayonara, our creator-owned scifi comic, and it was a smashing success! We funded in less than 12 hours and unlocked a number of stretch goals with over 500 backers. In 4 weeks we made over 200% our funding goal. Since then we’ve been posting the comic online for free on Webtoons. In a matter of months Temerity gained a readership of over 50,000 with over a score over 9.6! The reader response has been incredible, and we are excited to finally launch the highly anticipated second issue!

This project aims to fund the printing and shipping of the scifi comic: Temerity #2: The Runaway. This issue features 26 full color comic pages and will have a page dedicated to the backers of the project for making this book a reality. As we grow in funding, we will add content to this book including more guest art, extra side comics, and concept art.

Missed out on issue #1? No worries, you can grab both issues during this campaign!

The Story:

The Daigen Project altered Taeru’s DNA when he was just four years old. Now he’s an 18-year-old super-soldier with formidable skills and hardly any experience with the outside world. When his best friend, Sky, suddenly disappears with no explanation, Taeru refuses to believe she’s actually dead. During an unexpected attack from the Enlightenment, Taeru uses the attack as a diversion to escape and search for her.

But escape is not that easy. He finds himself aboard the Temerity and must now prove his worth to stay. But Captain Edith McKarmick knows harboring a Daigen could lead to the death of her crew. Will she turn him back over to the Daigen Project for a reward? Or risk being found by the Enlightenment, a radical organization that hunts down and kills his kind and anyone who protects them?

Come enjoy the ride as comic artist Chad Hardin and writer Jemma M. Young combine their talents to tell one incredible story of mechas, brain hacking, and terrible pun t-shirts. The result is a high-adventure intergalactic romp with a heavy dose of humor and a whole lot of temerity.

The art is by famed DC artist Chad Hardin - whose first real love was mecha, anime, and spaceships! Unlike his previously published works with crazy tight deadlines, Chad has taken his time to create a comic unlike anything you’ve ever seen. Every panel is a work of art taken to the next level by our fantastic colorist, Enrica Eren Angiolini.

Here’s a challenge: Find a single panel in this comic that doesn’t look like a masterpiece. This won’t be a comic where you simply read the word bubbles and then place in a stack of other comics to be forgotten. Or CGCed in a piece of plastic to never be opened and crossing your fingers it’ll be worth something someday. This is a comic you’ll want to open and soak in the art and story over and over again.

If your still skeptical after reading all of that, go read the comic for yourself! You can read it free on Webtoons HERE.

During this campaign we will be offering several variant covers by other artists! These will all be available as add-ons during this campaign.

We’ve got a handful of rewards for you to pick from that have copies of Temerity and some of our extras. Once you select your reward, you can then add on some of our amazing extras.

We are offering all kinds of amazing add-ons during this campaign, including the first issue of Temerity if you missed out on our previous campaign! Some of these add-ons are unlimited but some are not! We’ll be adding new add-ons during the campaign as stretch goals unlock so be sure to keep an eye out for new rewards!

As we hit higher funding amounts, we will be unlocking stretch goals! These stretch goals include free extras such updates to the book, bonus goodies in your package like stickers and pins, or unlock extra add-on merch that you can add to your reward at a discounted price. Stretch goals are based on the total funding between Kickstarter and Indigogo!

Join CryptoComics to collect digital comics by creators like Jemma and Chad, follow them, hang out, and participate in events and giveaways. Read the comics you love and discover new, original stories with a community of other passionate readers and fans.

 Here’s a general breakdown on how much you can expect to pay for shipping based on what rewards and add-ons you pledge for. The base reward on the standard issue starts at 8 ounces including the shipping materials.

International Shipments: Please make sure you are aware of your VAT tax, tariffs, and customs for your country! Every country is different so we can’t estimate how much these extra fees will cost. We also declare the full value of your shipment on the Customs forms. We will be shipping with USPS to cut down on handling fees from Fedex and UPS. 

Some of you may be asking yourself, “Why should I back this campaign when I can read the comic online for free?” While we do provide this comic for free, it’s something we can only work on during our free time. And our free time is pretty limited since we have to take on jobs that pay the bills! (Gotta feed our families or something like that!) When you pledge to this campaign, it’s helping support us as creators! If we can make enough on our campaign then we can use Temerity to pay the bills instead of something else! Which means that we can spend more time working on it and post updates more frequently with more content. Help turn our dream project into a sustainable one!

 Other Ways You Can Help

While we appreciate financial support, we understand that not everyone is in a place to donate money. But that’s not the only way you can support Temerity! Sharing our comic with friends and family is a great way to help. Follow us on social media such as Instagram and Twitter, and like, share, and commenting helps us get past gate-keeping algorithms and expand our reach. The more Temerity lovers there are out there, the more likely we are to hit our goals and create more content!

Thank you for checking out Temerity: The Runaway. It’s because of people like you that these sorts of projects get to become a reality! We hope that you will help make this book real and help us reach our goal of making this our full-time job!

Links:

Temerity on Webtoons and Instagram

Chad Hardin on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and Patreon.

Jemma M. Young on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and Patreon.

Enrica Eren Angiolini on Instagram, Twitter, Twitch, and ArtStation.

Risks and challenges

I have helped run and fulfill 11 successful Kickstarters including my own projects and projects for clients. So I'm familiar with how to run a campaign as well as how to fulfill them efficiently and in a timely manner. Of course, there can always be hiccups and delays along the way, and if they do happen I'll be sure to keep people updated here and on social media.

story:
Hello!  My name is Bill Coulombe, and I am a comic book writer.  In 2018, launched Kinetic, the story about a young man, Johnny,  who developed superpowers, and thought he could do a better job than his city's resident hero.

Johnny is able to create and manipulate kinetic energy.  He's the first person born with superpowers.  The city's current hero, The Ascender, was patrolling the skies in a metal suit (like Iron Man).  After Johnny's brother got hurt by a psychopath, and the Ascender chose not to intervene, or even help, Johnny decided that he could do a better job, and became KINETIC.

Well, after two years, eight issues, and thousands of books sold online and at conventions, he's beat the bad guy, mastered his powers, and got the girl.

NOW WHAT?!

Kinetic: Identities #1 picks up where the story left off.  When a villain from his past is up to his old tricks, it's up to Johnny to save the day!

But is Kinetic a match for the villains when this time, they're ready for him?!

If you are a card-carrying Kinetic VIP, welcome back!  But if this is your first time hearing about this series, don't worry, I've got you covered.  You don't have to have know anything to read and enjoy this issue, and I've also got plenty of catch-up tiers to get you up to speed.

I get emails, messages, and even mail to my PO Box all the time asking me when there will be more Kinetic. 

I'm happy to know the answer: RIGHT NOW.

There are even more awesome rewards further down the page, but here's a sneak peak at a couple of our reward tiers for backers:

 

At some of our higher tiers, we also have rare and exclusive rewards, such as Physical Scripts, and these Ultra-Limited Black and White Variants:

This is the first time Kinetic is being offered internationally, but also, ALL ORDERS SHIPPED IN THE USA HAVE FREE SHIPPING!

 

This book wouldn't be able to happen without the help of my wonderful creative team, and I am proud to call them collaborators and friends!

Since my very first time behind a booth at my first comic convention, Kinetic has built up a dedicated fanbase...

And a few reviewers, and industry professionals have had some nice things to say, too!

There's been a little hiatus since the last Kinetic book released.  We've had to deal with losing an artist and finding a replacement.  Thankfully, we found a wonderful talent in indie comic veteran Luis Rivera.  I met him at a convention, and hit it off immediately.  With Luis onboard, we could get started again.  I am proud to say that, except for Rafael, the creative team remains completely unchanged!

I just had to tell more of Kinetic's story.  Like so many of you, I've also fallen in love with the world of Velo City, and I knew Johnny's tale wasn't over yet.

This is my first Indiegogo campaign, and I want to keep it simple.  Since I began my selling comics, I've realized one thing: even with the best marketing in the world, reaching out with marketing on social media, email, and messaging, there are always going to be people who miss your booth in the convention hall, or don't see your website.  I want to give everyone a chance to check out Kinetic!  And Indiegogo's OnDemand is the way to do that!

 

Since last year, we've been running the gauntlet with 2020.  So why now?  Well, with so much going on in the world, the best way I feel that I can help is to continue offering up awesome comics to you.  A sense of normalcy is important in turbulent times, even if it's just a little getaway time away from the madness.

 

We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.

You pay premium prices for a premium product on Indiegogo, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:

These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.

And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?

I'll replace it free of charge.

Thank you for checking out this Indiegogo campaign!  Kinetic would not be possible without the support of the wonderful fans, and I appreciate you giving me the chance to make my dreams of becoming a comic book writer a reality!

Now, I'm going to ask you to look over our awesome reward tiers, find the one you like best, and let's get Kinetic: Identities #1 in YOUR hands!

became KINETIC.Well, after two years, eight issues, and thousands of books sold online and at conventions, he's beat the bad guy, mastered his powers, and got the girl.NOW WHAT?!Kinetic: Identities story:
"Scairy Tales" gets print!

Hello, my name is Gus Hardy and I'm a character in a comic strip called "Scairy Tales: the not so scary fairy tales!" by weirdo comics creator J.R. Mounts. Yeah, he spells 'scary' with an "i" so no one thinks these are horror comics but instead a combination word of 'scary tales' and 'fairy tales', comic made for the entire family!

To tell you a little about J.R., he's a regular geek guy with a regular job and everything. But when he's not being all regular, he's drawing comic books! Now if you love comic books as much as I do, then you know he's not exactly normal. His poor wife constantly wonders what's wrong with him when he geeks out over things like monsters and superheroes and other things that grown ups shouldn't like. Still, she loves the big lug and supports him at every comic con he appears at trying to let everybody know about us, his characters!

Indiegogo is giving J.R. the opportunity to help get us adventurous kids into to comic books! Sure, he draws them a lot but we haven't been professionally printed yet. You may know his other comic, "Fried Pickle Noir" which did very well here on Indiegogo and was actually his SECOND idea! Yep, that fried pickle Q Cumbersome was just supposed to be a comic WE were reading in "Scairy Tales". But the pickle took off and is all stuck up n' stuff now because HE's got the best looking books. Well, we kids wanna get even and show off ourselves too! Heck, we were first!

Anyway, for those of you who don't know, "Scairy Tales" is a family friendly comic strip about little kids in a town called Sunset who dress up all year as superheroes and monsters, get picked on a lot and then discover REAL monster kids in the next town called Moonrise! It's kinda like 'Calvin and Hobbes meets The Nightmare Before Christmas' because we get to meet weirdo monsters like the Snombies: reanimated snowmen that come back not for brains, but clothes!!! Plus there's other monster kids like my best pal Moses, Lad Scientist, Hazl the witch, Fubar the octo-chef and more!

Whadda we need?

Well, here's the deal, J.R. has an awesome professional printer that did a great job on his comics for "Fried Pickle Noir" and we wanna look every bit as good as the pickle! So, they're doing a special version of our comics like the old school comics collections just like 'Garfield' or 'Calvin and Hobbes'! It's gonna cost around $1000 to get a full run of our comic strip episodes into enough collections to sell inexpensively. The idea is to have something families can enjoy without selling the farm! Every cent donated here on Indiegogo will go into printing our "Scairy Tales" comics just like it did with the pickle!

For any donation, we've got some nice PERKS for ya! Some are as simple as a heartfelt "THANKS", some artwork for you or even as GRAND as making you into a Moonrise MONSTER of your very own!

If we reach our goal and beyond, it will still all go to printing even more of our comics!

When does is happen?

That's the coolest part.....this October marks the 5th YEAR of my comics!!! Yep, I started it all with a sketchbook in October 2010 doodling these kids, figuring out their world, how the monsters would fit in, what it would be called...everything! So it's only fitting for the anniversary to have something BIG happen like this, and YOU can be a part of history!

Why are these comics so important anyway?

Hi gang, J.R. Mounts, speaking for myself right now. Basically, Gus is me! I dream big and always have, just as little kids do. The economy is always suffering and that means we're all operating on shoestrings. That makes every cent in our homes important to us all. As an artist, being able to continue to bring joy and entertainment through the my comics means the world to me. It's what I feel I was put on this earth for. But even doing your passion means we all need a little help sometimes. That's where campaigns like this come in. Every donation makes YOU a part of this "Scairy Tales" world, and boy I can't wait to show everyone how much fun it's going to be!

Every comic convention I appear at, I'm lucky enough to touch the hearts and funny bones of anyone willing to give these characters a look whether they be kids or adults. Not only do they all like the idea, they want to see more. This is how I can give more to them. If my silly little comics a can bring a smile to someone who really needs it, that's what my purpose is all about. So far, "Fried Pickle Noir" has made a nice and funny impact at every convention I appear at and it's constantly growing little by little. Who knows where these comics can go if I can get into enough homes? I'm excited to see and I'd be honored if you'd be a part of that with me.

It's not about money all the time but faith and passion that you believe in something so strongly, you'll be doing it for no matter how long it takes and no matter what until you reach your goal.

So even if you can't afford to contribute, spread the word about this campaign and let the world know these comics are ready to LIVE!!! So email, 'share', 'like', twitter, pin, whisper and SHOUT about it because every little bit truly makes a big difference!

From every person I know, every geek I've met at cons and everyone I'm soon to meet, my thanks to you all.

Cheers,
J.R. Mounts
www.scairytalesnoir.com
